jobs.title: Spray-painter
jobs.description: Paintworks is looking for an experienced spray painter to join our team. Paintworks Limited is a family business that offers spray-painting services and durable coatings for joinery and cladding repairs, recolouring, powdercoat repairs, industrial and architectural painting. While our core business is on site spray painting, we are not just windows and doors. We do gates, garages, caravans, boats, letterboxes, lights, water features, signs and so much more from our Sydenham based workshop, equipped with spraybooth, drying room and mixing bank. With a background in automotive refinishing, we strive to achieve an invisible repair with a strong focus on quality. We work with leading aluminium joinery suppliers and construction companies as well as engineering and industrial manufacturers throughout Christchurch and the South Island. We pride ourselves on excellent customer service, product knowledge and application, communication and problem solving in a team environment, which is also why our customer base continues to grow and remain loyal to our business. This full-time role will be predominantly based in our workshop with occasional site work as required. The successful applicant will: Take responsibility for all aspects of spray-painting including preparation, mixing, colour matching, priming, cleaning, application, troubleshooting and buffing/polishingBe able to complete small dent repairsHave a minimum of 5 years experience in an automotive or industrial spray-painting roleBe able to plan your jobs from start to finish and organise your day efficientlyBe able to work both independently and part of a teamHave a positive attitude and a desire to learnBe able to interact with a wide range of people including clients, company representatives and the general publicUse and maintain tools and equipmentUse job management software to sufficiently record job informationBe able to work safely and follow and engage with health and safety guidelinesKeep a workshop clean and organisedBe able to read and understand technical and safety data sheetsPaintworks will offer the successful applicant: Full training of our products and systemsFull PPE, uniform and spray-painting equipmentA competitive wage for the right skillsetA friendly and supportive work environmentA respected position in the company where your contribution is valuedA forklift licence, Site Safe passport and any necessary qualifications to perform your jobThe successful applicant will have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa. For more information about Paintworks and what we are about, head to our website to get an overview of our business http://www.paintworks.nz Apply online for this role or contact Dan King for more information.

jobs.title: Operations Officer - Information Management
jobs.description: An Exciting Opportunity Awaits!Join our team as a Security Officer – Vault Librarian and Archive Officer and make a real impact in a trusted, secure and dynamic environment!ABOUT TIMGTIMG provides secure information management solutions for NZ businesses and government agencies. With 30+ years of experience, TIMG helps organizations manage, transform, and securely dispose of data. Trusted by 15,000+ clients across Australasia, TIMG is proudly NZ-owned and backed by Freightways.ABOUT THE ROLEWe have an exciting opportunity for a detail-oriented and reliable Vault Librarian/Archive Officer to join our team. In this varied role, you will be responsible for managing and processing client media in a highly secure environment and supporting the Archive team ensuring the secure management, handling and storing of sensitive materials, maintaining safety and contributing to operational efficiency.KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:The role’s responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Media and Archive Management – Pick, check out, and store media and archive securely using S@FE.Verification & Accuracy – Ensure barcode verification and 100% database accuracy.Client Communication – Respond to customer inquiries and provide professional support.Operational Support – Maintain vault and Archive records, assist with retrievals, and ensure correct storage.Secure Handling – Follow strict compliance and security protocols for media and Archive transport and storage.Cross Training – Support our Imaging department as required.A full clean driver’s licence is a requirement, as you will need to be confident driving a security van. ABOUT YOUYou have a keen eye for accuracy and attention to detail.You’re organized and comfortable handling secure and sensitive information.Your someone adaptable who can step into various roles as needed, helping the team with anything from deliveries to operational support.You’re confident working with systems, databases, and inventory processes.You take pride in maintaining a safe, secure, and professional work environment.You enjoy working independently while also being part of a high-performing team.You can lift and move Archive boxes up to 15kg and your comfortable working at height.WHAT'S ON OFFERThis is an exciting opportunity to join a motivated and secure environment within a company that values excellence and accuracy. We offer:A stable, secure workplace with long-term career opportunities.Access to discounted medical insurance and Employee Assistance Programme (EAP).Full training provided – we’ll set you up for success!COME AND JOIN US!We are a high-security company, and successful applicants must pass a drug/alcohol test and police check. Candidates must have the legal right to work in New Zealand (citizenship or residency). Unfortunately, we are unable to offer visa sponsorship for this role.Please note applications will be reviewed after 12 January 2026If you have the skills and attention to detail we’re looking for, apply online today – we’d love to hear from you!

jobs.title: Senior Associate - Banking and Finance
jobs.description: The opportunityJoin Buddle Findlay’s Christchurch banking and financial services team. The team advises a broad range of financial institutions - including New Zealand and offshore banks, building societies, credit unions, non‑bank lenders and deposit takers, insurers, brokers, remittance providers, issuers of FMCA products, and local authorities. Our team provides specialist advice across regulatory compliance and prudential supervision, financial markets and conduct, financial advisers and service provider regulation, consumer credit, personal property securities and anti‑money laundering.The team is led in Christchurch by banking and finance partner Jan Etwell, who has deep experience in financial regulatory compliance and transactional banking. The team specialises in consumer credit, financial adviser and financial service provider regulation and financial markets regulation including product disclosure and compliance.Why Buddle Findlay?Work on high‑profile, technically complex banking and finance matters across New Zealand and offshore clients, supported by market‑leading partners and opportunities to build specialist expertiseStrong focus on professional development and career progression, including mentoring, training, secondments and support for continuing legal education and NZ professional obligationsA team that backs you – you will work closely with colleagues across Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch, in a culture where your ideas are valued and your growth is a priority. What you will doWe are seeking a commercially minded Senior Associate to join Jan and her team in Christchurch. You will work on a mix of financial regulatory compliance and transactional banking matters. This will include:Advising on the Financial Markets Conduct Act (FMCA), Credit Contracts and Consumer Finance Act (CCCFA), Anti‑Money Laundering and Countering Financing of Terrorism Act (AML/CFT), Personal Property Securities Act (PPSA), Financial Service Providers (Registration and Dispute Resolution) Act (FSPA), Non-bank Deposit Takers Act (NBDT) and other relevant regimesAdvising banks, non‑bank lenders, insurers and other financial institutions on regulatory compliance, governance and prudential requirements under the Reserve Bank frameworkDrafting and reviewing product disclosure, compliance programmes, financial adviser and service provider documentation, and regulatory submissionsActing on secured lending transactions, PPSR filings and intercreditor arrangements.Supporting clients with conduct and disclosure obligations, consumer credit issues and corporate compliance and governance matters.What matters to usYou will have a genuine commitment to delivering high-quality, client-focused advice, a collaborative approach to working with clients and colleagues.You will also have: Significant banking and finance experience - ideally 6+ years’ PQE with a mix of transactional and regulatory compliance experienceDemonstrable knowledge of NZ regulatory regimes (RBNZ prudential framework, FMCA, CCCFA, AML/CFT, PPSA, FSPR)Strong drafting, advisory and client management skills, commercial judgement and the ability to run matters independently and mentor junior lawyersComfortable working collaboratively across teams and with partners to deliver technically excellent and commercially practical advice.What we offerA career with us gives you the opportunity to work with a wide range of people that are motivated to help shape the future of business in New Zealand. We offer a range of benefits that enable you to be the best you can be, such as opportunities for ongoing professional and personal development, flexible working practices, health insurance benefits, social events, charity initiatives and wellbeing-focused programmes.To applyYou don’t need to tick every box – a willingness to learn and develop is also important to us. If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you. Please send your CV and a short cover letter to our talent attraction specialist jill.mclisky@buddlefindlay.comWe look forward to hearing from you about your aspirations as a commercial lawyer and we hope that could be at Buddle Findlay.Together we grow, Ka tipu tahi tatau.

jobs.title: Police Officer
jobs.description: Working at Police (who we are) New Zealand Police delivers services that ensure people can be safe and feel safe in their homes, on our roads and in their communities. Police operate 24 hours a day in a complex environment actively targeting and preventing crime and harm. With around 16,000 staff, we work from urban and rural stations and larger policing hubs.We operate on land, sea and in the air, and respond to more than 1.2 million events per year – answering more than 992,000 111 calls and over 650,000 non-emergency calls. We’re working towards specific goals and targets that highlight our intent to work collaboratively with iwi and communities, other government sectors and business partners to deliver ‘Our Business’ and achieve long-term changeValues: Our Values provide a guide to the way New Zealand Police work, operate, and make decisions, and reflect what is important to us and the communities we serve. Professionalism: Taking pride in representing New Zealand Police and making a difference in the communities we serveRespect: Treating everyone with dignity, upholding their individual rights and honouring their freedomsIntegrity: Being honest and upholding excellent ethical standards Commitment to Māori and The Treaty: Acting in good faith of, and respecting the principles of Te Tiriti O Waitangi – partnership, protection, and participationEmpathy: Seeking understanding of, and considering the experience and perspective of those New Zealand Police serve Valuing Diversity: Recognising the value different perspectives and experiences bring to making us better at what we do Position Overview (where you’ll be working) The purpose of the District Operations is to deliver Our Business. To support the delivery of District outcomes the General Duties Constable will maintain and enhance public security and welfare through response to incidents requiring police attention and the conduct of relevant enquiries. The purpose of leadership in this role is to deliver (or enable others to deliver) Our Business. Responsibilities (what you’ll be doing) The Constable – General Duties will:1. Be safe and feel safe Understand the hazards in your work area and eliminate or minimise the associated risk.Report all accidents, incidents and near misses in MyPolice in a timely fashionActively participate in Wellness and Safety initiatives and training 2. Service delivery Patrolling Undertakes patrols and responds to situations to enforce law and/or maintain public order by the following: Undertaking patrolling in accordance with organisational requirements, principles of non-discrimination and supervisors instructions in a manner that optimises achievement of the patrols goals. Correctly assessing emergent situations and taking appropriate action Establishing, maintaining and utilising knowledge of the local patrol area Responding to incidents, taskings and requests for assistance in accordance with accepted operational procedures Utilising situational problem-solving techniques to resolve issues Assessing situational behaviour of people and determining/implementing appropriate reaction/response strategies Providing first response control/command and/or co-ordination at incidents Conduct Initial Police Investigation Assesses and preserves crime/incident scenes, and assists in the investigation process when required Collects and analyses information relevant to investigations Identifies, seizes, processes and manages exhibits in accordance with legislative and administrative processes Considers and utilises all organisational avenues of inquiry and investigative procedures in order to identify subjects and persons Conducts searches of persons, property and vehicles with due regard to lawful authority and organisational procedures. Decisions to caution, report or arrest are made at the discretion of the officer and conveyed to the person(s) concerned in accordance with organisational and legal guidelines. Affords rights to suspects and victims of crime by treating them in a fair, equitable and non-discriminatory manner.Gathers, Collates and Records Information Collects and records information relevant to police issues in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and procedures Takes comprehensive statements that contain all details relevant to the matter being examined and are in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and procedures Completes the full range of complaint correspondence in a concise and timely manner Completes arrest files, not guilty prosecution files, and other correspondence including notifying of complainants, witnesses and dealing with exhibits Conducts and records interviews in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and procedures Carries out access, storage and retrieval of information in accordance with jurisdictional laws and organisational Codes of Ethics/Best Practice. Uses interview and evidence recording equipment in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and proceduresIdentifies and utilises communication linkages within the organisation to exchange/share informationProcesses and provides for persons in police care or custody Ensures persons in care or custody are provided for, processed and escorted/transported in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and procedures Fosters a positive organisational image in the community Acts on opportunities to explain and promote the organisations activities in order to encourage community recognition and support Represents the organisations position on particular issues in a way which acknowledges community concerns and promotes community awareness Advises and involves the community in public safety activities Contributes to the objectives of the Safety Administration Programme S(A)P and the National Road Safety Plan Provides an initial police response to traffic crash events and emergencies Assists in reducing the number of road deaths and enhances the safe and efficient use of roads through: Patrol duties directed at compliance of general traffic law and the promotion of safe driving practices Targeting of alcohol / drug impaired road users Speed control enforcement Promoting and enforcing the use of vehicle restraint devices Providing peak traffic flow supervision Enforcing vehicle maintenance regulations through vehicle checks Issuing Traffic and Infringement Offence Notices Provides assistance/support for: Accident investigation officers Summons service CARD centre Judicial Processing Prepares and manages evidence, witnesses and offenders for the relevant judicial authority in accordance with jurisdictional laws and organisational policies and procedures by: Managing witnesses Monitoring offenders Liaising with and assisting prosecutions section Undertaking post-court procedures 3. Personal professional performance Effectively manages personal professional performance in order to ensure public confidence in the police service by: Modelling high standards of personal performance, ethics and integrity Reviewing and monitoring personal performance Developing and maintaining ongoing personal competence Assisting and supporting other personnel Maintaining personal physical and emotional health. 4. Team work Works effectively as a member of a team within the community Co-operates and works with other members of the section in order to achieve team goals Establishes and supports open honest and constructive relationships with colleagues Takes a constructive approach to team efforts and supports other team members where possible Customer service Ensures all service requests and complaints are met with a professional, customer focused and timely response. Assesses the changing needs of the customer and implements strategies to respond to them. Ensures services are delivered promptly, impartially and safely. Ensures that Policing services are delivered with a quality customer service and Māori Responsiveness focus. Fosters an atmosphere where being responsive to customer needs is a priority. Provides services designed to target general public attitudinal and behavioural change for the purposes of producing safer communities. Provides high quality policing services in conjunction with other members of the team. Ensures that service delivery conduct and performance integrate both Treaty principles and Māori values and principles consistent with the spirit and substance of the Treaty of Waitangi. 6. Relationship management Creates and maintains networks to ensure local examples of best practice are identified and communicated so that duplication of effort is avoided. Establishes and maintains a positive working relationship with other members of police including members of Dog Section, the Criminal Intelligence Branch, Scene of Crime Officers, Police Photographers, Training Service Centre staff and Prosecutions Service Centre staff. Establishes and maintains a positive working relationship with members of the community and other Government and service agencies such as CYPS, WINZ, Victim Support organisations, cultural groups, local government, churches, schools, neighbourhood watch, and community service groups such as Lions, Rotary and Zonta. 7. Universal Responsibilities All employees of New Zealand Police are expected to: Adhere to New Zealand Police standards of integrity and conduct. Comply with legislative and statutory requirements within area of expertise, including employment and privacylegislation. Model the New Zealand Police Values – Professionalism, Respect, Integrity, Commitment to Māori and The Treaty, Empathy and Valuing Diversity. Respect diversity and demonstrate inclusiveness. Understand the hazards in their work area and eliminate or minimise the associated risk. Report all accidents, incidents and near misses in MyPolice in a timely fashion. Actively participate in Wellness and Safety initiatives and training. Perform other duties and participate in projects as required. Additional information: (what you need to know) Required Qualifications For selection purposes, candidate suitability will be considered in relation to: potential to perform well in the position, given a reasonable period of time for familiarisation and/or training. personal attributes and temperament relevant to the position. general health which will allow for the performance of all duties and functions of the position (for constabulary employees a current PCT is an indicator of general health). Pre-Employment Checks Core children’s worker, safety check required. Drug and alcohol testing, as required, according to guidelines.

jobs.title: Police Officer
jobs.description: Working at Police (who we are) New Zealand Police delivers services that ensure people can be safe and feel safe in their homes, on our roads and in their communities. Police operate 24 hours a day in a complex environment actively targeting and preventing crime and harm. With around 16,000 staff, we work from urban and rural stations and larger policing hubs.We operate on land, sea and in the air, and respond to more than 1.2 million events per year – answering more than 992,000 111 calls and over 650,000 non-emergency calls. We’re working towards specific goals and targets that highlight our intent to work collaboratively with iwi and communities, other government sectors and business partners to deliver ‘Our Business’ and achieve long-term changeValues: Our Values provide a guide to the way New Zealand Police work, operate, and make decisions, and reflect what is important to us and the communities we serve. Professionalism: Taking pride in representing New Zealand Police and making a difference in the communities we serveRespect: Treating everyone with dignity, upholding their individual rights and honouring their freedomsIntegrity: Being honest and upholding excellent ethical standards Commitment to Māori and The Treaty: Acting in good faith of, and respecting the principles of Te Tiriti O Waitangi – partnership, protection, and participationEmpathy: Seeking understanding of, and considering the experience and perspective of those New Zealand Police serve Valuing Diversity: Recognising the value different perspectives and experiences bring to making us better at what we do Position Overview (where you’ll be working) The purpose of the District Operations is to deliver Our Business. To support the delivery of District outcomes the General Duties Constable will maintain and enhance public security and welfare through response to incidents requiring police attention and the conduct of relevant enquiries. The purpose of leadership in this role is to deliver (or enable others to deliver) Our Business. Responsibilities (what you’ll be doing) The Constable – General Duties will:1. Be safe and feel safe Understand the hazards in your work area and eliminate or minimise the associated risk.Report all accidents, incidents and near misses in MyPolice in a timely fashionActively participate in Wellness and Safety initiatives and training 2. Service delivery Patrolling Undertakes patrols and responds to situations to enforce law and/or maintain public order by the following: Undertaking patrolling in accordance with organisational requirements, principles of non-discrimination and supervisors instructions in a manner that optimises achievement of the patrols goals. Correctly assessing emergent situations and taking appropriate action Establishing, maintaining and utilising knowledge of the local patrol area Responding to incidents, taskings and requests for assistance in accordance with accepted operational procedures Utilising situational problem-solving techniques to resolve issues Assessing situational behaviour of people and determining/implementing appropriate reaction/response strategies Providing first response control/command and/or co-ordination at incidents Conduct Initial Police Investigation Assesses and preserves crime/incident scenes, and assists in the investigation process when required Collects and analyses information relevant to investigations Identifies, seizes, processes and manages exhibits in accordance with legislative and administrative processes Considers and utilises all organisational avenues of inquiry and investigative procedures in order to identify subjects and persons Conducts searches of persons, property and vehicles with due regard to lawful authority and organisational procedures. Decisions to caution, report or arrest are made at the discretion of the officer and conveyed to the person(s) concerned in accordance with organisational and legal guidelines. Affords rights to suspects and victims of crime by treating them in a fair, equitable and non-discriminatory manner.Gathers, Collates and Records Information Collects and records information relevant to police issues in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and procedures Takes comprehensive statements that contain all details relevant to the matter being examined and are in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and procedures Completes the full range of complaint correspondence in a concise and timely manner Completes arrest files, not guilty prosecution files, and other correspondence including notifying of complainants, witnesses and dealing with exhibits Conducts and records interviews in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and procedures Carries out access, storage and retrieval of information in accordance with jurisdictional laws and organisational Codes of Ethics/Best Practice. Uses interview and evidence recording equipment in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and proceduresIdentifies and utilises communication linkages within the organisation to exchange/share informationProcesses and provides for persons in police care or custody Ensures persons in care or custody are provided for, processed and escorted/transported in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and procedures Fosters a positive organisational image in the community Acts on opportunities to explain and promote the organisations activities in order to encourage community recognition and support Represents the organisations position on particular issues in a way which acknowledges community concerns and promotes community awareness Advises and involves the community in public safety activities Contributes to the objectives of the Safety Administration Programme S(A)P and the National Road Safety Plan Provides an initial police response to traffic crash events and emergencies Assists in reducing the number of road deaths and enhances the safe and efficient use of roads through: Patrol duties directed at compliance of general traffic law and the promotion of safe driving practices Targeting of alcohol / drug impaired road users Speed control enforcement Promoting and enforcing the use of vehicle restraint devices Providing peak traffic flow supervision Enforcing vehicle maintenance regulations through vehicle checks Issuing Traffic and Infringement Offence Notices Provides assistance/support for: Accident investigation officers Summons service CARD centre Judicial Processing Prepares and manages evidence, witnesses and offenders for the relevant judicial authority in accordance with jurisdictional laws and organisational policies and procedures by: Managing witnesses Monitoring offenders Liaising with and assisting prosecutions section Undertaking post-court procedures 3. Personal professional performance Effectively manages personal professional performance in order to ensure public confidence in the police service by: Modelling high standards of personal performance, ethics and integrity Reviewing and monitoring personal performance Developing and maintaining ongoing personal competence Assisting and supporting other personnel Maintaining personal physical and emotional health. 4. Team work Works effectively as a member of a team within the community Co-operates and works with other members of the section in order to achieve team goals Establishes and supports open honest and constructive relationships with colleagues Takes a constructive approach to team efforts and supports other team members where possible Customer service Ensures all service requests and complaints are met with a professional, customer focused and timely response. Assesses the changing needs of the customer and implements strategies to respond to them. Ensures services are delivered promptly, impartially and safely. Ensures that Policing services are delivered with a quality customer service and Māori Responsiveness focus. Fosters an atmosphere where being responsive to customer needs is a priority. Provides services designed to target general public attitudinal and behavioural change for the purposes of producing safer communities. Provides high quality policing services in conjunction with other members of the team. Ensures that service delivery conduct and performance integrate both Treaty principles and Māori values and principles consistent with the spirit and substance of the Treaty of Waitangi. 6. Relationship management Creates and maintains networks to ensure local examples of best practice are identified and communicated so that duplication of effort is avoided. Establishes and maintains a positive working relationship with other members of police including members of Dog Section, the Criminal Intelligence Branch, Scene of Crime Officers, Police Photographers, Training Service Centre staff and Prosecutions Service Centre staff. Establishes and maintains a positive working relationship with members of the community and other Government and service agencies such as CYPS, WINZ, Victim Support organisations, cultural groups, local government, churches, schools, neighbourhood watch, and community service groups such as Lions, Rotary and Zonta. 7. Universal Responsibilities All employees of New Zealand Police are expected to: Adhere to New Zealand Police standards of integrity and conduct. Comply with legislative and statutory requirements within area of expertise, including employment and privacylegislation. Model the New Zealand Police Values – Professionalism, Respect, Integrity, Commitment to Māori and The Treaty, Empathy and Valuing Diversity. Respect diversity and demonstrate inclusiveness. Understand the hazards in their work area and eliminate or minimise the associated risk. Report all accidents, incidents and near misses in MyPolice in a timely fashion. Actively participate in Wellness and Safety initiatives and training. Perform other duties and participate in projects as required. Additional information: (what you need to know) Required Qualifications For selection purposes, candidate suitability will be considered in relation to: potential to perform well in the position, given a reasonable period of time for familiarisation and/or training. personal attributes and temperament relevant to the position. general health which will allow for the performance of all duties and functions of the position (for constabulary employees a current PCT is an indicator of general health). Pre-Employment Checks Core children’s worker, safety check required. Drug and alcohol testing, as required, according to guidelines.

jobs.title: Sales Consultant - Travel Money
jobs.description: Sales Consultants, here's your boarding pass to enter the exciting travel retail sector! Travel Money NZ is part of New Zealand's largest and most progressive travel retailer (ever heard of Flight Centre?) We provide foreign currency solutions that help our customers get more out of their holiday. Travel is in our DNA so naturally, if you're considering working with us, travel should be one of your biggest interests, too! We are looking for a part time sales consultant to work across 2 of our Christchurch stores! More than just currency exchange At Travel Money NZ, we consider ourselves more traveller than banker. As one of our Sales Consultants, you'll be an expert in our key products: foreign currency, prepaid travel money cards, and international money transfers. Success with us means listening to your customer, asking open questions to understand their needs, and offering solutions that help them get the most out of their holiday. You'll deliver your service with a high level of accuracy and a commitment to outstanding customer service and will have the ability to build your loyal customer base and drive local marketing initiatives. Skills and experience (what makes a great Flightie!) Experience working towards and achieving sales targets and KPI's A passion for customer service Comprehensive computer skills and the ability to confidently learn new computer systems You're ambitious, highly motivated and an efficient organiser You have exceptional attention to detail and love problem solving Great remuneration! We offer a base salary of $50,000 and generous uncapped earning commission! Why Choose Travel Money (Because we’re awesome) A fun and connected culture, awards, conferences, national and global celebrations! Full training provided: 2 week paid new starter program Travel discounts, health and wellness discounts, free financial planning advice and more Brightness of future - career opportunities in a network of brands and businesses across the global - we promote from within Awards nights, social team building events, and the opportunity to attend global conferences (Las-Vegas 2022, Bali 2023) Learning & Development pathways Paid Parental Leave Corporate Health Discounts - access exclusive discounts on health insurance plans for you and your family with our partners. We proudly support and advocate responsible travel, positive diversity practices, empowered giving, and conservation of natural resources and sustainability About Flight Centre. mō mātou Flight CentrePut simply, we’re a bunch of travel lovers looking for more travel lovers to join our family. Over the past 40 years, we’ve celebrated many important milestones and today, we are proud to be an award-winning global travel retailer. This year we are SO proud to have been listed as excellence awardees at the HR Awards New Zealand, for the Employer of Choice Award AND the HR Team of The Year award! Come as you are. Nau mai, whakatau maiWe believe that every individual is equally important and has access to all the same opportunities and rights. We work as a community with accessible leaders and we embrace diverse cultures, backgrounds and perspectives. We have an irreverent culture of taking our business seriously but not ourselves.So come and join our team of Flighties, and help us open up the world to those who want to see. Click Apply Now! And let your career take off with Flight Centretono mai!

jobs.title: Network Services Operations Manager
jobs.description: At IAG, we’re ready for you. We're the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand. Our family of brands turns the IAG purpose of making your world a safer place into action by helping everyday Aussies and New Zealanders, supporting their ambitions and making insurance accessible.Make your mark as a Network Services Operations ManagerReady for a fresh start? This is your chance to step into a pivotal leadership role shaping the future of IAG’s network operations. You’ll lead a trans-Tasman team and partner with our managed service provider to deliver resilient, high-performing network services while driving automation and innovation. If you’re passionate about transforming traditional operations into a Zero-Touch model and enabling AI-driven solutions, this is the opportunity to make a real impact. This is a permanent full-time role based in Ōtautahi (Christchurch).Ngā Mahi Hei Whakatutuki Māu | What You'll DoLead and inspire a team of network specialists across Australia and New Zealand, fostering capability uplift and growth.Drive the roadmap for network automation and observability, moving towards AI enabled Zero-Touch operationsManage vendor relationships and performance, ensuring seamless collaborationOversee cost management and contribute to financial planning for network services.Champion customer-centricity and operational excellence, ensuring resilience and reliability across all services.Drive product excellence for the product/s assigned to you, and support peers in improving their product capabilitiesCollaborate with architecture and technology teams to deliver innovative, scalable solutions aligned to IAG’s strategy. Ōu Pūkenga me ōu Wheako | What You'll BringStrong demonstrable background in enterprise secure network operations and engineering with leadership experience.Strong background in Product/ Service Ownership delivering world-class Customer ExperienceProven ability to implement automation and software-defined networkingExperience managing vendors and outsourced operations in complex environments.Exceptional communication skills to translate technical concepts into business outcomes.Strategic mindset with a passion for innovation and continuous improvement.Ability to lead high-performing teams and negotiate win-win outcomes. Tā Mātau ki a Koutou| What We OfferBoosted KiwiSaver with 4% employer contribution and life insurance as standard.20 days annual leave + 5 days MyLeave (extra leave for what’s important to you).Work from home and many more flexibility options with myFlex.Up to 50% off personal insurance, including home and motor insurance.Annual $500 health & wellbeing payment.14 Weeks paid parental leave.Access to LinkedIn Learning, the award-winning IAG Academy, study assistance and secondment opportunities.*employment type eligibility criteria apply Applications close: Friday 16 January 2026 9:59PM NZDTPlease note – full time, part time, and job-sharing arrangements will be considered.Tā Mātau Ratonga Tautoko | Adjustments & SupportIf you require any support or adjustments to participate equitably in our recruitment process, we encourage you to reach out to careers@iag.co.nz for a confidential conversation. He pitopito kōrero anō mō mātau | More About UsAs part of IAG you'll enjoy a world of career opportunities, a purpose-led place focused on creating connection and belonging, and where you can create meaningful impact every day and grow your career beyond the expected. That’s not just words. It’s our people promise. We're ready for you with unexpected opportunities for your career, your work-life and your ability to make a difference. We acknowledge Tāngata Whenua in Aotearoa and are committed to growing Māori prosperity and wellbeing in Aotearoa through He Rautaki Māori (IAG’s Māori Strategy). We celebrate unique viewpoints shaped by life experiences, cultures and passions. And expand careers, genuinely connect with community, lead with a powerful purpose and celebrate what makes you individual. While our team takes a well-deserved break, we encourage you to apply for the positions we have advertised. Please note that the Talent Acquisition process will resume in the new year. Your applications are important to us, and we appreciate your patience.

jobs.title: Police Officer
jobs.description: Working at Police (who we are) New Zealand Police delivers services that ensure people can be safe and feel safe in their homes, on our roads and in their communities. Police operate 24 hours a day in a complex environment actively targeting and preventing crime and harm. With around 16,000 staff, we work from urban and rural stations and larger policing hubs.We operate on land, sea and in the air, and respond to more than 1.2 million events per year – answering more than 992,000 111 calls and over 650,000 non-emergency calls. We’re working towards specific goals and targets that highlight our intent to work collaboratively with iwi and communities, other government sectors and business partners to deliver ‘Our Business’ and achieve long-term changeValues: Our Values provide a guide to the way New Zealand Police work, operate, and make decisions, and reflect what is important to us and the communities we serve. Professionalism: Taking pride in representing New Zealand Police and making a difference in the communities we serveRespect: Treating everyone with dignity, upholding their individual rights and honouring their freedomsIntegrity: Being honest and upholding excellent ethical standards Commitment to Māori and The Treaty: Acting in good faith of, and respecting the principles of Te Tiriti O Waitangi – partnership, protection, and participationEmpathy: Seeking understanding of, and considering the experience and perspective of those New Zealand Police serve Valuing Diversity: Recognising the value different perspectives and experiences bring to making us better at what we do Position Overview (where you’ll be working) The purpose of the District Operations is to deliver Our Business. To support the delivery of District outcomes the General Duties Constable will maintain and enhance public security and welfare through response to incidents requiring police attention and the conduct of relevant enquiries. The purpose of leadership in this role is to deliver (or enable others to deliver) Our Business. Responsibilities (what you’ll be doing) The Constable – General Duties will:1. Be safe and feel safe Understand the hazards in your work area and eliminate or minimise the associated risk.Report all accidents, incidents and near misses in MyPolice in a timely fashionActively participate in Wellness and Safety initiatives and training 2. Service delivery Patrolling Undertakes patrols and responds to situations to enforce law and/or maintain public order by the following: Undertaking patrolling in accordance with organisational requirements, principles of non-discrimination and supervisors instructions in a manner that optimises achievement of the patrols goals. Correctly assessing emergent situations and taking appropriate action Establishing, maintaining and utilising knowledge of the local patrol area Responding to incidents, taskings and requests for assistance in accordance with accepted operational procedures Utilising situational problem-solving techniques to resolve issues Assessing situational behaviour of people and determining/implementing appropriate reaction/response strategies Providing first response control/command and/or co-ordination at incidents Conduct Initial Police Investigation Assesses and preserves crime/incident scenes, and assists in the investigation process when required Collects and analyses information relevant to investigations Identifies, seizes, processes and manages exhibits in accordance with legislative and administrative processes Considers and utilises all organisational avenues of inquiry and investigative procedures in order to identify subjects and persons Conducts searches of persons, property and vehicles with due regard to lawful authority and organisational procedures. Decisions to caution, report or arrest are made at the discretion of the officer and conveyed to the person(s) concerned in accordance with organisational and legal guidelines. Affords rights to suspects and victims of crime by treating them in a fair, equitable and non-discriminatory manner.Gathers, Collates and Records Information Collects and records information relevant to police issues in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and procedures Takes comprehensive statements that contain all details relevant to the matter being examined and are in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and procedures Completes the full range of complaint correspondence in a concise and timely manner Completes arrest files, not guilty prosecution files, and other correspondence including notifying of complainants, witnesses and dealing with exhibits Conducts and records interviews in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and procedures Carries out access, storage and retrieval of information in accordance with jurisdictional laws and organisational Codes of Ethics/Best Practice. Uses interview and evidence recording equipment in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and proceduresIdentifies and utilises communication linkages within the organisation to exchange/share informationProcesses and provides for persons in police care or custody Ensures persons in care or custody are provided for, processed and escorted/transported in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and procedures Fosters a positive organisational image in the community Acts on opportunities to explain and promote the organisations activities in order to encourage community recognition and support Represents the organisations position on particular issues in a way which acknowledges community concerns and promotes community awareness Advises and involves the community in public safety activities Contributes to the objectives of the Safety Administration Programme S(A)P and the National Road Safety Plan Provides an initial police response to traffic crash events and emergencies Assists in reducing the number of road deaths and enhances the safe and efficient use of roads through: Patrol duties directed at compliance of general traffic law and the promotion of safe driving practices Targeting of alcohol / drug impaired road users Speed control enforcement Promoting and enforcing the use of vehicle restraint devices Providing peak traffic flow supervision Enforcing vehicle maintenance regulations through vehicle checks Issuing Traffic and Infringement Offence Notices Provides assistance/support for: Accident investigation officers Summons service CARD centre Judicial Processing Prepares and manages evidence, witnesses and offenders for the relevant judicial authority in accordance with jurisdictional laws and organisational policies and procedures by: Managing witnesses Monitoring offenders Liaising with and assisting prosecutions section Undertaking post-court procedures 3. Personal professional performance Effectively manages personal professional performance in order to ensure public confidence in the police service by: Modelling high standards of personal performance, ethics and integrity Reviewing and monitoring personal performance Developing and maintaining ongoing personal competence Assisting and supporting other personnel Maintaining personal physical and emotional health. 4. Team work Works effectively as a member of a team within the community Co-operates and works with other members of the section in order to achieve team goals Establishes and supports open honest and constructive relationships with colleagues Takes a constructive approach to team efforts and supports other team members where possible Customer service Ensures all service requests and complaints are met with a professional, customer focused and timely response. Assesses the changing needs of the customer and implements strategies to respond to them. Ensures services are delivered promptly, impartially and safely. Ensures that Policing services are delivered with a quality customer service and Māori Responsiveness focus. Fosters an atmosphere where being responsive to customer needs is a priority. Provides services designed to target general public attitudinal and behavioural change for the purposes of producing safer communities. Provides high quality policing services in conjunction with other members of the team. Ensures that service delivery conduct and performance integrate both Treaty principles and Māori values and principles consistent with the spirit and substance of the Treaty of Waitangi. 6. Relationship management Creates and maintains networks to ensure local examples of best practice are identified and communicated so that duplication of effort is avoided. Establishes and maintains a positive working relationship with other members of police including members of Dog Section, the Criminal Intelligence Branch, Scene of Crime Officers, Police Photographers, Training Service Centre staff and Prosecutions Service Centre staff. Establishes and maintains a positive working relationship with members of the community and other Government and service agencies such as CYPS, WINZ, Victim Support organisations, cultural groups, local government, churches, schools, neighbourhood watch, and community service groups such as Lions, Rotary and Zonta. 7. Universal Responsibilities All employees of New Zealand Police are expected to: Adhere to New Zealand Police standards of integrity and conduct. Comply with legislative and statutory requirements within area of expertise, including employment and privacylegislation. Model the New Zealand Police Values – Professionalism, Respect, Integrity, Commitment to Māori and The Treaty, Empathy and Valuing Diversity. Respect diversity and demonstrate inclusiveness. Understand the hazards in their work area and eliminate or minimise the associated risk. Report all accidents, incidents and near misses in MyPolice in a timely fashion. Actively participate in Wellness and Safety initiatives and training. Perform other duties and participate in projects as required. Additional information: (what you need to know) Required Qualifications For selection purposes, candidate suitability will be considered in relation to: potential to perform well in the position, given a reasonable period of time for familiarisation and/or training. personal attributes and temperament relevant to the position. general health which will allow for the performance of all duties and functions of the position (for constabulary employees a current PCT is an indicator of general health). Pre-Employment Checks Core children’s worker, safety check required. Drug and alcohol testing, as required, according to guidelines.

jobs.title: Sales Consultant - Travel Money
jobs.description: Sales Consultants, here's your boarding pass to enter the exciting travel retail sector! Travel Money NZ is part of New Zealand's largest and most progressive travel retailer (ever heard of Flight Centre?) We provide foreign currency solutions that help our customers get more out of their holiday. Travel is in our DNA so naturally, if you're considering working with us, travel should be one of your biggest interests, too! We are looking for a part time sales consultant to work across 2 of our Christchurch stores! More than just currency exchange At Travel Money NZ, we consider ourselves more traveller than banker. As one of our Sales Consultants, you'll be an expert in our key products: foreign currency, prepaid travel money cards, and international money transfers. Success with us means listening to your customer, asking open questions to understand their needs, and offering solutions that help them get the most out of their holiday. You'll deliver your service with a high level of accuracy and a commitment to outstanding customer service and will have the ability to build your loyal customer base and drive local marketing initiatives. Skills and experience (what makes a great Flightie!) Experience working towards and achieving sales targets and KPI's A passion for customer service Comprehensive computer skills and the ability to confidently learn new computer systems You're ambitious, highly motivated and an efficient organiser You have exceptional attention to detail and love problem solving Great remuneration! We offer a base salary of $50,000 and generous uncapped earning commission! Why Choose Travel Money (Because we’re awesome) A fun and connected culture, awards, conferences, national and global celebrations! Full training provided: 2 week paid new starter program Travel discounts, health and wellness discounts, free financial planning advice and more Brightness of future - career opportunities in a network of brands and businesses across the global - we promote from within Awards nights, social team building events, and the opportunity to attend global conferences (Las-Vegas 2022, Bali 2023) Learning & Development pathways Paid Parental Leave Corporate Health Discounts - access exclusive discounts on health insurance plans for you and your family with our partners. We proudly support and advocate responsible travel, positive diversity practices, empowered giving, and conservation of natural resources and sustainability About Flight Centre. mō mātou Flight CentrePut simply, we’re a bunch of travel lovers looking for more travel lovers to join our family. Over the past 40 years, we’ve celebrated many important milestones and today, we are proud to be an award-winning global travel retailer. This year we are SO proud to have been listed as excellence awardees at the HR Awards New Zealand, for the Employer of Choice Award AND the HR Team of The Year award! Come as you are. Nau mai, whakatau maiWe believe that every individual is equally important and has access to all the same opportunities and rights. We work as a community with accessible leaders and we embrace diverse cultures, backgrounds and perspectives. We have an irreverent culture of taking our business seriously but not ourselves.So come and join our team of Flighties, and help us open up the world to those who want to see. Click Apply Now! And let your career take off with Flight Centretono mai!

jobs.title: Police Officer
jobs.description: Working at Police (who we are) New Zealand Police delivers services that ensure people can be safe and feel safe in their homes, on our roads and in their communities. Police operate 24 hours a day in a complex environment actively targeting and preventing crime and harm. With around 16,000 staff, we work from urban and rural stations and larger policing hubs.We operate on land, sea and in the air, and respond to more than 1.2 million events per year – answering more than 992,000 111 calls and over 650,000 non-emergency calls. We’re working towards specific goals and targets that highlight our intent to work collaboratively with iwi and communities, other government sectors and business partners to deliver ‘Our Business’ and achieve long-term changeValues: Our Values provide a guide to the way New Zealand Police work, operate, and make decisions, and reflect what is important to us and the communities we serve. Professionalism: Taking pride in representing New Zealand Police and making a difference in the communities we serveRespect: Treating everyone with dignity, upholding their individual rights and honouring their freedomsIntegrity: Being honest and upholding excellent ethical standards Commitment to Māori and The Treaty: Acting in good faith of, and respecting the principles of Te Tiriti O Waitangi – partnership, protection, and participationEmpathy: Seeking understanding of, and considering the experience and perspective of those New Zealand Police serve Valuing Diversity: Recognising the value different perspectives and experiences bring to making us better at what we do Position Overview (where you’ll be working) The purpose of the District Operations is to deliver Our Business. To support the delivery of District outcomes the General Duties Constable will maintain and enhance public security and welfare through response to incidents requiring police attention and the conduct of relevant enquiries. The purpose of leadership in this role is to deliver (or enable others to deliver) Our Business. Responsibilities (what you’ll be doing) The Constable – General Duties will:1. Be safe and feel safe Understand the hazards in your work area and eliminate or minimise the associated risk.Report all accidents, incidents and near misses in MyPolice in a timely fashionActively participate in Wellness and Safety initiatives and training 2. Service delivery Patrolling Undertakes patrols and responds to situations to enforce law and/or maintain public order by the following: Undertaking patrolling in accordance with organisational requirements, principles of non-discrimination and supervisors instructions in a manner that optimises achievement of the patrols goals. Correctly assessing emergent situations and taking appropriate action Establishing, maintaining and utilising knowledge of the local patrol area Responding to incidents, taskings and requests for assistance in accordance with accepted operational procedures Utilising situational problem-solving techniques to resolve issues Assessing situational behaviour of people and determining/implementing appropriate reaction/response strategies Providing first response control/command and/or co-ordination at incidents Conduct Initial Police Investigation Assesses and preserves crime/incident scenes, and assists in the investigation process when required Collects and analyses information relevant to investigations Identifies, seizes, processes and manages exhibits in accordance with legislative and administrative processes Considers and utilises all organisational avenues of inquiry and investigative procedures in order to identify subjects and persons Conducts searches of persons, property and vehicles with due regard to lawful authority and organisational procedures. Decisions to caution, report or arrest are made at the discretion of the officer and conveyed to the person(s) concerned in accordance with organisational and legal guidelines. Affords rights to suspects and victims of crime by treating them in a fair, equitable and non-discriminatory manner.Gathers, Collates and Records Information Collects and records information relevant to police issues in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and procedures Takes comprehensive statements that contain all details relevant to the matter being examined and are in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and procedures Completes the full range of complaint correspondence in a concise and timely manner Completes arrest files, not guilty prosecution files, and other correspondence including notifying of complainants, witnesses and dealing with exhibits Conducts and records interviews in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and procedures Carries out access, storage and retrieval of information in accordance with jurisdictional laws and organisational Codes of Ethics/Best Practice. Uses interview and evidence recording equipment in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and proceduresIdentifies and utilises communication linkages within the organisation to exchange/share informationProcesses and provides for persons in police care or custody Ensures persons in care or custody are provided for, processed and escorted/transported in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and procedures Fosters a positive organisational image in the community Acts on opportunities to explain and promote the organisations activities in order to encourage community recognition and support Represents the organisations position on particular issues in a way which acknowledges community concerns and promotes community awareness Advises and involves the community in public safety activities Contributes to the objectives of the Safety Administration Programme S(A)P and the National Road Safety Plan Provides an initial police response to traffic crash events and emergencies Assists in reducing the number of road deaths and enhances the safe and efficient use of roads through: Patrol duties directed at compliance of general traffic law and the promotion of safe driving practices Targeting of alcohol / drug impaired road users Speed control enforcement Promoting and enforcing the use of vehicle restraint devices Providing peak traffic flow supervision Enforcing vehicle maintenance regulations through vehicle checks Issuing Traffic and Infringement Offence Notices Provides assistance/support for: Accident investigation officers Summons service CARD centre Judicial Processing Prepares and manages evidence, witnesses and offenders for the relevant judicial authority in accordance with jurisdictional laws and organisational policies and procedures by: Managing witnesses Monitoring offenders Liaising with and assisting prosecutions section Undertaking post-court procedures 3. Personal professional performance Effectively manages personal professional performance in order to ensure public confidence in the police service by: Modelling high standards of personal performance, ethics and integrity Reviewing and monitoring personal performance Developing and maintaining ongoing personal competence Assisting and supporting other personnel Maintaining personal physical and emotional health. 4. Team work Works effectively as a member of a team within the community Co-operates and works with other members of the section in order to achieve team goals Establishes and supports open honest and constructive relationships with colleagues Takes a constructive approach to team efforts and supports other team members where possible Customer service Ensures all service requests and complaints are met with a professional, customer focused and timely response. Assesses the changing needs of the customer and implements strategies to respond to them. Ensures services are delivered promptly, impartially and safely. Ensures that Policing services are delivered with a quality customer service and Māori Responsiveness focus. Fosters an atmosphere where being responsive to customer needs is a priority. Provides services designed to target general public attitudinal and behavioural change for the purposes of producing safer communities. Provides high quality policing services in conjunction with other members of the team. Ensures that service delivery conduct and performance integrate both Treaty principles and Māori values and principles consistent with the spirit and substance of the Treaty of Waitangi. 6. Relationship management Creates and maintains networks to ensure local examples of best practice are identified and communicated so that duplication of effort is avoided. Establishes and maintains a positive working relationship with other members of police including members of Dog Section, the Criminal Intelligence Branch, Scene of Crime Officers, Police Photographers, Training Service Centre staff and Prosecutions Service Centre staff. Establishes and maintains a positive working relationship with members of the community and other Government and service agencies such as CYPS, WINZ, Victim Support organisations, cultural groups, local government, churches, schools, neighbourhood watch, and community service groups such as Lions, Rotary and Zonta. 7. Universal Responsibilities All employees of New Zealand Police are expected to: Adhere to New Zealand Police standards of integrity and conduct. Comply with legislative and statutory requirements within area of expertise, including employment and privacylegislation. Model the New Zealand Police Values – Professionalism, Respect, Integrity, Commitment to Māori and The Treaty, Empathy and Valuing Diversity. Respect diversity and demonstrate inclusiveness. Understand the hazards in their work area and eliminate or minimise the associated risk. Report all accidents, incidents and near misses in MyPolice in a timely fashion. Actively participate in Wellness and Safety initiatives and training. Perform other duties and participate in projects as required. Additional information: (what you need to know) Required Qualifications For selection purposes, candidate suitability will be considered in relation to: potential to perform well in the position, given a reasonable period of time for familiarisation and/or training. personal attributes and temperament relevant to the position. general health which will allow for the performance of all duties and functions of the position (for constabulary employees a current PCT is an indicator of general health). Pre-Employment Checks Core children’s worker, safety check required. Drug and alcohol testing, as required, according to guidelines.

jobs.description: Extrastaff are one of New Zealand's longest standing labour hire providers, originally founded in 1965. Since then, we've placed over 120,000 candidates with clients across the country, spanning commercial and civil construction, manufacturing, engineering, and more.We operate across both the blue- and white-collar markets, providing both temporary labour solutions as well as long-term fixtures for our talent and clients. With a small team of focused, driven and like-minded recruiters and support staff, you will be joining a highly capable team that will do everything they can to ensure you succeed.We're after an enthusiastic, driven individual with a bit of gumption and grit, able to build relationships and drive results, with a sense of humour and urgency about them. so a Ford Ranger with full use could be in your future..)Full-time, permanent position - not a short-term contractWork for a leading labour hire provider in Christchurch & New ZealandEnd-to-end training provided, with on-going support and mentorshipDown-to-earth, professional management who understand the trials of the jobGreat team with a sense of humour What you'll be doing:Cultivating new business opportunities on a new desk (Civil Construction or Engineering), with the support of the Sales Manager in ChristchurchOffering a consultative approach to a businesses' recruitment needs, with the client's interests always at the forefront of your mindBuilding meaningful, long-lasting relationships with key stakeholdersConducting site visits, meeting the right people, and ensuring the safety of our guys (with the help of our dedicated OH&S Officer)Ensuring clear and concise communication both internally and externally - you MUST be able to write a cracking email, with great spelling and grammarDelivering regular reports and insightful recommendations to the Sales ManagerScreening candidates on the phone and in personOrganising interviews, medicals, and PPE for your guys on site and new startersMeeting KPIs and deadlines A bit about you:We would prefer someone from a Trade background (Civil), but would also look at keen sales people with a bit of experience (B2B ideally)Understanding how recruitment works would be advantageous, but we can teach you in the ins and outs if you don't have this backgroundWell presented and able to "talk-the-talk"Able to negotiate (with help from your Manager) and secure the sale, with a collaborative and understanding approachAble to identify new opportunities, make a plan, and capture themExcellent communication both written and verbalAble to well as part of a teamPrevious experience using Excel, Word, Outlook and/or Google SuiteFull NZ working rights (Residency/Citizenship)Able to work 40 hours per week in the office (on Colombo Street, in town)Driver's Licence (restricted minimum)Willing to travel for work when required As an equal opportunity employer, those from diverse or underrepresented backgrounds are encouraged to apply. Please note, only those candidates who are shortlisted for the role will be contacted given the number of applications we receive.Our process is simple: we'll give you a call first, and if you're the right sort of person we'll get you in for a chat with the team, and from there we'll access your written ability (can you send a good email?). The general turnaround would be 1-2 weeks from that first call, with an immediate start on offer (notice is also fine).If this sounds like you, please send your resume to jake.mcfadyen@extrastaff.co.nz or apply to this advert with your updated CV.

jobs.title: Meat Production Supervisor
jobs.description: Company DescriptionSouth Pacific Meats, is a 100% New Zealand-owned, Talley’s Group member with over 120 years’ experience. We process premium, grass-fed beef and lamb across 11 plants nationwide, exporting to more than 80 international markets.South Pacific Meats Malvern is seeking an enthusiastic and talented Supervisor to join our team based at our plant in Burnham near Christchurch.Job DescriptionReporting to the Production Manager, the Production Supervisor leads and supports frontline teams to meet production, quality, yield, and regulatory targets while maintaining HACCP standards.In this role, you will be responsible for:Leading, mentoring, and motivating production teams to resolve day-to-day issuesMonitoring and optimising labour resource usage to achieve throughput and efficiency targetsEnsuring HACCP compliance and maintaining process controlOverseeing productivity, quality, yield, process flow, and cost control initiativesConducting staff training, development, supervision, and mentoringDocumenting and processing production records accurately and in a timely mannerDriving continuous improvement activitiesUpholding health & safety standards and leading safety initiativesPerforming other duties as directed by the Plant Management teamHours of work vary from 30 – 50 hours per week and applicants must be available to work both day and night shift, and overtime when necessary. The hourly rate ranges from $30.00 to $38.00, depending on skills and experience.QualificationsThe ideal candidate will have proven experience supervising production teams, preferably within meat processing or food manufacturing. Strong leadership and operational management skills are essential, along with competence in productivity, yield, quality control, and cost management. You should have experience with HACCP and regulatory compliance systems, excellent communication abilities, computer literacy, and accurate documentation skills. A commitment to staff training, development, continuous improvement, and health and safety is critical for success in this role.Additional InformationIf you’re ready to step into a key supervisory role in a high-performance environment, apply today and join SPM’s trusted team.

jobs.title: Trough/Dairy Shed Cleaning & Farm Technician
jobs.description: DescriptionLove the outdoors? Love driving? Keen to do real work that actually matters?If the idea of spending your days on farms, in the sun, in the hills, or right next to the coast sounds better than sitting in an office… keep reading.This role is for someone who gets a kick out of seeing the instant impact of their work. You turn up to a dirty trough, clean it out, blast it, and 10 minutes later it’s spotless. Job done. Farmer happy. Stock healthier. On to the next one.It’s physical, it’s gritty, and it’s also pretty epic.Why This Work MattersFarmers rely on clean water for their animals. When troughs are neglected, young stock suffer and farm operations slow down. You’re not just doing a task. You’re making a meaningful difference to people who feed the country.Plus, you’ll become a familiar face on some of the best farms in Canterbury and beyond. Think southern hills, snow on the ridgelines, coastal blocks with ocean views, big farms with stunning scenery, that’s your Monday.What You’ll Be DoingCleaning and waterblasting farm troughs on siteUsing pumps, hoses, gear and a high pressure systemShovelling out leftover debris and giving each trough a proper resetWorking in Dairy sheds in winter (ceilings, floors, pits, pressure cleaning)Driving between farms (expect plenty of road time, 10-15hours per week )Keeping gear tidy, safe and looked afterOccasionally staying away overnight (usually 1 to 2 nights per month, plus the odd 7 to 8 day run for Southland jobs)Who This Role Is Perfect ForYou’ll thrive here if you:Enjoy being outside all dayLove driving deep into rural Canterbury and beyondNotice details and stay aware of farm hazardsAppreciate farmers, their humour, and the lifestyleCan handle long days and physical workAre under 35, fit, healthy and keen for adventureDon’t mind shovelling when the job needs itTake pride in doing a job properly, not rushing or wrecking gearWho This Role Is NOT ForThis won’t suit you if you:Hate drivingPanic about mud, soft ground, or off-road accessAre rough with equipment, vehicles or toolsDon’t like being on your own for long stretchesWant a cruisy, low effort jobAvoid physical workAren’t comfortable in rural environmentsThe Honest BitsSome days are unreal. Snow on the ground, mountains in the background, great farmers, big farms, epic views.Some days absolutely suck.Rain. Mud. Frozen fingers. Shovelling stones out of troughs that won’t pump properly.It’s hard work. That’s why the pay is good.Pay and Practical StuffYou’ll work around 50 hours a weekTypical day is 10 hours including travel, farm access and setupYou’re on the road a lot, but you’ll also spend time on foot doing hands-on workYou’ll use a dedicated work truck (left at the yard each day)Full training providedManual licence requiredNo farm experience needed, but a farming background helps a lotHow to ApplyIf you’re reading this thinking “that’s me”, then we want to hear from you.Send us:Your CV (or a simple summary of your work history)A short note telling us why this role stood out to youHit APPLY or email us directly
