jobs.title: Team Member
jobs.description: PURPOSE OF POSITIONThe Team Member is responsible and accountable for performing specific tasks and duties, as assigned, within the restaurant. The Team Member provides each guest with a positive guest service experience, prepares quality food products and keeps the restaurant clean.KEY ACCOUNTABILITIESGeneral Accountabilities & Work tasks Follow guest service guidelines and procedures; take appropriate action to ensure guests receive service beyond their expectations Work assigned stations accurately and productively; clean and stock station areas; perform other cleaning duties as assigned You may be required to cook as an when required by your supervisor Handle all food products according to RBL procedures Follow RBL food safety, food handling and sanitation requirements, to ensure the health and safety of guests and employees Report faulty equipment and fixtures to the manager on duty Work Tasks could include: Order taking and serving food and beverage orders. Operating an electronic register, receiving payment and making change. Packing products into food packaging for takeaway or trays for serving, with condiments. Handing packed orders to customers from the packing bench to front counter or out the drive-thru window to the customer’s vehicle. Washing, cutting, dicing, slicing vegetable and salad ingredients. Measuring and mixing foods e.g. potato mix, gravy mix Using a potato scoop to scoop mash potato into pottles and pouring gravy on top. ∙ Preparing food such as burgers, wraps and salads Operating cooking equipment such as potato mixer, microwave, warmer timers ∙ Heating simple food items e.g. burger buns, rolls and tortillasMonitoring food timers for food safety ‘shelf life’ control and discards products Loading chip basket with raw fries placing in to the fryer, lifting and dumping cooked chips from the basket into the chip hopper, ready for serve. Scooping hot chips using a chip scoop into takeaway packaging. Moving chicken trays from the warming cabinet into the chicken display. Cleaning food preparation areas, cooking surfaces, food containers and utensils ∙ Handling general purpose detergents and sanitiser for cleaning Clearing tables of food packaging, emptying rubbish bins and carrying rubbish bags to the rubbish skip back of house. Training and Development Strive to improve personal skills and performance Relevant cook training may be provided as and when required Communicate to immediate supervisor when additional training, guidance and practice are needed Keep immediate supervisor informed of anything which might affect guests, other employees and overall operations Is performance oriented and driven; understands performance expectations and is aware of performance results Effective Business Management Consistently meet job expectations to positively impact the sales and profits of the restaurant ∙ Contribute to the restaurant’s success by accomplishing the expected work during each shift; consistently produces quality work Support the goals, decisions and directives of restaurant management; perform additional duties and responsibilities as directed Follow RBL guidelines for food and cash controls, follow cost control guidelines to maintain and minimize restaurant costs; properly use all products, suppliers, equipment and facilities Health and Safety Take reasonable care for your own health and safety at work, and that your actions/omissions do not cause harm to any other person in the workplace (including, for example, co-workers and customers) Participate in creating and maintaining a safe and healthy work environment, particularly by complying with instructions, policies and procedures Advise manager of any/all work related injuries, accidents, near misses and hazards or potential hazards (including any faults to equipment), and risks or potential risks to health and safetyMOST FREQUENT CONTACTSRestaurant Manager Assistant Restaurant Manager Customers Area Managers Store TeamCritical Qualifications/Skills/ExperienceQualifications: Ideally a minimum of NCEA Level 1 or working towards Level 1 Business/Technical Skills Previous customer service or customer facing experience is favoured but not essential Experience (Behavioural): Places customer first and goes out of their way to ensure customer satisfaction ∙ Able to work under pressure, remaining calm at all times Works well with others and is supportive and collaborative Focused on achieving results and strives to meet targets Acts with integrity at all times Works within guidelines, policies and rules and is a natural rule follower Focused on the safety and wellbeing of others at all times including customers and peersCommunicates effectively verbally with customers and the team and is clear and concise ∙ Able to comprehend written English and able to complete online training modules and follow written procedures and policies with ease Manages time well to complete set tasks and works quickly and with purpose to maintain momentumThis Position Description summarises the primary responsibilities of this role at the time of commencement. Various other responsibilities not listed here may also fall within the responsibility parameters of the position. From time to time and with the natural developments of business structure and practice, an employee may be required to perform additional or new responsibilities that fall reasonably within the expectations of this role. Any significant adjustments to role responsibilities will always be made after consultation with the employee.P22-225226-3

jobs.title: Senior Terrestrial Ecologist
jobs.description: About Use3Scientific Limited is a proudly New Zealand owned environmental science consultancy, operating since 2007 (formerly Davis Consulting Group) with offices in Arrowtown, Christchurch, Invercargill, and Hamilton (https://e3scientific.co.nz/). We deliver technically excellent, innovative, and practical solutions across ecology, water and environmental management, contaminated land, and landfill gas. Our clients span regional and local government, NGOs, and private sector industries such as agriculture, development, tourism, and resource management.The RoleAs a Senior Terrestrial Ecologist at e3s, you'll lead and manage a diverse spectrum of ecological projects across a range of terrestrial environments. You'll take charge of delivering both impact assessments and restoration plans, stepping up as a technical lead, mentor, and key client liaison. The role can be based in Queenstown, Dunedin, or Christchurch. Responsibilities include:· Plan and undertake ecological fieldwork in accordance with industry best practice. Fieldwork will include plant, bird, lizard, bat, and wetland surveys.· Preparation of clear and technically robust reports (EcIAs, Restorations Plans etc), including development of mitigation, offsetting, and compensation packages, in accordance with relevant New Zealand legislation and guidelines (e.g. RMA, NES/NPS documents, Regional and District Plans, EIANZ Guidelines).· Senior and technical review of memos and reports.· Managing, and advising on, large ecological restoration and rehabilitation projects, including on site audits and annual reporting.· Project management of multiple projects, including health and safety, data management, client liaison, and ensuring deliverables are meet on time and on budget.· Mentoring Ecologists and contributing to business development and tender preparation.· Ensuring compliance with NZ environmental legislation, policy frameworks (e.g. NPS‑Freshwater Management), and applying the latest best practice.Required Skills & ExperienceEssential:· Tertiary qualification (MSc or PhD) in Ecology, Zoology, Environmental Science, or a related discipline.· Minimum 7+ years of ecological consulting experience in New Zealand.· Demonstrated expertise in terrestrial and wetland flora and fauna surveys and restoration.· Demonstrated experience in preparing clear, accurate, and technically robust EcIAs, including development of mitigation, offsetting and compensation packages.· Demonstrated experience in preparing Ecological Restoration/Management Plans.· Experience in desktop assessments and research, as well as use of GIS.· Strong writing, data analysis, and project management skills.· Understanding and experience with the National Policy Statement for Indigenous Biodiversity, the National Policy Statement for Freshwater, EIANZ EcIA guidelines, and Regional and District Council Plans.· Willingness to travel and work flexible hours, as well as work both independently and within a team.· Full NZ driver’s licence; mobility across regions.Highly Desirable:· Qualifications and experience in lizard and bat survey and monitoring.· General or Specialist CEnvP.Why e3Scientific?National footprint: Work across Otago, Southland, Waikato, Canterbury, and beyond.Credibility & impact: Science driven restoration projects and impact assessments.Collaborative culture: Join a tight-knit team of passionate scientists where diverse disciplines and local knowledge thrive.How to ApplyIf you’re excited about this opportunity, please send your CV and a cover letter to office@e3scientific.co.nz at your earliest convenience. Informal enquiries are warmly welcomed.

Mō mātou | About us (IDEA ServicesIDEA Services supports adults with intellectual disabilities to live in their own homes and enjoy life as part of their communities. We are New Zealand's largest provider of services to people with intellectual disabilities and their families. Our services are founded on IHC's utter commitment for people with intellectual disabilities to have a good life and to be valued contributors to and members of their own community.Me pēhea te tuku tono | How to ApplySubmit an online application by selecting the 'Apply' button. jobs.title: Landscape gardener

jobs.title: Groundsperson
jobs.description: About the role – Mō te TūrangaBurlington Village is a resort-style complex for the ‘young at heart’. We are located on the Northern side of Christchurch, near Redwood. We are looking to fill the position of a part time grounds person over the summer months. As the weather heats up and the gardens begin to take off we need someone to assist our grounds team under the lead gardener in keeping our village gardens looking their best! The successful candidate will have some gardening/grounds keeping experience. They will have an interest in getting in knowing more about gardening and grounds keeping for a large complex No one day is the same! This is a part-time summer position with around 20-30 hours per week between Monday and Friday until around March/April next year. The successful candidate will be a flexible, professional, capable and adaptable team player with the following qualities: Enjoy working outdoorsAttention to detail with a focus on high standards at all timesSound skills in terms of operating and maintaining machinery (ride-on mower etc)Be physically fitGood communication skillsExcellent customer service skillsA current and clean drivers licenceDiscreet and diplomaticApplicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work VISAAbout us - Nga Korero Mo MatouBurlington is owned and operated by Qestral Corporation Ltd, a company specialising in the development of new generation retirement villages, with a strong focus on “lifestyle”. Our approach is design-led and anti-institutional, and our philosophy is to create communities that bring together and combine the very latest thinking, facilities and the very best people, in terms of design, healthcare, wellness, hospitality, and technology.Qestral Corporation is a well-resourced company, based in Christchurch, with extensive experience in this industry. Check out the Qestral website (which refers to our other villages and board of directors) at http://www.qestral.co.nz.If this sounds like you and you have a passion for beautiful lawns and gardens, are able to work independently or part of a team and enjoy the outdoors please submit your CV and cover letter via Trade Me or Seek

jobs.title: Practice Leader

jobs.title: Real Estate Salesperson

jobs.title: Assistant Manager
jobs.description: Are you a motivated individual with a flair for retail management? Sunday to Thursday, 40-45 hours per week. About Glassons:Glassons is a leading fashion retailer offering the latest trends in women's clothing and accessories. jobs.title: Qualified Carpenter
jobs.description: Job Title: Qualified CarpenterCompany: Bowers Builders (2006) Ltd Location: Christchurch & Canterbury RegionAbout Us: Bowers Builders (2006) Ltd. One week you could be working on a detailed renovation, and the next you could be involved in a light commercial project or a retail shop fit out. We are looking for a versatile carpenter who enjoys variety and can apply their skills to different challenges.Key Responsibilities:Reading and interpreting a variety of architectural and construction plans.All aspects of the build from foundations and framing through to finishing, fit-out, and installation.Collaborating effectively with the site foreman, project managers, clients, and subcontractors across different project types.Maintaining a high standard of workmanship and ensuring site safety at all times.Problem-solving on-site to ensure seamless project delivery.What You'll Bring:Must be New Zealand Trade Qualified in Carpentry.A current LBP (Licensed Building Practitioner) licence in Carpentry is highly advantageous.A minimum of 3 years of post-apprenticeship experience across residential and/or commercial construction.Contact details for at least two professional references.Your own reliable transport and a comprehensive set of hand and power tools.The ability to produce high-quality work with a meticulous eye for detail.A positive, can-do attitude and a strong work ethic.Punctuality, reliability, and excellent time management skills.Excellent communication skills and the ability to work well within a team.Must be able to speak and understand English clearly for health and safety purposes.A full, clean NZ driver's licence.You must be eligible to work in New Zealand.What We Offer:Start date: January / February 2026.A supportive, friendly, and professional team culture.A steady pipeline of interesting and challenging projects.Work uniform and PPE provided.A strong commitment to Health & Safety.Opportunities for career growth and leadership.Please note: Bowers Builders is committed to a safe and healthy work environment. jobs.title: Team Member
jobs.description: Why Taco Bell? We truly believe that where you work matters, and we know a thing or two about what makes employees happy. Join us on our mission of feeding people’s lives with más! We are about more than just building restaurants—we connect with our fans through their passions including sports, gaming, and music. We know that employees want a company they can live and grow with; they crave a unique culture that fosters creativity and encourages pursuit of passion, and they look for opportunities to take risks, develop skills and learn in ways that fit their lifestyle. We foster a culture of authenticity for you to feel at home with the Taco Bell family! What is “Live Más”? Equally important to the job role and responsibilities is making sure Team Members can represent the amazing Live Más! culture that is Taco Bell. At Taco Bell, we embrace breakthrough thinking and innovative ideas that continue to differentiate us from our competitors. We have a maniacal focus on our customers, never follow, and always celebrate the accomplishments of our people. Your role as a Team Member is responsible and accountable for performing specific tasks and duties, as assigned within the restaurant. Team Members provide each guest with a positive guest service experience, prepares quality food products and keeps the restaurant clean.KEY ACCOUNTABILITIESGeneral Accountabilities Greeting customers in the restaurant or drive thru Consistently provide a quality product and guest service experience that delivers total guest satisfactionFollow guest service guidelines and procedures; take appropriate action to ensure guests receive service beyond their expectations Work assigned stations accurately and productively; clean and stock station areas; perform other cleaning duties as assigned Ensure guests receive hot, quality products; prepare packages and deliver products according to menu standard Handle all food products according to RBL procedures Follow RBL food safety, food handling and sanitation requirements, to ensure the health and safety of guests and employees Report faulty equipment and fixtures to the manager on duty Training and Development Strive to improve personal skills and performance Communicate to immediate supervisor when additional training, guidance and practice are needed Understand how each job responsibility in the restaurant impacts guests, other employees and overall operations Keep immediate supervisor informed of anything which might affect guests, other employees and overall operations Is performance oriented and driven; understands performance expectations and is aware of performance results Effective Business Management Consistently meet job expectations to positively impact the sales and profits of the restaurant Contribute to the restaurant’s success by accomplishing the expected work during each shift; consistently produces quality work Support the goals, decisions and directives of restaurant management; perform additional duties and responsibilities as directed Follow RBL guidelines for food and cash controls, follow cost control guidelines to maintain and minimize restaurant costs; properly use all products, suppliers, equipment and facilitiesHealth and Safety Take reasonable care for your own health and safety at work, and that your actions/omissions do not cause harm to any other person in the workplace (including, for example, co-workers and customers) Participate in creating and maintaining a safe and healthy work environment, particularly by complying with instructions, policies and procedures Advise manager of any/all work related injuries, accidents, near misses and hazards or potential hazards (including any faults to equipment), and risks or potential risks to health and safetyMOST FREQUENT CONTACTSRestaurant Manager Assistant Restaurant Manager Customers Area Managers Store TeamCRITICAL QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS/EXPERIENCEQualifications: Ideally a minimum of NCEA Level 1 or working towards Level 1 Business/Technical Skills Previous customer service or customer facing experience is favoured but not essential Experience (Behavioural): Places customer first and goes out of their way to ensure customer satisfaction ∙ Able to work under pressure, remaining calm at all times Works well with others and is supportive and collaborative Focused on achieving results and strives to meet targets Acts with integrity at all times Works within guidelines, policies and rules and is a natural rule follower ∙ Focused on the safety and wellbeing of others at all times including customers and peers ∙ Communicates effectively verbally with customers and the team and is clear and conciseAble to comprehend written English and able to complete online training modules and follow written procedures and policies with ease Manages time well to complete set tasks and works quickly and with purpose to maintain momentumThis Position Description summarises the primary responsibilities of this role at the time of commencement. jobs.title: Caregiver Social Worker
jobs.description: Specialised role, focusing on recruiting, assessing and supporting caregivers to provide the best possible care.This role is based in Christchurch at our Sydenham and West SitesChampion the protection, wellbeing and best management of tamariki in safe families Mō te tūnga | About the roleCaregivers take on a critically important role in the lives of tamariki who cannot live safely at home. As a Caregiver Social Worker, you will partner closely with our caregivers to help them understand the role they play at each stage of a child's journey through care. With your strong relationship management skills and commitment to providing tailored support, you will ensure that our caregivers are well prepared with the resources, skills and information that they need to provide nurturing, safe and stable homes for tamariki. As part of your work, you will build relationships with and support whānau and non-whānau caregivers, emergency and respite caregivers and long-term caregivers.The role of a Caregiver Social Worker is varied and deeply rewarding, with the opportunity to deliver tangible and meaningful benefits to your community. You will work as a team with the child's Social Worker to identify key or underlying issues and develop creative, individually tailored strategies that provide cohesive support from all angles to facilitate great outcomes for tamariki who need caring for. Where required, you will also work with other agencies, community groups and providers to ensure the needs of our caregivers are met.Our close-knit and supportive team are fully committed to achieving positive change for tamariki, whānau and caregivers. We also understand and have experience in managing the challenges you may face in this role. We work from a strengths-based perspective and proactively share knowledge, learnings and insights across the team to ensure that all our members feel heard, supported and well prepared to deliver their best. You will receive a full induction into the role, regular training and supervision, and have the benefit of a strong peer and leadership group.This role is based at our Sydenham and West Sites and will support Caregivers across the Canterbury region. As this role is a Social Worker position, not Caregiver, you must hold a Social Work qualification and be registered with SWRB. Mō mātou | About usOranga Tamariki—Ministry for Children has a commitment to putting tamariki and rangatahi at the heart of what we do. In our work, we aim to demonstrate these values:We put Tamariki firstWe believe Aroha is vitalWe respect the Mana of peopleWe are Tika and PonoWe value WhakapapaWe recognise that Oranga is a journey Ngā pūmanawatanga ōu | What you will bringA recognised Social Work qualification by the Social Worker Registration Board (SWRB)Full registration with New Zealand's Social Worker Registration Board and an annual practicing certificate (or the ability to gain registration with the SWRB)Demonstrated resilience, critical thinking and problem-solving techniquesUpholding the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and demonstrating this in practiceHaving a good understanding of section 7(AA) of The Oranga Tamariki ActA good understanding of the Oranga Tamariki National Care Standards 2018Passion and vision for caregivers and what they need to succeedExcellent relationship management skillsWell-developed written and verbal communication skillsA valid and clean New Zealand's driver's license Nōu te rourou | What's in it for youOranga Tamariki offer an impartial remuneration package, that offers progression annually for experience through tenure. Annual remuneration for this position starts between $81,206 to $97,557 dependent on experience, with tenure-based progression steps above this range.We offer a vibrant and supportive team, flexible work options and a genuine commitment to wellbeing. We offer significant training and professional development so that you can thrive and grow. We welcome diversity and are committed to working in an inclusive and respectful way.This is your opportunity to apply your skills and experience to the wellbeing of tamariki and rangatahi. To see all the benefits of working for Oranga Tamariki, please visit https://mahi.orangatamariki.govt.nz/working-with-us/employee-benefits/Me pēhea te tuku tono | How to applyApply online with your CV and Covering Letter, please include in your application your work availability. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please ensure you apply with a log in using your Oranga Tamariki email address. If you have any questions about role, please contact info_recruit@ot.govt.nz. Applications close: Friday 12 November 2025, however we will be reviewing and inviting candidates to interview as we go so get your application in now! (Interviews will be held in the week of 15 - 19 December) Please note we do reserve the right to close the advert once all roles are filled.If you are interested in any of our vacancies, please ensure that you make yourself familiar with our code of conduct as it sets out our expectations for our kaimahi and requires you to present at work free from the influences of both drugs and alcohol.

jobs.title: Revenue Integrity Officer
jobs.description: We are New Zealand’s leading courier company, entrusted with helping Kiwis with their deliveries for over 50 years. We are the largest subsidiary of the Freightways Group, employing over 1,200 employees and 550 independent contractors in 25 locations across New Zealand. We pride ourselves on our passionate team, innovative systems, and our results-focused service. We have an opportunity for two highly motivated individuals to join our dynamic Christchurch team. In this role, you will be responsible for monitoring freight that moves through our Christchurch Hub, ensuring consignments are correctly addressed, packaged, and ticketed by the sending customer. The role will suit a self-starter with a strong attention to detail, who is highly motivated to earn from the generous performance-based incentive that forms part of the role.This is a part time position with contracted hours between: Monday to Friday 3pm - 8pmDuties for this role include, but are not limited to:Identifying under-ticketed consignments sent through our networkComplying with company Health & Safety standardsAssist with other depot duties as required The ideal applicant will be friendly and outgoing with a great sense of humour, and demonstrate the following attributes:Self-starterAttention to detail and a strong desire to meet targetsAdaptable and organised with good time managementPositive and professional with a strong desire to go the extra mileAble to safely lift/carry consignments weighing up to 25kg If the person described above sounds like you and you think you have what it takes to join team CHC please apply online with your CV (including references) and application letter.New Zealand Couriers is an essential business, and we look for people who are motivated, reliable and punctual who thrive both working within teams and autonomously. With a sense of humour, strong work ethic and ability to prosper in a fast-paced environment you will be the perfect addition to our Team. BenefitsIn addition to the competitive hourly rate, a generous performance-based incentive will applyFree onsite parking Work in a dynamic and rewarding work environment for an established company All applicants will be required to provide proof of their eligibility to work in New Zealand and undertake pre-employment screening including a criminal history check.

jobs.title: Support Worker
jobs.description: At NZCL, we are dedicated to support people with disabilities in New Zealand. Our Disability Support Services reflect our belief that all New Zealanders deserve to live fully, have equal opportunities, and achieve their ambitions.You will be part of a team who will provide a safe environment where people can develop confidence and new skills, build friendships with peers and interact with others in the community. Our teams are our greatest asset and we are committed to employing and training the best people. NZCL team is looking for energetic and motivated people to support people in their own home. We are looking for a Permanent part-time or fixed term part-time Support Workers in Christchurch for our Whānau Support Services. What does a Support Worker do? | He aha te mahi a te Kaimahi TautokoYou will support people in their home and community to lead fulfilling and meaningful lives to achieve their personal dreams and goals by doing the things they want to do such as going swimming, attending sporting events, arts and crafts, movies, or shopping - the list is endless! What do you get? | He aha te whiwhiEarn competitive pay rates between $23.97 up to $29.68 per hour.Job security with Employee benefits, sick/annual leave and more.Travel Allowance.Employee Assistance programme service anytime you need health and wellbeing support.'Refer a friend' BonusPB Tech discount when shopping onlineDiscounted 2Degrees phone and broadband plansDiscounted Southern Cross Health InsuranceDiscounted Samsung productsWho are we looking for? | Ko wai ta tatou e rapu anaPeople who are passionate about helping others, are kind and understanding.Previous experience in a healthcare setting preferred, including experience working with youth.Full driver's license and owning your own vehicle is essential.A desire to support people to learn new skills and achieve outcomes.Somebody who has the initiative to push people for their goals, is energetic, outgoing, and can think outside the box. You need to be respectful of others thinking, and their way of living life that may be different to your own.Empathy, respect, and cultural awareness is important in this role as the people we support come from diverse backgrounds with varying needs and interests. If you are passionate about supporting people, then maybe there is a role for you here. Send your request to NZCL.Mēnā he tangata ngākaunui ana koe ki te tautoko i ngā momo tāngata, tēnā pea, kei konei he tūranga mōu. Tukua mai tō tono ki NZCL.Please bear in mind all applicants must be a NZ Resident/Citizen or have a valid NZ work permit.

jobs.title: Graduate Territory Manager (Beef, Canterbury)
jobs.description: About the roleAs a Graduate Territory Manager at Halter, you will play a critical role in driving business growth and ensuring customer success within your designated territory. You will be responsible for executing sales strategies, building strong customer relationships, and meeting ambitious growth targets, all while acting as Halter’s on-the-ground representative. This role requires a proactive and hands-on approach, with a focus on both expansion and long-term customer satisfaction.This is an entry level opportunity for someone to positively disrupt an industry and pioneer groundbreaking change on some of the highest-performing beef farms. You will be assisting the the South Island team through expansion for one of the world’s fastest-growing companies by helping equip farms with Halter technology that will transform the way they farm to become leaders in productivity and sustainability. You will be working closely with a passionate Customer team on the ground in the area and backed by a team of exceptional people at Halter’s Auckland HQ, to ensure this is the best job you’ll ever have.In addition to your CV, we want to see a cover letter to show us why you’re the right fit for this Business Development Graduate role - demonstrate your creative, out-of-the-box thinking and help us understand what makes you tick and why you want to work at Halter!We're targeting someone to start within this role in March 2026. This role is based out of our Christchurch office. Applicants must live within the region. Travel is required to meet with farmers daily.Who we're looking for:Someone who is excited about growing new business, managing exisiting accounts and owning an end-to-end sales cycle from lead generation to close.A passion for the agri sector and beef farming with a deep passion for helping farmers succeed.A phenomenal attitude and a team player with the ability to consistently overcome challenges.The ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced working environment with a high degree of autonomy.A hunger for success and personal growth to be able to evolve quickly alongside a world-class sales team.Bachelors degree (ideally agriculture).Base knowledge of beef farming systems preferred.What your day could look likeProspecting & Expansion: Sourcing new leads and opportunities through proactive outreach, referrals, industry events, and other channels, as well as responding to inbound queries. You’ll manage the full sales pipeline from lead generation through to close.Hitting Sales Targets: Manage your pipeline and meet high-growth sales targets by screening, qualifying, demonstrating the product, and successfully negotiating contracts with customers.Customer Account Management: After the sale, maintain close relationships with customers to ensure their ongoing satisfaction, provide support, and address any challenges they face with Halter’s products. You’ll also ensure a smooth handoff from sales to customer onboarding and deployment of Halter, helping customers get the most value from Halter’s solutions.Territory Ownership: A high level of ownership in your territory working with regional agricultural groups to foster deep relationships across the beef industry.Customer Onboarding: Assist in owning the end-to-end customer experience during onboarding and deployment of Halter’s product, ensuring a smooth transition from sales to implementation.Field Learnings & Feedback: Serve as the primary point of contact for gathering customer feedback in your territory. Work closely with Support, Product, and R&D teams to share insights from the field that can drive product improvements and innovations.Collaborating with Support Teams: Partner with the Support Team to resolve any issues your customers encounter quickly. You’ll escalate problems as needed and ensure that customers in your territory feel fully supported.Why our team loves working at HalterEvery now and again a company comes along that disrupts and transforms an entire industry, leaving society in a better place. Few people get the opportunity to work at companies like these. Halter is an incredible technology transforming an essential industry. We have a genuine and shared connection to our mission to make a difference in the world.Our product changes the lives of our customers, directly improving their livelihoods and their lifestyle. Your work matters.Dedicate yourself to solving real-world problems alongside an epic team in a high-growth culture. The excitement, risk and reward of a high-growth technology scale-up on the global stage. Our ideas are truly valued, we are able to move fast, and our impact is real.Delicious snacks and drinks are available for your daily flow.Healthy body, healthy mind. We’re partnered with Southern Cross Health Insurance to support your well-being.We offer 6 months of fully paid parental leave for primary caregivers, 4 weeks of fully paid secondary caregiver leave and many other parental benefits that support you and your family.Our personal growth is important. Halter offers an annual $1000 self-development budget to be used for anything that fuels personal growth.Our time to recharge is valued, we’re offered wellness leave and unlimited paid annual leave.Importantly, we offer an inclusive and attractive remuneration package made up of salary, benefits and an employee stock ownership plan.About Halter At Halter, we’re on a mission to enable farmers and graziers to run the most productive and sustainable operations. Our customers are using Halter to break free from the time-intensive constraints of conventional practices. Imagine watching 500 cattle stand up and walk calmly towards their next break? No quad bikes, no dogs, no fences. Just a group of cattle walking at their own pace. People say it looks like magic. Our customers are revolutionizing grazing with Halter. It's changing lives and transforming an industry. People join Halter to do meaningful work. By joining us you’ll be solving challenging problems within a talented team and a culture built for high performance. Our team out-think, out-work and out-care. We’re committed to delivering real change in the world - this isn’t easy, and in truth, we love that it’s hard. We’re backed to deliver on a mission that matters by Tier 1 investors including Bessemer Venture Partners, DCVC, Blackbird, Promus Ventures, Rocket Lab’s Peter Beck and Icehouse ventures. To find out more, visit our careers website, LinkedIn & Instagram. Join our team Halter is committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive workplace — a place where we can each be ourselves and do the best work of our lives. Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the requirements, women and under-represented groups of candidates tend to only apply when they meet every requirement. If you think you have what it takes but don’t necessarily tick every requirement on this job description, please still get in touch and apply to Halter. We’d love to chat to see if you’ll be an epic fit! If this opportunity sounds like you, please apply below by sending through your cover letter explaining why you’re excited about this role and working at Halter, along with your CV, and we’ll be in touch! Please also feel free to check out the careers page for more information on working at Halter and don't forget to follow us on LinkedIn & Instagram.About HalterAt Halter, we’re on a mission to enable farmers and graziers to run the most productive and sustainable operations. Our customers are using Halter to break free from the time-intensive constraints of conventional practices. Imagine watching 500 cattle stand up and walk calmly towards their next break? No quad bikes, no dogs, no fences. Just a group of cattle walking at their own pace. People say it looks like magic. Our customers are revolutionizing grazing with Halter. It's changing lives and transforming an industry. People join Halter to do meaningful work. By joining us you’ll be solving challenging problems within a talented team and a culture built for high performance. Our team out-think, out-work and out-care. We’d love to chat to see if you’ll be an epic fit!If this opportunity sounds like you, please apply below by sending through your cover letter explaining why you’re excited about this role and working at Halter, along with your CV, and we’ll be in touch!Please also feel free to check out the careers page for more information on working at Halter and don't forget to follow us on LinkedIn & Instagram.We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. jobs.title: Junior Service Technician - Espresso Machines
jobs.description: Trainee Field Service Espresso Machine TechnicianAbout UsFounded in 2006, Espresso Tools has grown from a small garage operation into one of Canterbury’s most trusted names in commercial coffee equipment. We’re known for exceptional service, a supportive team culture, and long-standing customer relationships.As demand continues to grow, we’re excited to offer an opportunity for a Trainee Field Service Espresso Machine Technician to join our team. This is a rare chance to learn a specialised trade within the thriving hospitality industry, with full training provided.Role OverviewIn this trainee role, you’ll work alongside experienced technicians to learn how to service, repair, and install commercial espresso machines and grinders. You’ll gain hands-on experience, develop technical skills, and build confidence in providing professional service to our valued customers.This position is ideal for someone with mechanical or electrical aptitude who’s keen to build a long-term career in a unique and rewarding field.Pre trade electrical level 3 is a minimum requirement for this position. jobs.title: ECE Teacher-in-Training
jobs.description: BestStart Halswell Road is on the lookout for a passionate and dedicated Teacher in Training to join our warm and welcoming team.At our centre, our heart leads our relationships, helping us form meaningful connections with tamariki and whānau. These strong relationships guide us in understanding the learning aspirations we can support and nurture. Each day is a fun adventure, filled with opportunities to celebrate diversity and educate our centre community on important causes. From cultural celebrations to fundraising events, there’s always something special happening at Halswell Road!We’re lucky to be in a great location, right on the main road into Halswell with the Halswell Domain in walking distance, perfect for the spontaneous outings our tamariki love. With tamariki bringing their own lunchboxes and enjoying our nutritious morning and afternoon teas, we also help them build the self-care skills they’ll need as they grow.About the role:We’re looking for a Teacher in Training enrolled in a Level 7 ECE Bachelor or Graduate Diploma programme.This is a permanent, part-time position (16 hours per week: 8 hours Wednesday, 8 hours Friday) working in our nursery with tamariki under 2 years old. You’ll be part of a nurturing, playful, and supportive environment where every day is guided by curiosity, care, and connection.What you’ll bring:Enrolment in a Level 7 ECE Bachelor or Graduate Diploma A passion for working with our youngest learners and supporting their development Knowledge of Te Whāriki, ECE regulations, and compliance requirements Commitment to Te Tiriti o Waitangi and inclusive practice Energy, humour, and a genuine love of teaching and learningWhy choose BestStart?We’re proud to have opted into Full Pay Parity and to support your growth every step of the way. With us, you’ll enjoy:Paid study support (for Year 2 & 3 Teachers-in-Training*) Multiple career pathways and wrap-around mentoring Access to Whare Ako online learning & tailored PLD Subsidised health insurance* Free annual flu vaccinations & EAP counselling Wellbeing programme and sick days from day one $2000 bonus for referring a Qualified Teacher* At BestStart Halswell Road, you’ll be part of a close-knit, experienced team who love what they do and are passionate about making a difference for tamariki.Apply now and take the next step in your teaching journey with a centre that celebrates growth, collaboration, and the joy of learning.1097212

jobs.title: Class 4 Driver - Civil Works
jobs.description: Extrastaff is looking for an experienced and motivated Class 4 Driver to join our team for ongoing civil works projects across Christchurch. If you’ve got tipping experience, that’s a huge bonus - but we’re happy to train the right person with the right attitude.You’ll be operating Class 4 tipper trucks and supporting a range of civil construction projects. jobs.title: Sales Manager
jobs.description: We’re on the lookout for a driven Sales Manager to join our Christchurch studio. This is a pivotal new role for NV, focused purely on acquiring new clients and securing high-value projects. If you thrive on building relationships, opening doors and closing meaningful deals, this is your chance to shape NV’s growth story.About NVNV Interactive is a digital agency with studios in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch. For more than 25 years we’ve been blending creativity and intelligence to craft digital experiences that deliver real-world impact. We work with some of New Zealand’s most recognised organisations, as well as international clients, creating online and interactive experiences at a world-class level.As Sales Manager, your focus will be on acquiring new partners and winning projects of significant value, building a pipeline that delivers strong new business revenue each year. You’ll represent NV in the market, collaborate with our strategy, design and development teams to shape solutions, and set each project up for long-term success through a seamless handover to delivery.What you’ll doBuild and maintain a strong pipeline of opportunities with medium to large organisations.Represent NV at meetings, pitches and industry events, showing the craft and credibility we’re known for.Collaborate with internal teams to shape compelling proposals that balance client needs with NV’s commercial goals.Protect NV’s commercial position by ensuring pricing, margins and contracts are solid.Deliver accurate forecasts and keep revenue projections visible to leadership.Stay sharp on digital trends, competitor activity and market opportunities.What we’re looking forDigitally fluent and confident with modern web technology, CMSs (ideally Umbraco), analytics dashboards and sales tools.A proven track record of winning $50k+ projects and hitting annual revenue targets.An established network with strong connections to decision-makers in relevant industries.Skilled in consultative selling, able to shape solutions with delivery teams and show ROI without over-promising.Commercially astute, with confidence in pricing, negotiation and contracts.Resilient and self-directed, with persistence in complex mid-to-enterprise sales cycles.Straight up, authentic and able to build trust quickly.Bonus points if you bring agency/consultancy experience, or an existing portfolio of wins with references.We can offer youA competitive base salary plus performance-based commission.A clear annual new-business target with accelerators and bonuses for standout wins.A supportive and inclusive culture that puts people at the heart of everything we do.The chance to work across varied, interesting clients and sectors, backed by a talented senior team with diverse digital expertise.A collaborative, award-winning studio culture in a central Christchurch location.Flexible working arrangements, professional development opportunities, and yes – even our own in-house cafe.A sense of humour required – we work hard, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously.How to apply:If you’re ready to take on an exciting challenge and play a key role in NV’s next stage of growth, we want to hear from you. Even if you don’t tick every box but know you’d smash this role, get in touch.Applicants should have NZ residency or a valid work permit and be available in Christchurch for interviews.

jobs.title: Social Worker

You will bring aroha, clarity and optimism while maintaining mana.You will:Complete thorough safety and risk assessmentsLead hui with care and confidenceDesign tailored, strengths-based, and culturally aligned plansUplift the mana of whānau through every interactionWork in true partnership with iwi, hapū, Māori organisations, community groups and fellow government agencies to create enduring, meaningful Whakapapa. Our values guide us:Aroha - we care deeplyWhakapapa - we honour connectionsMana - we uphold the dignity of allTika & Pono - we do what's right, with integrityOranga - we journey toward wellbeing, togetherWe are committed to building genuine partnerships with iwi, hapū and Māori communities - ensuring tamariki and whānau are at the centre of all we do.Me pēhea te tuku tono | How to ApplyApply online with your CV and Cover Letter. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please log in and apply using your Oranga Tamariki email address.If you have any questions about the role, please contact: info_recruit@ot.govt.nzApplications close: Thursday 18 December 2025, We will be reviewing CVs and inviting preferred candidates to interview as applications come in, so apply now. The role will commence in January 2026.*Please note we do reserve the right to close the advert once all roles are filled.If you are interested in any of our vacancies, please ensure that you make yourself familiar with our code of conduct which explains our expectations for our kaimahi and requires you to present at work free from the influences of both drugs and alcohol.

jobs.title: Team Member
jobs.description: PURPOSE OF POSITIONThe Team Member is responsible and accountable for performing specific tasks and duties, as assigned, within the restaurant. The Team Member provides each guest with a positive guest service experience, prepares quality food products and keeps the restaurant clean.KEY ACCOUNTABILITIESGeneral Accountabilities & Work tasks Follow guest service guidelines and procedures; take appropriate action to ensure guests receive service beyond their expectations Work assigned stations accurately and productively; clean and stock station areas; perform other cleaning duties as assigned You may be required to cook as an when required by your supervisor Handle all food products according to RBL procedures Follow RBL food safety, food handling and sanitation requirements, to ensure the health and safety of guests and employees Report faulty equipment and fixtures to the manager on duty Work Tasks could include: Order taking and serving food and beverage orders. Operating an electronic register, receiving payment and making change. Packing products into food packaging for takeaway or trays for serving, with condiments. Handing packed orders to customers from the packing bench to front counter or out the drive-thru window to the customer’s vehicle. Washing, cutting, dicing, slicing vegetable and salad ingredients. Measuring and mixing foods e.g. potato mix, gravy mix Using a potato scoop to scoop mash potato into pottles and pouring gravy on top. ∙ Preparing food such as burgers, wraps and salads Operating cooking equipment such as potato mixer, microwave, warmer timers ∙ Heating simple food items e.g. burger buns, rolls and tortillasMonitoring food timers for food safety ‘shelf life’ control and discards products Loading chip basket with raw fries placing in to the fryer, lifting and dumping cooked chips from the basket into the chip hopper, ready for serve. Scooping hot chips using a chip scoop into takeaway packaging. Moving chicken trays from the warming cabinet into the chicken display. Cleaning food preparation areas, cooking surfaces, food containers and utensils ∙ Handling general purpose detergents and sanitiser for cleaning Clearing tables of food packaging, emptying rubbish bins and carrying rubbish bags to the rubbish skip back of house. Training and Development Strive to improve personal skills and performance Relevant cook training may be provided as and when required Communicate to immediate supervisor when additional training, guidance and practice are needed Keep immediate supervisor informed of anything which might affect guests, other employees and overall operations Is performance oriented and driven; understands performance expectations and is aware of performance results Effective Business Management Consistently meet job expectations to positively impact the sales and profits of the restaurant ∙ Contribute to the restaurant’s success by accomplishing the expected work during each shift; consistently produces quality work Support the goals, decisions and directives of restaurant management; perform additional duties and responsibilities as directed Follow RBL guidelines for food and cash controls, follow cost control guidelines to maintain and minimize restaurant costs; properly use all products, suppliers, equipment and facilities Health and Safety Take reasonable care for your own health and safety at work, and that your actions/omissions do not cause harm to any other person in the workplace (including, for example, co-workers and customers) Participate in creating and maintaining a safe and healthy work environment, particularly by complying with instructions, policies and procedures Advise manager of any/all work related injuries, accidents, near misses and hazards or potential hazards (including any faults to equipment), and risks or potential risks to health and safetyMOST FREQUENT CONTACTSRestaurant Manager Assistant Restaurant Manager Customers Area Managers Store TeamCritical Qualifications/Skills/ExperienceQualifications: Ideally a minimum of NCEA Level 1 or working towards Level 1 Business/Technical Skills Previous customer service or customer facing experience is favoured but not essential Experience (Behavioural): Places customer first and goes out of their way to ensure customer satisfaction ∙ Able to work under pressure, remaining calm at all times Works well with others and is supportive and collaborative Focused on achieving results and strives to meet targets Acts with integrity at all times Works within guidelines, policies and rules and is a natural rule follower Focused on the safety and wellbeing of others at all times including customers and peersCommunicates effectively verbally with customers and the team and is clear and concise ∙ Able to comprehend written English and able to complete online training modules and follow written procedures and policies with ease Manages time well to complete set tasks and works quickly and with purpose to maintain momentumThis Position Description summarises the primary responsibilities of this role at the time of commencement. Various other responsibilities not listed here may also fall within the responsibility parameters of the position. From time to time and with the natural developments of business structure and practice, an employee may be required to perform additional or new responsibilities that fall reasonably within the expectations of this role. Any significant adjustments to role responsibilities will always be made after consultation with the employee.P22-225158-1

jobs.title: Senior Consultant/Manager - Tax Policy and Controversy
jobs.description: At EY, we’re all in to shape your future with confidence. We’ll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go. Join EY and help to build a better working world.Nāu te rourou, nāku te rourou, ka ora ai te iwiWith your contribution and my contribution, together we will thrive.Hei Oranga Iwi | The opportunity Due to strong market growth, we are seeking a Senior Consultant or Manager to join EY’s Tax Policy and Controversy team in New Zealand. You will play a pivotal role in resolving complex tax disputes and influencing the future of tax policy, advising a diverse range of clients—from large corporates to entrepreneurial businesses and high-net-worth individuals.This position offers significant variety, combining technical analysis, governance and control testing, commercial acumen, and the opportunity to drive strategic risk management initiatives. You will work at the forefront of tax developments, helping clients navigate regulatory change, get certainty and strengthen their tax governance frameworks.Location: Auckland (Tāmaki Makaurau) preferred; however, for the right applicant, we would also consider Wellington (Te Whanganui-a-Tara) and Christchurch (Ōtautahi).Ko Tō Rourou | Your key responsibilities Advise clients on complex tax issues, including controversy management, technical interpretations, and private binding ruling requests, enabling robust positions and compliance with evolving legislation.Design and implement tax governance frameworks and control testing programs, assessing operational effectiveness and supporting clients in meeting best practice standards.Prepare high-quality technical documentation, including dispute resolution submissions, technical advice papers, voluntary disclosures, penalty remission requests, private binding ruling application.Monitor and interpret legislative and regulatory developments, providing proactive insights on tax policy changes and their commercial implications.Collaborate with clients, regulators, and internal teams to deliver strategic solutions that balance compliance, risk management, and business objectives.Pūkenga | Skills and attributes for success Extensive experience in professional tax advisory, with a strong foundation in tax controversy management, technical research and interpretation, and policy analysis, complemented by commercial insight.Proven ability to manage complex assignments independently, applying sound judgment and strategic thinking to deliver outcomes in dispute resolution, governance control testing, and policy advocacy.Exceptional relationship-building skills, with a track record of engaging effectively with clients, regulators, and policymakers at all levels. At EY, we value potential as much as experience. If you’re proactive, eager to learn, and passionate about making an impact, we’d love to hear from you—even if you don’t tick every box. Your ability to grow and adapt matters most.Ko Taku Rourou | What we offer youAt EY, we’ll fuel you and your extraordinary talents in a diverse and inclusive culture of globally connected teams. Learn more. Career development: At EY, your career is yours to shape! We’ll develop you with future-focused skills and equip you with world-class experiences www.ey.com/nz/careerdevelopmentFlexible work arrangements: Our flexible work policies empower you to balance your professional and personal life, fostering a culture of trust and autonomy.A comprehensive benefits package: From a yearly wellness incentive, to access to additional 8 weeks of flex leave per year, and family-friendly policies, including 26 weeks of gender-neutral paid parental leave, we cater to your diverse needs to help you thrive both personally and professionally www.ey.com/nz/benefits Diversity, equity, and inclusiveness (DE&I) are core to who we are, how we work and how we live our values. We encourage applications from people of all ages, nationalities, abilities, cultures, sexual orientations, and gender identities and are committed to providing an equitable and barrier free recruitment experience for all. We encourage you to share any support and adjustments you need to be your best and participate equitably in our recruitment process. We understand sharing your needs with us can be daunting, so if you have questions before or during your application, we welcome you to get in touch at contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or +61 3 8650 7788 (option 2). Anything you tell us will be kept completely confidential.He rourou kai kei ō ringa hei tākoha? Tēnā haria mai! Are you ready to shape your future with confidence? Apply todayPlease be advised that our offices in Oceania will be closed from 19 December and will reopen in early January. As a result, there will be a delay in responding to applications during this period. We appreciate your understanding and patience. Thank you for considering a career with EY.EY | Building a better working world

jobs.title: Site Engineer Geotec
jobs.description: EngineeringCivil / Structural / DesignChristchurchPermanent / Full TimeWork on major national projects with a contractor that actually invests in youHands on role where you're on site setting out, solving problems and making realBig 2026 pipeline with career progression, flexibility and opportunities acrossSite Engineer - Geotech | Hands-On, Boots-On, Laser-Level Legend Wanted Kia ora and happy Monday momentum, we’re levelling up (literally).If you thrive on getting out from behind the desk, lining up lasers, running levels, solving problems on the fly, and actually being on-site rather than watching the action from a swivel chair… keep reading.We’re partnering with a major national contractor with projects across Aotearoa (you’ll find their signs everywhere, but we’ll save the name-drop for the interview). They’re driving serious infrastructure in NZ and we’re searching for a Site Engineer with a geotechnical edge, someone who backs themselves, backs their work, and isn’t afraid to get a bit of dirt on the hi-vis.About the role This role puts you in the centre of critical civil and geotechnical works across New Zealand. You’ll be the person who knows the site inside out the levels, the lines, the earth, the risks, the workflow, the “that’s not going to sit right” moments.Expect a balance of technical know-how, robust fieldwork, and practical decision-making. No passengers here, you’ll be hands-on from day one.You’ll be doing things like:Setting out, running levels, and laser height surveys with precisionSupporting geotech investigations, testing, and on-site monitoringWorking alongside project managers, forepersons and subcontractors to keep things movingReading plans, marking lines, and ensuring design intent actually becomes realityReporting on progress, site conditions, and quality outcomesTroubleshooting on the ground and providing practical, safe, solutionsEnsuring site compliance, safety, and documentation standards are metWhat we’re looking for (non-negotiables):Degree in Civil Engineering, Geotechnical Engineering, or similar2–5+ years’ experience in site engineering, geotech or civil infrastructureStrong set-out skills, lasers, GPS, levels, total stations… you know your toysConfident working on active sites with boots on the groundSolid understanding of NZ construction methodologies and standardsClear and confident communicator, you can talk to consultants, contractors, and the crewAbility to work independently and own your patchMust be currently in New Zealand with valid work rightsExtra brownie points if you have:Experience with piling, retaining walls, foundations, or ground improvementKnowledge of local geotech conditions and consenting frameworksExposure to medium-to-large civil builds or complex sitesWhat’s on offer You choose your path.We can support you into a permanent role with massive career development, or, if lifestyle and flexibility matter, work through us and enjoy diverse projects, and the freedom to choose where you make your impact.Either way, you’ll be backed by a national brand that prides itself on delivering the right people, at the right time, with zero nonsense and high integrity.About Remarkable People Since 2016, we’ve grown into a national team of high-performing humans who back each other, celebrate wins, and work hard for our communities. We’re people-first, fun, and future-focused. If you want to work somewhere that values growth, capability, and actual work-life balance — you’ll feel right at home.How to apply Keen to get on-site and do meaningful work?Send your CV to Jordan at jordan@remarkablepeople.co.nz, apply online, or call us on 022333268Your next Remarkable move starts here.879263

jobs.title: Support Worker
jobs.description: HealthCare NZ is a leading provider of in-home and community-based health, rehabilitation, nursing, mental health and disability support. Our aim is to support people to live as independently as possible, for as long as possible and to maintain their independence regardless of age, injury, illness or disability. Are you looking to make a real difference in your community? We are currently looking for candidates in christchurch to work Monday to Friday with alternate weekends and between 8am to 9.30pm. This role covers all of CHCH area including Waimakariri, Selwyn and CHCH city.What does a Support Worker do? As part of a wider team, you will assist our clients to live as independently as possible, within their homes and community. You will help our clients to achieve their goals and reach their potential, through both practical and emotional support. Responsibilities can be varied and you will follow a care plan, which may include some or all of the below: Meal preparation Community outings and integration Giving medication Personal cares (showering, toileting etc) Home management What's in it for you? We are committed to our employees and are proud to employ and train the best people in all areas of our organisation. We provide a career pathway for staff through the learning and development framework to achieve NZQA qualifications, which are fully funded. You will earn between $23.97 - $29.68 per hour, depending on experience and qualification. This is an opportunity to join New Zealand's largest community healthcare provider with the potential to gain experience in a variety of disciplines including aged care, disability, mental health and rehabilitation. Whilst you will be part of a large national organisation, you will join a dedicated and close-knit team. What are we looking for? Attitude - a desire to help and support others, achieving excellence in all you do! Previous healthcare or care-giving experience would be advantageous Excellent communication skills Healthcare qualifications are advantageous Most positions require a full NZ drivers' licence and your own reliable transport At HealthCare New Zealand, we are passionate about creating an inclusive workplace that promotes and values diversity and reflects the communities we serve. If you are passionate about what you do and are interested in exploring a rewarding career with us, then we would love to hear from you! Mēnā he tangata ngākaunui ana koe ki te tautoko i ngā momo tāngata, tēnā pea, kei konei he tūranga mōu.Tukua mai tō tono ki Healthcare NZ! You must possess the right to work in New Zealand and a willingness to undergo police vetting and additional checks in order to be considered for this position.

jobs.title: Daytime Cafe Chef
jobs.description: DescriptionAt Ten27 Eatery we are a close team in a family business that has been on the same site in Ferrymead since 1990. Some of our regulars have been coming here since we opened.Open 7 days a week, we have a fresh and innovative a-la-carte menu, as well as a cabinet full of healthy and tasty savoury and sweet items.We are on the lookout for a competent and energetic Daytime Cafe Chef to work with our small team. This role is full-time, 5 days per week (Tuesday - Saturday), daytime hours. The right person for the sous chef’s role will Have several years’ experience cooking breakfast and lunch dishes and creating items for the cabinet.Assist the Head Chef with ordering, and the Food Control PlanLead the team on the Head Chef’s days off.Enjoy people and contribute to a positive working environment.Be a good communicator with excellent spoken English.Work consistently no matter what the pressures.Be flexible with their roster.We all work really hard. The pace can be fast and furious, and with a small team there is a lot to do. We keep the place spotless. We look for something to do when it’s quiet. We love our customers, and we make sure everyone leaves with a smile.We need our team to be loyal and hard-working, always at their rostered shift, and on time, with total focus on getting great food and drinks to our customers as quickly as we can. In return, you’ll get job satisfaction, supportive workmates and managers, good money, and a stable work environment. We are open every day, with occasional evening functions.If you know a great barista looking for some shifts, we’d love to hear from them too. If you are in Christchurch and available for an interview, apply now to admin@casualandcountry.co.nz with your CV and Cover Letter.

jobs.title: Kaiwhakarite Ārahi Client Service Lead

Lead annual client survey process.Finance SupportSupport invoicing, payment tracking, and funding claims related to client services and programmes.Assist with donations, ensuring accurate records and acknowledgements.Assist with grant and accountability requirements (eg. sourcing quotes and collating evidence).Liaise with bookkeeping contractor and assist with their requirements.Communication & Marketing SupportCollaborate with the Fundraising & Marketing Manager to support newsletters, social media, website and community updates.Help design client-facing materials that improve accessibility and awareness of services.Health and SafetyUp to date and familiar with Health and Safety policy and protocols within the office.Participates in and complies with requirements of the Health and Safety in Employment Act 1992 and other associated policies.Key Skills & AttributesStrong interpersonal and communication skills with empathy for clients affected by neurological conditions.Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritise effectively in a dynamic environment.Excellent organisational skills with attention to detail and accuracy.Competent in Microsoft 365 and client management systems (e.g. clinical database and CRM platforms).Proven ability to work independently and as part of a small, collaborative team.Qualifications & ExperienceMinimum three years' experience in client service, healthcare administration, or community support coordination.Tertiary qualification in business administration, communications, or health sciences preferred.Experience in not-for-profit administration and not-for profit fundraising advantageous.Understanding of brain health and health promotion advantageous.

jobs.title: Rural Corporate Relationship Manager
jobs.description: Nau mai ki ASBHere at ASB, the customer is at the heart of everything we do. We are recognised as one of New Zealand's leading organisations with a highly engaged and talented workforce focused on accelerating progress for all New Zealanders.ASB's Rural Corporate team is a team of experienced rural bankers who manage the portfolio of ASB Rural's largest rural customers ranging from corporate farming operations to large scale family businesses. We're experts in understanding the banking requirements for farming businesses which have significant complexity and risk to deliver great banking outcomes for both our customers and the bank.We have an exciting opportunity for a Rural Corporate Relationship Manager to join our team based in the Canterbury region. Te tūranga | The role:Reporting to the Senior Rural Corporate Manager, you will be responsible for the development and ongoing management of complex Rural Corporate business from within a current portfolio; assisting these businesses to meet their financial objectives through the promotion of ASB products and services suited to their ongoing individual needs.As part of your day to day activities, you will prepare, analyse and communicate complex large-scale credit transactions, manage your customers lending, deposit, one team referrals and other banking requirements to ensure we are providing solutions best suited to their financial needs. You will establish strong working relationships with your customers; providing outstanding customer service to a portfolio of high net worth individuals and key industry leaders. Ultimately you will assume the lead responsibility for these customers as you develop in the role.Ō pūkenga | About you:This is an outstanding development opportunity for someone with experience and a proven track record in analysing and structuring complex proposals, with outstanding communication, organisational and time-management skills. Typically, this role would appeal to an experienced Rural Manager and/or a person with strong financial literacy and an understanding of the rural sector who is looking to develop into a Rural Corporate Manager role.This is a challenging yet rewarding role for someone to be a key part of the ongoing Rural Corporate success story. Our rural team are recognised as market leaders, and this is a fantastic career move to make your mark in the industry and further your growth and success with ASB!Te mahi ki ASB | Working for ASB:In our diverse and accepting environment, our people grow their agile mind-set, learn, evolve, and utilise their skills, while being empowered to make decisions.We offer a competitive salary, great banking benefits, heaps of personal and career development opportunities, flexible working styles and parental benefits.For more information see the attached position description, please note that all applications must be received via our careers site online.Me pēhea te tono | How to apply?If this role sounds like it might be the one for you then please click "apply"… we'd love to hear from you!Successful candidates will be required to undertake several pre-employment checks which will include but are not limited to; Police Check, Credit Check, AML Compliance, Verification of your qualifications and may include checks both here in New Zealand and overseas.To serve a diverse community, we need a diverse organisation. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds who bring unique perspectives and thinking styles that add to the culture and performance of our team.More details (document) Rural Corporate Relationship Manager.pdf

This creates an environment of huge growth for our team and our clients.The RoleWe are looking for a highly organised, efficient and process driven individual to support our training and operations teams. A small amount of time each week may be spent working remotely.This is a newly created role so hours will be reviewed after the 90 day trial period.You must have a driver’s license and ideally your own laptop.This role would suit a mature and experienced administrator looking for a few hours work per week.Anticipated start date: 5th January 2026Pay range: $25-28/hourTo ApplyPlease read the above "About You" criteria carefully. jobs.title: Estimator
jobs.description: Leighs Construction is a proudly New Zealand, family-owned business with a strong reputation for delivering complex, high-quality commercial projects across the country. With a commitment to excellence, long-term partnerships, and a people-first culture, Leighs continues to shape skylines and strengthen communities.The construction sector is beginning to show signs of renewed momentum as we move toward 2026. In Auckland and Christchurch, increased stability in pricing, improved supply chain conditions, and a more optimistic economic outlook are contributing to a stronger environment for major commercial projects. As activity ramps up and competition for high-quality delivery partners continues, robust and reliable estimating capability is more important than ever.Leighs is well positioned to leverage this next cycle of growth, continuing to secure meaningful and transformational projects throughout New Zealand.More about the roleAs an Estimator at Leighs, you will play a pivotal role in the tendering and bid process, working to produce accurate, competitive, and well-considered estimates for major commercial construction projects.You will take full ownership of allocated tenders - managing all documentation, analysing risks, engaging with subcontractors, and developing pricing that reflects both commercial competitiveness and construction practicality. Your work will influence early project success and support Leighs' commitment to delivering high-quality built environments.Applications are strictly to be submitted to our recruitment partner Assemble: Submit ApplicationKey responsibilities include:Preparing accurate measurements, pricing, and subcontractor assessments.Managing tender documentation, drawings, and specifications.Identifying risks within tenders and ensuring these are effectively assessed and mitigated.Collaborating on cost analysis and value management initiatives to maximise profitability and enhance project viability.Working with subcontractors to secure competitive pricing and ensure quality contributions to each submission.Supporting procurement activities including sourcing, assessing, and letting subcontractor packages.Contributing to monthly tender reporting and supporting smooth transition of tenders to the commercial and operational teams.Actively engaging in Leighs’ Health, Safety, Environmental, and Sustainability initiatives. Who are we looking for?We are seeking a professional who brings strong technical capability, excellent communication skills, and a proactive approach to problem-solving. You will enjoy working collaboratively with both internal teams and external partners and be comfortable managing a busy workload with autonomy.The successful candidate will ideally bring:A qualification in Quantity Surveying, Construction, or equivalent experience.3–5+ years’ experience in estimating for commercial construction projects.Proficiency with electronic tendering systems.Strong analytical skills with a methodical and meticulous approach.Sound commercial judgement and confidence in decision-making.Proven experience managing multiple tenders or projects simultaneously.Advanced stakeholder engagement capability, with confidence in negotiations.Excellent documentation management, version control, and organisational skills.A customer-focused mindset and the ability to work both independently and as part of a team.A positive, solutions-focused attitude, especially when navigating challenges during the bid process. Why Join Leighs?Leighs offers the stability and values of a family-owned business combined with the scale and capability of a national construction leader. You will be part of a team that values integrity, collaboration and delivering work to be proud of.This is an exciting, career-defining opportunity for a competent construction professional who is ready to step up and shape the next phase of Leighs’ North and/or South Island success story.Apply now or contact Sam Calvert on 027 274 5586 or sam@assemblerecruit.com to discuss further. All applications will be considered and processed by Assemble Recruitment only.
