jobs.title: Youth Support Worker
jobs.description: About the Role As a Kaimahi (Support Worker), you will be part of a dedicated team providing 24-hour wraparound support within a home-like environment. You will role-model positive behaviours, uphold safety, and walk alongside tamariki and rangatahi as they navigate daily routines, emotions, schooling, whānau relationships, and personal goals. This role requires "kia tau te rangimarie" - calmness under pressure, patience, resilience, and the ability to maintain a culturally safe, therapeutic environment anchored in tikanga Māori. You will work rotating 24-hour shifts (minimum 4 days on per roster). This includes days, nights, weekends, and public holidays. Key Responsibilities (Expanded) As a Kaimahi, your responsibilities include (but are not limited to): Direct Care & Support Provide 24-hour, consistent, mana-enhancing support. Maintain daily routines such as waking, meals, schooling, activities, and evening routines. Support emotional wellbeing, self-regulation, and positive behaviour. Role-model healthy life skills, communication, boundaries, and problem-solving. Cultural Practice Work within a kaupapa Māori framework. Uphold tikanga, wairuatanga, and manaakitanga in all care practices. Protect the mana, tapu, and safety of each rangatahi. Professional Expectations Understand individual plans and support rangatahi to meet their goals. Work collaboratively with whānau, social workers, Oranga Tamariki, health professionals, schools, and community services. Attend key meetings, appointments, staff hui, and training. Accurately complete reports, incident notes, and documentation in line with policy and legislation. Maintain professional conduct, confidentiality, and always uphold organisational values. Home Environment & Safety Support basic household tasks: cleaning, laundry, meal preparation, organising activities, and maintaining a calm and safe whare. Demonstrate strong personal hygiene and ensure hygiene standards are upheld for tamariki and rangatahi. Follow health and safety processes, risk plans, and emergency procedures. What We’re Looking For We seek kaimahi with a caring heart and strong integrity, people who can remain calm, steady, and compassionate in challenging situations. You will bring: A genuine passion for supporting rangatahi to thrive. Patience, resilience, and strong communication skills. A willingness to learn and work within tikanga Māori and kaupapa Māori practice. Reliability and the ability to work flexible, long shifts. Strong reading, writing and report-writing abilities. A valid work visa with at least 12 months remaining. A full, clean NZ driver’s licence. A clean Police Vetting Check and CYRAS clearance. Understanding of basic health and safety expectations. Willingness to obtain (with our support): First Aid Certificate NZ Certificate in Health & Wellbeing (Level 3) What We Offer A supportive, whānau-centred, kaupapa Māori workplace. Ongoing training and professional development. Support to complete Level 3 Health & Wellbeing. Opportunities to grow into senior roles for the right people. The chance to make a meaningful difference every day. Other Information Casual roles available with the potential to move into permanent. Typical roster cycle: 4–7 days at 24 hours per day. Work locations across Gore, Oamaru, Timaru, and Christchurch. How to Apply If you have a caring heart, strong sense of whanaungatanga, and want to be part of a kaupapa that uplifts the next generation, we’d love to hear from you. Please send your CV and brief cover letter to: hr@hapuora.nz Tell us why you feel called to this mahi and how you will contribute to the wellbeing of our tamariki and rangatahi. He taonga te tamaiti – every child is a treasure. He taonga hoki ngā kaimahi – those who care for them are treasures too.

jobs.title: Senior Associate - Banking and Finance
jobs.description: The opportunityJoin Buddle Findlay’s Christchurch banking and financial services team. The team advises a broad range of financial institutions - including New Zealand and offshore banks, building societies, credit unions, non‑bank lenders and deposit takers, insurers, brokers, remittance providers, issuers of FMCA products, and local authorities. Our team provides specialist advice across regulatory compliance and prudential supervision, financial markets and conduct, financial advisers and service provider regulation, consumer credit, personal property securities and anti‑money laundering.The team is led in Christchurch by banking and finance partner Jan Etwell, who has deep experience in financial regulatory compliance and transactional banking. The team specialises in consumer credit, financial adviser and financial service provider regulation and financial markets regulation including product disclosure and compliance.Why Buddle Findlay?Work on high‑profile, technically complex banking and finance matters across New Zealand and offshore clients, supported by market‑leading partners and opportunities to build specialist expertiseStrong focus on professional development and career progression, including mentoring, training, secondments and support for continuing legal education and NZ professional obligationsA team that backs you – you will work closely with colleagues across Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch, in a culture where your ideas are valued and your growth is a priority. What you will doWe are seeking a commercially minded Senior Associate to join Jan and her team in Christchurch. You will work on a mix of financial regulatory compliance and transactional banking matters. This will include:Advising on the Financial Markets Conduct Act (FMCA), Credit Contracts and Consumer Finance Act (CCCFA), Anti‑Money Laundering and Countering Financing of Terrorism Act (AML/CFT), Personal Property Securities Act (PPSA), Financial Service Providers (Registration and Dispute Resolution) Act (FSPA), Non-bank Deposit Takers Act (NBDT) and other relevant regimesAdvising banks, non‑bank lenders, insurers and other financial institutions on regulatory compliance, governance and prudential requirements under the Reserve Bank frameworkDrafting and reviewing product disclosure, compliance programmes, financial adviser and service provider documentation, and regulatory submissionsActing on secured lending transactions, PPSR filings and intercreditor arrangements.Supporting clients with conduct and disclosure obligations, consumer credit issues and corporate compliance and governance matters.What matters to usYou will have a genuine commitment to delivering high-quality, client-focused advice, a collaborative approach to working with clients and colleagues.You will also have: Significant banking and finance experience - ideally 6+ years’ PQE with a mix of transactional and regulatory compliance experienceDemonstrable knowledge of NZ regulatory regimes (RBNZ prudential framework, FMCA, CCCFA, AML/CFT, PPSA, FSPR)Strong drafting, advisory and client management skills, commercial judgement and the ability to run matters independently and mentor junior lawyersComfortable working collaboratively across teams and with partners to deliver technically excellent and commercially practical advice.What we offerA career with us gives you the opportunity to work with a wide range of people that are motivated to help shape the future of business in New Zealand. We offer a range of benefits that enable you to be the best you can be, such as opportunities for ongoing professional and personal development, flexible working practices, health insurance benefits, social events, charity initiatives and wellbeing-focused programmes.To applyYou don’t need to tick every box – a willingness to learn and develop is also important to us. If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you. Please send your CV and a short cover letter to our talent attraction specialist jill.mclisky@buddlefindlay.comWe look forward to hearing from you about your aspirations as a commercial lawyer and we hope that could be at Buddle Findlay.Together we grow, Ka tipu tahi tatau.

jobs.title: Hiab Crane Truck Operator
jobs.description: Do you hold a full class 4 or 5 licence and are seeking a new job opportunity?We are seeking a motivated and reliable person to join our team to drive and operate our class 2, 4 and class 5 hiab trucks based in Christchurch.About the role:We are a medium-sized structural steel company that fabricates steel in our workshop then installs it on sites around the South Island with our crane trucks.The role covers loading trucks, delivering and positioning steel on site with our hiab cranes in a safe and responsible manner.We transport steel around the South Island occasionally so must be willing to work away every now and then.We are ideally looking for someone that has hiab and steel erection experience but is not a must and would offer training to the right person. Being able to read basic plans and work in a team environment would be required.Hours of work are 7:00am – 4:30pm Monday – Friday, with the chance of occasional extra hours when required.Holding a Class 5 licence is preferred but not a must and there are opportunities to up-skill for the right applicant.When there is down time from the trucks you would be expected to help in the yard, workshop, or on site where possible and also drive our class 1 vehicles for deliveries and pickups.Benefits:Competitive pay - $30 - $40 per hour depending on experience and licence class held.Weekly pay cycle.Working away allowances and accommodation provided when working away.Great variety of work, get to see a fair bit of the country and work on different projects alongside our installation team.Work alongside a good group of people that enjoy doing what they do.To apply you should possess the following:Be motivated, reliable, punctual and have a good attitude towards health and safety.Good communication skills and manners – both with our management team and with our clients on site.Hold a full class 4 or 5 licence.Be willing to work as part of a team and work on your own occasionally.Be able to tie down loads on truck decks safely.Be willing to work away from home occasionally.A mobile phone so we can contact you.Have pride in the vehicles that you operate and be willing to maintain the cleanliness of the trucks and provide basic maintenance i.e. – checking fluids etc.How to apply:Please email all applications to Ryan or call during business hours, 7:00am – 4:30pmEmail: ryanm@canmet.co.nzMobile: 0226971332Office: 033796077

There is plenty of scope for new ideas, lots of room for you to add value, and importantly, you’ll be working with a business that touches the lives of three million New Zealanders a week.Endless possibilities with Woolworths GroupWe're a proud part of the Woolworths Group – 200,000+ bright minds, passionate hearts and unique perspectives working together connected by a shared Purpose – ‘to create better experiences together for a better tomorrow.Here you’ll be supported and empowered to explore new ideas, make brave commitments and innovate better ways to meet the food and everyday needs of more than 24 million customers every week. jobs.title: Mechanic
jobs.description: Our business is growing, we are starting to build new vehicle types, and now need a new fulltime mechanic to come in and take over the day to day fleet maintenance in our workshop.We are a small, and dynamic team that operates in a fast paced environment through the summer months. We use quality parts and operate a preventative maintenance structure to ensure minimal issues on the road for our customers.Core tasks will be regular servicing, various other repairs, and maintenance as well as scheduled preventative maintenance work. Transmission servicing/repairs, and engine swaps. Tyre fitting will also be required.The ideal candidate will have at least 5 years mechanical experience and be happy to help where needed throughout the different seasons. Our current fleet of multi award-winning campers are very specialized being all second and third generation Toyota Estima vehicles. In 2026 we will be adding two new vehicle classes as we continue to diversify and grow the business.A successful applicant will have an excellent work ethic and be focused on quality workmanship with a preventative maintenance mindset. An excellent attitude is required, as well as being presentable, customer focused when required, computer literate, and have good communication and people skills.This role reports to our Christchurch Branch Manager, and our senior mechanic in Christchurch. Remuneration will be discussed during interview.Accountability Critical Factors SafetyTo ensure compliance is valid and maintained for all workshop equipment. Work with the Branch Managers and Senior Mechanic to ensure high standards and safety checks are carried out on fleet as required. Maintain safe working practices. Work within industry and legislative codes, procedures, and practices. Carry out and ensure compliance of the fleet and operations to any statutory or local body regulations including but not limited to COF’s, and, vehicle registrations and regulations stipulated by the LTSA. Complete pre hire safety checks as required.Fleet maintenanceCarry out as much mechanical work in-house as possible. Identify and communicate any preventative work that could help reduce costs incurred on the road.ServicingCommunicate parts supply. Inspect, diagnose and repair mechanical and electrical defects. Monitor brake pads and replace within set parameters. Test drive all Vehicles after work has been carried out to ensure safety. Check Brake hoses as required. Follow checklists and guidelines provided to ensure all parts and repairs are carried out to the highest level.Third Party workCoordinate any third party work required.OtherRotate and change tyres as required.AdministrationKeep a record of all work in our online system, plus any other task that we may reasonably ask you to complete. In addition to the specific duties above, you acknowledge that your role may develop to include other tasks in addition to those listed above. Skills and Attributes requiredComputer literacyAccuracy in Data EntryAbility to deliver excellent customer service Our business is growing and we require a new fulltime mechanic to come in and take over the day to day fleet maintenance in our workshop.An outgoing and “Happy to Help” personalityAbility to use initiativeTroubleshoot and problem solveA keen team playerAbility to juggle many tasks at onceAbility to remain calm under pressureGood communication skillsAPPLICATANTS TO BE WITHIN NEW ZEALAND PLEASE

jobs.title: Occupational Therapist, Transport Assessor
jobs.description: Occupational Therapist, Transport Assessordrivemednz.co.nzThis is a unique, specialist, and exciting area of clinical practice that has a huge impact on client’s lives. You will be responsible for the assessment of a wide age-range of community-based clients with injury-related and/ or medical-related issues that impact upon their ability to either drive a vehicle or be a passenger in a vehicle. Employment TypeIndependent contractor, part-time.Salary/wages$47-70/hr.Hours/daysMon-Fri - hours and days are negotiable.Where you’ll be workingFrom home; in the clinic in Addington; at client’s homes; at specialist engineer workshops; as examples.Main duties and responsibilities1. Medical fitness to drive assessment2. Vehicle and vehicle modifications assessment3. All administrative tasks associated with your dutiesYou will need your own registered vehicle with a current WOF, an iPAD (for assessment purposes) and a laptop.Experience and qualificationsYou must be a NZROT with a current annual practising certificate.You must be an OTNZ member with professional indemnity insurance.Ideally you will have a minimum of 3y clinical experience in neurological/ physical assessment and rehabilitation.Who we areDriveMed NZ is a small specialised company. We mostly work in Christchurch and Dunedin, however on occasion travel through the South Island to fulfil our roles. What we offerWe can offer on-the job training with a graduated approach to step into the role as you feel comfortable and confident. We can offer flexibility of hours. DriveMed NZ will provide you with ongoing clinical supervision in this specialist niche area of clinical practice.How to applyWe encourage you to call Shelley Beckert, Occupational Therapist, Transport Assessor on 0274688622 to find out more about the role. Please submit your CV with two referees, to drivemednz@gmail.com

jobs.title: Project Manager
jobs.description: The opportunityThis role suits a Project Manager who is early-to-mid career or stepping up into a fuller PM role. You’ll work alongside our experienced Project Managers and Site Managers, taking ownership of project coordination and delivery tasks while continuing to build your capability across the full project lifecycle.What you’ll be doingAssist with planning and delivery of construction projects (cost, time, quality, safety).Coordinate subcontractors, suppliers, and internal teams to keep sites running smoothly.Manage procurement: RFQs, pricing comparisons, ordering, and delivery tracking.Maintain project programmes, look-ahead schedules, and weekly progress reporting.Lead and attend site and client meetings, record minutes, chase actions, and communicate updates.Manage project documentation including contracts, variations, QA, and H&S records.Track costs, progress claims, budgets, and cost-to-complete forecasts.Build strong working relationships with clients, consultants, council reps, and trades.Uphold McBride’s Health & Safety standards on every project.What we’re looking for1–4 years’ experience in construction project delivery (LBP, PM/PC, site engineer, QS assistant stepping up, foreman moving into PM, or similar).A relevant qualification is ideal (Construction Management, Engineering, Architecture, QS) but not essential if your experience is strong.Good understanding of construction processes and sequencing.Clear communicator who can work confidently with both office and site teams.Strong organisation skills and comfort managing multiple priorities.Solid computer skills (MS Office; project management software exposure a bonus).Full NZ driver licence and ability to travel to Canterbury sites.NZ work rights required.What you’ll getA clear pathway for growth within McBride Construction.Exposure to varied Christchurch and Canterbury projects.Supportive team culture with mentoring from senior leaders.Competitive salary based on experience.Tools of trade (phone, laptop, vehicle/allowance depending on role needs).

jobs.title: Banking Specialist - Contact Centre
jobs.description: Multiple opportunities in our Auckland CBD and Christchurch - Contact CentresFull time, Permanent positionRotational RosterMō te Tūranga - About the RoleAs a Banking Specialist in Westpac Direct, you’ll play a crucial role in helping customers achieve their financial aspirations. This role is primarily phone-based (inbound and outbound calls), with some email and digital communication. You’ll review applications, evaluate credit worthiness, and make responsible lending decisions using tools and policies.Listening and Advising: Provide tailored solutions to meet customer needs, ensuring compliance with regulations and policies.Proactive Engagement: Identify opportunities to offer further solutions, supporting customers’ current and future financial goals.KiwiSaver & Insurance Expertise: We support customers with KiwiSaver and insurance products alongside lending solutions.Customer Interaction: Deliver solution-focused conversations that contribute to customer success and business growth.Exceptional Experience: Create high quality customer experiences by being empathetic, trusted, and knowledgeable.Growth Mindset: Build a career in finance, starting with unsecured lending and progressing to secured home lending as you develop skills in credit assessment, financial analysis, and customer relationship management.Time Management: Prioritize effectively in a fast-paced, agile environment.Na tōu rourou - What will you bring?We value attitude and presence as much as experience. For over 160 years we’ve been driven by our purpose to Create Better Futures Together.What makes us unique are the incredible people we’re lucky enough to have walk through our doors every day. The giant ‘W’ on our building doesn’t just stand for Westpac – it says, double you. We’re a place that values, rewards and recognises individuality. Where you can be your whole self, your true self, and your best self. We’re recognised as a place where talent is developed, where passions are fuelled and where ambitions of all shapes and sizes thrive. And it all starts with you!Tono mai ināianei! | Apply Now!Apply today with your CV and Cover Letter. The people of Aotearoa, New Zealand hail from many cultures and backgrounds. At Westpac New Zealand, we draw on this enormous talent pool to cultivate a team rich in ability and empowered to reach its full potential. Our aim is to be brave challengers, celebrating our differences and relentlessly advocating for our customers. It starts with us – we believe that when we care deeply and do our best for our people, they’ll do their best for our customers. We encourage people from all walks of life to apply, including those who are neurodiverse, have chronic health conditions or disabilities – your attitude and passion are as important to us as your experience, qualifications and capabilities. jobs.title: Bar & Barista Duty Manager
jobs.description: FLAX & Co. is a beautiful venue in a peaceful location overlooking a lake with FREE Parking, in the heart of the Preston’s community in Christchurch, just 10 mins from the city centre. We have established ourselves as the go to, independent café by day & a community restaurant, wine & cocktail bar by night. A little bit about us! (Flaxandco.co.nz)DAYTIME - we are delivering a daily 'Switch Espresso' Coffee fix, homemade cakes & sweet treats & Grizzly Baked Goods, alongside an all-day Brunch menu. EVENINGS - we offer a modern fresh menu inspired by the seasons & our travels, all washed down with some of our favourite hand selected NZ wines & beers from craft brewers we love.Due to the chameleon nature of the business, we are seeking a Duty Manager that knows a lot about coffee as well as the bar! You need a current DM License & will work alongside the General Manager & owners, running shifts as required & leading a team of happy smiley people who love delivering the best hospitality & top-notch food & drink. This role is permanent & could be full time or/ a part time role share.As the ‘Barista & Bar Manager’ your role can be broken down as follows -You will be skilled & passionate about all thing’s coffee. You will have previous experience & the ability to work on a busy machine & able to help lead & train a small team to consistently prepare & deliver high quality coffee beverages & other menu items to the set recipesYou will have a passion for wine & experience making cocktails, leading from the front, delivering the ‘perfect pour’ every time & always with a smileYou will ensure a smooth seamless service, be confident working with fresh food & communicating with the kitchen, ensuring compliance with health & safety regulations, as well as helping with ordering, opening / closing the venue & day to day shift management when the General Manager is on leave or having a day off. You will need to be confident to manage cash register operations & handling cash accurately & able to help with cash up & banking as & when requiredSo! Do you love people? Are you reliable & organised, with attention to detail? Do you want to grow in your role & be the best at what you do? Will you support & help to train & develop our team to deliver to the highest standards? To be successful in this role you will need to -Have a broad knowledge of coffee, wine, drink & food service with a genuine passion for delivering consistent & memorable experiencesBe flexible to work a mixture of days, nights & weekends & be available throughout the festive seasonHave great communication skills, willing to work closely with The General Manager, The Owners & The CommunityTo be eligible for this role you will need -A current Duty Managers LicenceAbility to work flexiblyIn return we are offering –A very competitive remuneration package, reflective of your experienceStaff DiscountsWe have decades of experience in the hospitality sector in both Australia, The United Kingdom, Norway & more recently New Zealand & will be supportive & hands on when you need us & will offer ongoing training to help you develop & further your careerFlax (Harakeke) is a traditional Māori symbol of community & we very much want to embody that. So, if you have the skills & experience, love hospitality, hold a current Duty Managers Licence & are as passionate as we are about delivering excellence, then please get in touch. We can’t wait to meet you!

jobs.title: Class 2 Driver/Forklift Operator
jobs.description: ABOUT THE COMPANY Our client is in the freight forwarding industry and looking for their next superstar to help during this busy period. jobs.title: Team Member
jobs.description: PURPOSE OF POSITIONThe Team Member is responsible and accountable for performing specific tasks and duties, as assigned, within the restaurant. The Team Member provides each guest with a positive guest service experience, prepares quality food products and keeps the restaurant clean.KEY ACCOUNTABILITIESGeneral Accountabilities & Work tasks Follow guest service guidelines and procedures; take appropriate action to ensure guests receive service beyond their expectations Work assigned stations accurately and productively; clean and stock station areas; perform other cleaning duties as assigned You may be required to cook as an when required by your supervisor Handle all food products according to RBL procedures Follow RBL food safety, food handling and sanitation requirements, to ensure the health and safety of guests and employees Report faulty equipment and fixtures to the manager on duty Work Tasks could include: Order taking and serving food and beverage orders. Operating an electronic register, receiving payment and making change. Packing products into food packaging for takeaway or trays for serving, with condiments. Handing packed orders to customers from the packing bench to front counter or out the drive-thru window to the customer’s vehicle. Washing, cutting, dicing, slicing vegetable and salad ingredients. Measuring and mixing foods e.g. potato mix, gravy mix Using a potato scoop to scoop mash potato into pottles and pouring gravy on top. ∙ Preparing food such as burgers, wraps and salads Operating cooking equipment such as potato mixer, microwave, warmer timers ∙ Heating simple food items e.g. burger buns, rolls and tortillasMonitoring food timers for food safety ‘shelf life’ control and discards products Loading chip basket with raw fries placing in to the fryer, lifting and dumping cooked chips from the basket into the chip hopper, ready for serve. Scooping hot chips using a chip scoop into takeaway packaging. Moving chicken trays from the warming cabinet into the chicken display. Cleaning food preparation areas, cooking surfaces, food containers and utensils ∙ Handling general purpose detergents and sanitiser for cleaning Clearing tables of food packaging, emptying rubbish bins and carrying rubbish bags to the rubbish skip back of house. Training and Development Strive to improve personal skills and performance Relevant cook training may be provided as and when required Communicate to immediate supervisor when additional training, guidance and practice are needed Keep immediate supervisor informed of anything which might affect guests, other employees and overall operations Is performance oriented and driven; understands performance expectations and is aware of performance results Effective Business Management Consistently meet job expectations to positively impact the sales and profits of the restaurant ∙ Contribute to the restaurant’s success by accomplishing the expected work during each shift; consistently produces quality work Support the goals, decisions and directives of restaurant management; perform additional duties and responsibilities as directed Follow RBL guidelines for food and cash controls, follow cost control guidelines to maintain and minimize restaurant costs; properly use all products, suppliers, equipment and facilities Health and Safety Take reasonable care for your own health and safety at work, and that your actions/omissions do not cause harm to any other person in the workplace (including, for example, co-workers and customers) Participate in creating and maintaining a safe and healthy work environment, particularly by complying with instructions, policies and procedures Advise manager of any/all work related injuries, accidents, near misses and hazards or potential hazards (including any faults to equipment), and risks or potential risks to health and safetyMOST FREQUENT CONTACTSRestaurant Manager Assistant Restaurant Manager Customers Area Managers Store TeamCritical Qualifications/Skills/ExperienceQualifications: Ideally a minimum of NCEA Level 1 or working towards Level 1 Business/Technical Skills Previous customer service or customer facing experience is favoured but not essential Experience (Behavioural): Places customer first and goes out of their way to ensure customer satisfaction ∙ Able to work under pressure, remaining calm at all times Works well with others and is supportive and collaborative Focused on achieving results and strives to meet targets Acts with integrity at all times Works within guidelines, policies and rules and is a natural rule follower Focused on the safety and wellbeing of others at all times including customers and peersCommunicates effectively verbally with customers and the team and is clear and concise ∙ Able to comprehend written English and able to complete online training modules and follow written procedures and policies with ease Manages time well to complete set tasks and works quickly and with purpose to maintain momentumThis Position Description summarises the primary responsibilities of this role at the time of commencement. Various other responsibilities not listed here may also fall within the responsibility parameters of the position. From time to time and with the natural developments of business structure and practice, an employee may be required to perform additional or new responsibilities that fall reasonably within the expectations of this role. Any significant adjustments to role responsibilities will always be made after consultation with the employee.P22-225165-1

jobs.title: Senior Estimator
jobs.description: Senior Estimator – Water NZChristchurch (or open to other NZ locations) | Full Time | Leadership RoleThe OpportunityWe have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Senior Estimator to join our Water NZ business, reporting to the General Manager – Water NZ and based in our Christchurch office. As a senior leader within our Utilities Projects team, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping successful bid outcomes, strengthening our estimating capability, and ensuring we remain the contractor of choice for water infrastructure projects across the region.You’ll lead a dedicated estimating team, collaborate with operational, engineering, and business development stakeholders, and ensure our price proposals are accurate, competitive, and aligned to Downer’s high standards. You will bring:A tertiary qualification in Quantity Surveying, Engineering or similar, plus experience in the construction industry (including 3+ years in an estimating environment).Demonstrated experience leading estimating teams and delivering successful tender outcomes.Strong analytical, commercial and risk assessment capability.Ability to build smart, cost-effective solutions and foster cross-functional collaboration.Exceptional communication and people leadership skills, with commitment to Zero Harm.About Energy & UtilitiesDowner's Energy & Utilities business unit is an integrated trans-Tasman team delivering services and solutions that connect communities to essential networks and infrastructure. We design, build, operate and maintain critical assets across the water, electricity, telecommunications, industrial and power generation sectors. Our strength lies in our technical capability, specialist engineering expertise, and dedicated teams of qualified professionals.Downer Group celebrates and values diversity. We encourage applications from all backgrounds and communities.How to ApplyClick “Apply” to submit your application. We look forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: Project Manager
jobs.description: Why You’ll Love Working With UsSome of the key benefits for the position and employment at Programmed, include:Attractive pay: Competitive salary + company supplied vehicle, laptop and phone.Exposure to diverse projects: Work across a variety of Infrastructure, including local government, telco and education.Exclusive employee perks: Access discounts and benefits with over 600 retailers.Investment in you: We're passionate about personal and professional growth, offering access to certificates, webinars, mentorship, and practical training to help you thrive in your career.Your well-being, our priority: Strong safety culture, generous paid parental leave and access to our Employee Assistance Program, including tailored well-being initiatives designed to support your personal and family needs.About The Opportunity A fantastic opportunity exists for a highly skilled and experienced Project Manager to join our NZ Facility Management team based in Christchurch. This position is responsible for leading complex construction and engineering projects from inception through to delivery and handover while operating within a PMO framework. Working across a diverse range of projects within Education, Telco, and Local Government, you will ensure projects are delivered safely on time and within budget, whilst maintaining high quality and stakeholder satisfaction. Nature of the position: Permanent, Full Time Location: Auckland/WellingtonReporting Line: National Project Delivery Manager/Snr Project ManagerKey Responsibilities Lead all phases of multiple construction projects: planning, design, procurement, construction, commissioning, and handover Manage project scope, schedules, budgets, risks, and quality, according to PMO standards Apply engineering principles to challenge design assumptions, ensure constructability, and resolve technical issues Maintain strong stakeholder relationships: clients, consultants, contractors, regulators Ensure compliance with health & safety, quality, environmental, and statutory/regulatory requirements Prepare and present project reports to senior leadership; ensure transparency and accountability in governance Mentor and guide project teams; encourage best practices & continuous improvement Drive optimisation: cost control, resource allocation, schedule efficiency About You To succeed in this role, you will bring 3 - 5 years of experience leading large-scale construction and engineering projects. Your proven leadership capabilities will enable you to manage and inspire the project management team effectively. In addition, you will demonstrate:Qualification in Engineering – Electrical, Mechanical, Building Science, Construction preferredPMP certification, or equivalent project management qualification is desirableProven record of delivering projects within a PMO or structured governance framework Excellent planning, scheduling, and financial management skills Proficient in risk management and change control Strong interpersonal skills with a focus on effective stakeholder engagement Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate with teams and external stakeholders effectivelyExperience with tools/software used in PMO / project scheduling/budget control (e.g. MS Project, Primavera, or similar) About Us Programmed is a leading provider of operations and maintenance services across all industry sectors including education, health, infrastructure, manufacturing, transport and mining in Australia and New Zealand. Our Facility Management business unit partners with our valued clients to deliver facility management and industrial maintenance services across multiple key and essential industries. We encourage career development, support flexibility and care about your personal wellbeing and safety. Join the Programmed team today. Work With Us Join us on our mission to build outstanding people, strong customers and great communities. Apply today. Our Commitment Programmed and PERSOL supports a workplace culture of zero harm and encourages this in all that we do. Programmed and PERSOL strives for diversity, inclusion and equality of our people. We seek a workforce that is representative of the communities we work in. We encourage people of all cultures, gender, age, sexual orientation or abilities to apply. To learn more about working with Programmed and PERSOL, we encourage you to visit our website.

As a Registered Nurse you will provide a broad range of care to clients in their own home such as:Palliative care including syringe driver careNon-complex and complex wound care including negative pressure therapy and compression bandagingMedication management and the methadone programmeDiabetes managementCatheter and bowel caresTunnel Drain careCardio-pulmonary CareCardio-thoracic and chest trauma care post-surgeryPart of the role is providing a 24hr service to clients which includes nurses working weekends and evening shifts, as well as an on-call component. Shifts include:Morning shift: 8:00AM - 4.30PMAfternoon shift 1:00pm - 9.30PMOn call: one overnight shift every 4 weeksWhat you will bring | Ngā tohungatanga mō tēnei tūrangaPassion for making a difference and improving the quality of life for people living in their own homesStrong communication and organisational skillsAt least 1 years' experience as a Registered Nurse and have a current registrationRestricted or Full Driver's License - must be able to drive around by yourself!Applications Close | Te katinga o tēnei whai tūranga: 19th December 2025 at 5pmOnly suitable candidates will be contacted for interview and applications will be reviewed as they are received, therefore resulting in the role closing early if the right applicant is found. Please note: You must be a citizen or resident of this country to apply, and currently registered with the Nursing Council of New Zealand.

jobs.title: IT, Development, Marketing & Digital Video Specialist
jobs.description: We're looking for a hands-on, tech-savvy, detail-driven team member who thrives in a role with variety. This position blends IT support, development co-ordination, system optimisation, marketing, social media content creation, and digital video editing. No two days will look the same.You’ll work closely with our CEO, support the wider team, solve technical issues, and help bring new ideas to life across both our internal systems and external digital presence.This role can be full-time or part-time, with flexible hours to suit successful candidate.Key Responsibilities:Troubleshoot day-to-day IT issues around the office and coordinate efficiently with our external IT providers for more complex issues to minimise staff downtime.Assist with new user setups, linking documents, and ensuring all system elements work correctly.Liaise with our website developer to ensure issues are resolved properly and improvements are implemented.Collaborate with our CEO and developer to bring new website concepts to life—requiring meticulous attention to detail and effective communication.Identify opportunities to improve office systems and workflows—becoming the “go-to” person for solving process roadblocks.Support and actively participate in our client workshops, ensuring the software runs smoothly for demonstrations, assisting with setup, helping clients troubleshoot issues, and contributing to a professional, seamless workshop experience (training given).Create and implement AI-driven solutions to speed up processes and improve operational efficiency.Create compelling social media posts and video content for Facebook, LinkedIn, and Instagram.Own our social media presence, digital campaigns, and promotional visuals.Confidently edit video content, produce short-form clips, and showcase our brand story across platforms.Self-learn our practice management software and build useful automations within our systems. Ideally you will have:Confidently use AI tools and remain up-to-date with emerging technologies.Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a knack for translating discussions into creative content, structure and storytelling.Strong Excel skills to diagnose issues, repair broken spreadsheets, and fix graphical or formula errors.Bring strong verbal and written communication skills to capture ideas from team discussions and transform them into meaningful, structured marketing content.Ability to write, structure and format marketing content for our service and eventsCreative with a good eye for design and video.A natural problem-solver with strong attention to detail.Comfortable juggling multiple tasks and switching between tech, development, and creative work.Practical, proactive, and confident with IT.Self-driven, curious, and eager to learn new technologies. In return we can offer you:A great, varied role where you will be appreciated and feel an important part of the team, and never be bored.Work closely with leadership and contribute directly to company improvements.A friendly team that values innovation and initiative, and support each other and the success of our clientsWork with a team that prides themselves on honesty, transparency, integrity and professionalismModern, stylish offices in Sydenham with off-street parking, right at the doorOpportunities to upskill across IT, AI, development, digital media and business systems and client-facing software training.Good coffee and always guaranteed a laugh If this sounds like you, please email your CV to kate@asl.co.nz

jobs.title: Registered Nurse

jobs.title: Meat Process Workers
jobs.description: Company DescriptionSouth Pacific Meats provides the world with New Zealand’s finest premium beef and lamb products for all to experience and enjoy. We serve over 80 markets globally, supported by an operation which includes twelve processing plants throughout New Zealand.SPM sources top-quality, sustainable, grass-fed, New Zealand Beef and Lamb products from our network of farmer suppliers. We are 100% New Zealand-owned and operated and a proud member of the Talley’s Group; New Zealand’s leading exporter of meat, dairy, seafood, and vegetable products.Job DescriptionSPM Malvern is gearing up for our busy season and are putting together motivated teams at our modern processing plant near Christchurch to help get NZ sheep and beef from our backyard to customers plates. No prior experience necessary as training is provided, you simply need to be keen for some hands-on work as part of a motivated crew!Reliable and hard working with a positive attitude, you know if a job's worth doing, it's worth doing right. Plus, you'll like to keep fit and healthy and seek a workplace where it's all go.We're building teams to fill a wide range of roles. You could be out in the stockyards or in the cold-stores, a butcher, boner, machine operator or labourer - wherever works best. We'll bring you up to speed right there on the job, so you can learn while you earn!We are seeking applicants for a variety of processing roles for our night shift:Sunday - Thursday 3:30pm - 12:00amSuccessful applicants must:always put safety firstbe keen to learn new skillsbe able to work on a night shift roster including weekendsenjoy working in a diverse teamIf you are already experienced in knife handling or meat processing, that’s great we need talented people like you and we invite you to apply as wellNo prior experience necessary as training is provided, you simply need to be keen for some hands-on work as part of a motivated crew!This is a Night-Shift roleAdditional InformationAll applicants must have the right to work in New Zealand To ensure a safe workplace, South Pacific Meats conducts pre-employment medical checks and drug screening. Applicants must be eligible to work in New Zealand.If you’re interested in joining a fast paced, challenging but enjoyable workplace, where you get to meet great people and work alongside your mates then please apply online through this ad.

jobs.title: Team Member
jobs.description: PURPOSE OF POSITIONThe Team Member is responsible and accountable for performing specific tasks and duties, as assigned, within the restaurant. The Team Member provides each guest with a positive guest service experience, prepares quality food products and keeps the restaurant clean.KEY ACCOUNTABILITIESGeneral Accountabilities & Work tasks Follow guest service guidelines and procedures; take appropriate action to ensure guests receive service beyond their expectations Work assigned stations accurately and productively; clean and stock station areas; perform other cleaning duties as assigned You may be required to cook as an when required by your supervisor Handle all food products according to RBL procedures Follow RBL food safety, food handling and sanitation requirements, to ensure the health and safety of guests and employees Report faulty equipment and fixtures to the manager on duty Work Tasks could include: Order taking and serving food and beverage orders. Operating an electronic register, receiving payment and making change. Packing products into food packaging for takeaway or trays for serving, with condiments. Handing packed orders to customers from the packing bench to front counter or out the drive-thru window to the customer’s vehicle. Washing, cutting, dicing, slicing vegetable and salad ingredients. Measuring and mixing foods e.g. potato mix, gravy mix Using a potato scoop to scoop mash potato into pottles and pouring gravy on top. ∙ Preparing food such as burgers, wraps and salads Operating cooking equipment such as potato mixer, microwave, warmer timers ∙ Heating simple food items e.g. burger buns, rolls and tortillasMonitoring food timers for food safety ‘shelf life’ control and discards products Loading chip basket with raw fries placing in to the fryer, lifting and dumping cooked chips from the basket into the chip hopper, ready for serve. Scooping hot chips using a chip scoop into takeaway packaging. Moving chicken trays from the warming cabinet into the chicken display. Cleaning food preparation areas, cooking surfaces, food containers and utensils ∙ Handling general purpose detergents and sanitiser for cleaning Clearing tables of food packaging, emptying rubbish bins and carrying rubbish bags to the rubbish skip back of house. Training and Development Strive to improve personal skills and performance Relevant cook training may be provided as and when required Communicate to immediate supervisor when additional training, guidance and practice are needed Keep immediate supervisor informed of anything which might affect guests, other employees and overall operations Is performance oriented and driven; understands performance expectations and is aware of performance results Effective Business Management Consistently meet job expectations to positively impact the sales and profits of the restaurant ∙ Contribute to the restaurant’s success by accomplishing the expected work during each shift; consistently produces quality work Support the goals, decisions and directives of restaurant management; perform additional duties and responsibilities as directed Follow RBL guidelines for food and cash controls, follow cost control guidelines to maintain and minimize restaurant costs; properly use all products, suppliers, equipment and facilities Health and Safety Take reasonable care for your own health and safety at work, and that your actions/omissions do not cause harm to any other person in the workplace (including, for example, co-workers and customers) Participate in creating and maintaining a safe and healthy work environment, particularly by complying with instructions, policies and procedures Advise manager of any/all work related injuries, accidents, near misses and hazards or potential hazards (including any faults to equipment), and risks or potential risks to health and safetyMOST FREQUENT CONTACTSRestaurant Manager Assistant Restaurant Manager Customers Area Managers Store TeamCritical Qualifications/Skills/ExperienceQualifications: Ideally a minimum of NCEA Level 1 or working towards Level 1 Business/Technical Skills Previous customer service or customer facing experience is favoured but not essential Experience (Behavioural): Places customer first and goes out of their way to ensure customer satisfaction ∙ Able to work under pressure, remaining calm at all times Works well with others and is supportive and collaborative Focused on achieving results and strives to meet targets Acts with integrity at all times Works within guidelines, policies and rules and is a natural rule follower Focused on the safety and wellbeing of others at all times including customers and peersCommunicates effectively verbally with customers and the team and is clear and concise ∙ Able to comprehend written English and able to complete online training modules and follow written procedures and policies with ease Manages time well to complete set tasks and works quickly and with purpose to maintain momentumThis Position Description summarises the primary responsibilities of this role at the time of commencement. Various other responsibilities not listed here may also fall within the responsibility parameters of the position. From time to time and with the natural developments of business structure and practice, an employee may be required to perform additional or new responsibilities that fall reasonably within the expectations of this role. Any significant adjustments to role responsibilities will always be made after consultation with the employee.P22-225157-8

jobs.title: Baker
jobs.description: Roster option 1Monday Monday 4:00 AM 2:30 PMTuesday Tuesday 4:00 AM 2:30 PMFriday Friday 4:00 AM 2:30 PMSaturday Saturday 4:00 AM 2:30 PMWorking with Woolworths Supermarkets New Zealand | Te Mahi ki Woolworths Supermarkets New ZealandWith over 185 stores and 20,000 team members across Aotearoa, we've made it our mission to make Kiwi lives a little better every day. jobs.title: Retail Associate | OPSM | PT | NZ | Riccarton
jobs.description: We are EssilorLuxottica, a global leader in the design, manufacture and distribution of ophthalmic lenses, frames and sunglasses. Formed in 2018 by the combination of Essilor and Luxottica, our Company combines two centuries of innovation and human endeavour to elevate vision care and the consumer experience around it. We are home to the most loved and widely-recognized vision care and eyewear brands in the world. Our proprietary eyewear brands include Ray-Ban, Oakley, Costa, Vogue Eyewear, Persol and Oliver Peoples, complemented by over 20 prestigious licensed brands. Our advanced lens technologies include Varilux, Crizal, Eyezen, Stellest and Transitions. We offer superior shopping and patient experiences with a network of 18,000 stores including world-class retail brands like Sunglass Hut, LensCrafters, Salmoiraghi & Viganò and GrandVision.Every day, EssilorLuxottica’s 180,000 employees in 150 countries work towards a common mission to help people see more and be more. In 2021, the Company’s milestones included a collaboration with Meta to launch Ray-Ban Stories smart glasses; the acquisition of GrandVision bringing 39,000 new employees into our family; expansion of our International Employee Shareholding community, and the launch of Eyes on the Planet, our strategic approach to sustainability.In Australia and New Zealand, we operate the iconic retail and eye care brands: Sunglass Hut, OPSM, Ray-ban and Laubman & Pank.Are you someone who wants to make an impact?See yourself at OPSM!We are seeking a passionate and engaging Part-Time Retail Associate to join our OPSM team in Riccarton for 20 hours per week - including one weekend shift.You will be involved in the customer’s journey from initial consult and pre-testing, to customising High-Fashion frames (from Luxury Brands such as CHANEL, Tiffany & Co. and Gucci) to suit their lifestyle.What’s in it for you?Monthly bonus schemeSubstantial Discounts through the rewards & recognition programGenerous yearly product reimbursementsWorld-class training program, provided by our training team and in-store mentorsLocal & global Volunteering opportunities with OneSightWork with brands such as Ray-Ban, Oakley, PRADA, D&G, Burberry, Miu Miu, Versace and many others.See yourself at OPSM – become part of our family and help us make a real change in people’s lives!You bring to the team:Retail experience – optical desired but not essentialStrong communication skills and a quick learnerPassion to help others see the beauty in life Ready to apply?If you love high fashion, luxury brands and are passionate about providing high-quality customer service, then we want to hear from you now!Click apply now or email: Carrie.Callaghan@au.luxottica.com

jobs.title: Regional Sales Manager
jobs.description: Laminex New Zealand, part of Fletcher Building’s Building Products division, is a trusted name in innovative design solutions. With a new plant underway in Taupō, this is an exciting time to join us. We’re proud of our welcoming, people-first culture where everyone feels valued, and you’ll be supported by a passionate, experienced team committed to your success.As we invest in innovation and strengthen our market presence, we’re looking for a dynamic Regional Sales Manager to lead our South Island team in a growth phase to drive strategic sales execution.About the RoleYou’ll be part of the sales leadership team, managing 6 direct reports across Christchurch, Dunedin, and Otago. As Regional Sales Manager, you’ll be responsible for leading and coaching a high-performing sales team across the Southern region. You’ll translate national sales strategies into actionable regional plans, taking ownership of budgets, KPIs, and forecasting to ensure supply chain readiness and growing the market share and achieving revenue targets. You will focus on building strong partnerships with key customers and stakeholders and driving excellence in customer experience and operational performance.What We’re Looking ForAt least 5 years’ experience managing a sales-focused team ideally with regional coverage. Proven ability to lead and coach sales teams, fostering a collaborative, high-performance culture that consistently drives growth.Ability to prepare and implement strategic sales plans aligned with company goals. Strong commercial acumen with expertise in P&L management, budgeting, and operational finance.Analytical mindset with excellent forecasting and planning skills.Highly collaborative with the ability to influence decisions through innovative solutions and customer-centric thinking.Strong relationship-building skills with key decision makers.Excellent negotiation and communication skills.Proficient in Microsoft Excel, with practical experience using CRM and ERP systems.Knowledge of the building products or manufacturing industries or similar is an advantage.Why Join Laminex?As part of Fletcher Building, Laminex offers a competitive salary and benefits, genuine opportunities for career growth, and a supportive team culture where your ideas truly make an impact. Ready to make your mark? Be the driving force behind innovation and growth and shape the future of Laminex in the Southern region, apply now!Studies indicate that some females and minority groups may hesitate to apply unless they meet all the criteria. If this role interests you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every requirement.Our teams thrive on diversity, embracing various nationalities, languages, religions, customs, and lifestyles. We are proud of our diversity and see it as one of the things that make us better together.

jobs.title: Front of House Receptionist
jobs.description: Core ResponsibilitiesGuest relations: Greet guests warmly, assist with their needs, and provide information about the hotel and local attractions.Check-in/check-out: Register new arrivals, verify booking details, issue keys, and process departures, including settling guest accounts and taking payments.Reservations: Take and confirm bookings via phone, email, or in person, often using a hotel management system.Communication: Answer multi-line phone systems, take messages, and forward calls to the appropriate staff.Financial transactions: Handle cash and card payments accurately, prepare bills, and reconcile the cash drawer at the end of their shift.Problem resolution: Address guest complaints and requests promptly and professionally to ensure guest satisfaction.Administrative tasks: Perform general office duties such as filing, data entry, and maintaining the order and cleanliness of the front desk area.Required skills and qualificationsCustomer service: Strong interpersonal skills, patience, tact, and the ability to remain calm under pressure.Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, a polite demeanor, and a good telephone manner.Organization: The ability to stay well-organized and handle multiple tasks efficiently.Computer proficiency: Experience with standard office software and hotel management systems is often required.Professionalism: A smart appearance and a high standard of personal presentation.Education: A high school diploma is typically the minimum requirement, though a hospitality-related degree or diploma can be an advantage.Language skills: Fluency in English is essential, and knowledge of other languages is highly valued in international settings.

jobs.title: Newly Qualified Pharmacists
jobs.description: Congratulations on Completing Your 2025 Internship! You’ve dedicated yourself to your studies and successfully completed your intern year. Now, it's time to launch your career with a company that’s as ambitious and dynamic as you are. Bargain Chemist, one of New Zealand's fastest-growing pharmacy groups, is looking for passionate, newly qualified pharmacists from the 2025 cohort to join our team. Why Start Your Pharmacist Career with Us?At Bargain Chemist, we don't just offer a job; we offer a career path. We are 100% Kiwi owned and committed to making healthcare affordable, but our biggest investment is in our people. jobs.description: Start the new year with a meaningful role in a centre where diversity thrives and whanaungatanga grows. jobs.title: Team Leader

Our Disability Support Services reflect our belief that all people deserve to live fully, have equal opportunities, and achieve their ambitions. We're proud to employ and train the best people in all areas of our organisation and we enjoy a vast degree of diversity within our staff teams.Earn competitive pay rates between $27.48 - 29.68 per hour. With an additional shift allowance of $1 per hour for Team Leader duties.PB Tech discount when shopping onlineDiscounted 2Degrees phone and broadband plansDiscounted Southern Cross Health InsuranceDiscounted Samsung productsEarn while you learn with free training towards NZQA Health & Wellbeing Employee Assistance program service anytime you need health and wellbeing supportWhat are we looking for? | He aha ta tatou e rapu anaMinimum Qualification Level 3 in Health and Well-being requiredPeople who are passionate about helping others, are kind and understanding.Previous experience in a healthcare setting preferred, including experience with disabilities and challenges behaviours.Full driver's license is essential.Somebody who has the initiative to push people for their goals, is energetic, outgoing, and can think outside the box. You need to be respectful of others thinking, and their way of living life that may be different to your own.Flexibility to work overnight shifts across a roster, including weekends.A warm, calm, and friendly personality with a passion for supporting people to achieve positive outcomes for themselves.Empathy, respect, and cultural awareness is important in this role as the people we support come from diverse backgrounds with varying needs and interests. If you are passionate about supporting people, then maybe there is a role for you here. Send your request to NZCL.Mēnā he tangata ngākaunui ana koe ki te tautoko i ngā momo tāngata, tēnā pea, kei konei he tūranga mōu. Tukua mai tō tono ki NZCL. jobs.title: Head Chef
jobs.description: HEAD CHEF — EL QUINCHO$30–$40/hr depending on experience | Full-time | 1 vacancyEl Quincho is Christchurch’s home of Argentinian fire cooking, authentic, humble, and driven by the simple belief that great food brings people together. After around two years leading our kitchen, our Head Chef Julian is moving on, and we’re looking for the next culinary leader to honour what he built while taking our kitchen to its next level.Who You AreYou’re a chef who loves flavour but respects systems. You enjoy creativity, but you also think in processes, yields, GP%, prep flows, and team development. You’re humble, team-first, and you value consistency as much as passion.You're someone who thrives with clear goals, and you enjoy working towards targets; COGS, labour efficiency, prep organisation, and service speed. You take pride in hitting them.If you’re the type of chef who fixes a bottleneck before anyone asks, coaches younger cooks, and sees recipes as living documents, we want to meet you.Your ResponsibilitiesLead the kitchen with clarity, fairness, and purpose.Own the weekly kitchen results: GP%, waste control, prep planning, service performance.Maintain and improve systems (Loaded, Operandio, Google Workspace).Develop and mentor the team, ensuring training is consistent and scalable.Engineer specials that follow our identity: simple, bold, tradition-focused, while optimising stock utilisation and profitability.Guarantee food quality and consistency true to Argentinian asado culture.Ensure food safety, compliance, and clean, efficient workflows.Collaborate with management on menu evolution and long-term kitchen strategy.What You BringProven experience leading a kitchen, ideally with fire cooking, grills, or high-volume service.System-thinking: recipes, yields, prep lists, station charts, checklists.Financial awareness: COGS, waste, margins, portioning.Strong leadership skills, firm when needed, supportive always.Calm under pressure, organized by nature.Humility. Pride in craft. Respect for tradition.A desire to create an environment where people enjoy working and learning.What We Offer$30–$40/hour depending on experience.A values-driven workplace based on Family, Humility, Connection, and Enjoyment.A kitchen where your ideas are heard and your leadership matters.Support from ownership focused on professional systems, long-term growth, and giving you the tools to succeed.The chance to help shape the next chapter of El Quincho’s culinary direction.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.description: Job Advertisement: Software EngineerCompany: YES CAR RENTALS LIMITEDJob Type : Full-timePay : Hourly $69 - $72Minimum working hours: 40 hours per weekLocation : 152 Orchard Road, Harewood, Christchurch, 8051 About Us:YES CAR RENTALS LIMITED is a leading provider of car leasing, hiring, and renting services. Our team, made up of travel enthusiasts, is dedicated to delivering exceptional customer service. We have consistently received positive feedback for offering a comprehensive and cost-effective car rental experience. Our stores are strategically located near airports for convenient pick-up and return. We offer multilingual customer service, 24/7 emergency assistance, unlimited kilometers, transparent pricing, and zero-risk insurance packages.Job Overview:The Software Engineer will be responsible for designing, developing, testing, and maintaining software systems and applications that support Yes Rentals’ online car rental platform and internal operations. The role ensures that all software solutions are secure, reliable, efficient, and aligned with the company’s business goals of delivering fast, cost-effective, and environmentally friendly car rental services across New Zealand. This role involves working 40 hours per week.Key Responsibilities:1. Design, develop, and maintain software applications and backend systems to support the company’s online booking, payment, and fleet management platforms.2. Write, test, debug, and document program code in accordance with technical specifications, user requirements, and industry quality standards.3. Develop APIs and system integrations to ensure seamless data flow between customer interfaces, payment systems, and internal management tools.4. Research, analyse, and evaluate current systems and identify technological limitations or deficiencies that require improvement.5. Propose and implement innovative technical solutions to optimise performance, scalability, and user experience across all platforms.6. Manage software testing procedures, including automated testing and deployment pipelines, to maintain high system reliability.7. Monitor software performance, collect and analyse operational metrics, and identify areas for continuous improvement.8. Maintain comprehensive documentation of all program code, technical configurations, and system design specifications for auditing and support purposes.9. Collaborate with the System Administrator and IT team to ensure software and hardware systems are effectively integrated and maintained.10. Design and implement technical security measures, including encryption, authentication, and access control protocols, to safeguard company and customer data.11. Perform forensic analysis and troubleshooting to identify and resolve anomalies, threats, or potential vulnerabilities within the software environment.12. Ensure compliance with data protection regulations, company policies, and IT security standards throughout all stages of software development.13. Develop and maintain tools to support automation, software configuration, and system monitoring, improving efficiency and reducing manual workloads.14. Participate in the planning, estimation, and delivery of new software projects, ensuring they meet business and user requirements within agreed timelines.15. Provide technical expertise and guidance to other departments, assisting with system usage,troubleshooting, and continuous improvement initiatives.16. Contribute to the company’s sustainability goals by optimising software resource usage and supporting the transition to smart, low-carbon digital systems. Qualifications：1. Bachelor’s degree (or above) in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field preferred and more than 5 years of previous closely related experience required.2. Strong understanding of software development lifecycle like SDLC, programming principles, and system integration.3. Proficiency in one or more programming languages such as Java, Python, C#, or JavaScript, and familiarity with database systems, API development, and cloud-based platforms.4. Experience with version control tools like Git, continuous integration/deployment (CI/CD), and automated testing frameworks.5. Good understanding of software security, data encryption, and regulatory compliance related to data protection.6. Ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams including system administrators, designers, and project managers.7. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.8. Strong problem-solving, analytical, and time management skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment. Join our team and be part of a dynamic environment where your skills and expertise will contribute to enhancing our customer experience and operational efficiency. Apply now to be a part of YES CAR RENTALS LIMITED, where we value every team member's contribution to our success.

Zero Micromanagement.Physio Clinicians is a new, clinician-led operation in Canterbury. We are building something different: an operation that treats clinicians like partners.We know that the best clinical work happens when you are supported and trusted to manage your own day. We are rejecting the "churn and burn" culture to focus on a model where quality care and clinician wellbeing go hand in hand.The Role & The PartnershipWe act as your partner in practice. Our Role: We secure the referrals, provide the systems, handle the administration, and provide the mentoring/community.Your Role: Focus on delivering clinical excellence for the patient.We are looking for driven Physiotherapists or OTs to service Concussion Services and Training for Independence (TI) contracts.Primary Focus: Delivering high quality Concussion Services & TI programmes.Optional Scope: HCS, Vocational Rehab, and Pain Management are available if you wish to broaden your caseload.Location: Community-based (Home, School, Workplace) across Canterbury, with the ability to complete admin from home.What we are offeringAutonomy & Flexibility: You are the master of your diary. Need to do the school pickup? Want to start late or finish early? As long as the clients are cared for and the outcomes are met, how you structure your day is up to you.Partnership, Not Just a job: We view this as a collaboration. We handle the logistics and provide the work, you provide the clinical excellence.Supportive, Close-Knit Team: Community work can be isolating, but not here. We are a close team that stays connected. You will have constant access to training, peer support, and team events.Structured Progression: We have a structured progression chart to help you gain new skills, increase your responsibility, and raise your earning potential ($90k - $130k+).Our ValuesWe are looking for people who want to belong to a team with high standards and open communication.Consistent Excellence: We put quality first. Whether you are a new grad or a veteran, we expect a drive to improve. We trust that when you are away, your colleagues will treat your patients with the same high level of care you do and you will do the same for them.Sincere Candor: We support each other enough to be honest. A supportive team isn't one that stays silent, it's one that has the courage to give feedback that helps you grow. We want people who can give and receive hard truths because they know it comes from a place of care and professional improvement.About YouRegistered Physiotherapist or Occupational Therapist with a current APC.Experience with ACC contractsKey Interest: You are passionate about delivering high quality community rehabilitation.Drive: You want to continually improve, and you are looking for a team that will support that growth.Communication: You are clear, professional, and unafraid to ask for help when you need it.Join a team that has your back.If you want to do great work without the burnout, we want to talk.To Apply:Please submit your application via Zeil, or email ben@physioclinicians.co.nz for a confidential discussion.

jobs.title: Residential Youth Workers
jobs.description: Permanent opportunitiesWe need role models with a passion for supporting and empowering rangatahiAttractive remuneration and benefits packageWhat is a Youth Justice Residence? It's a place where 13-17 year-olds accused of an offence stay to await court proceedings or serve a sentence. This means they are not free to leave. However, a residence is not a prison, and our Residential Youth Workers are not prison guards. At all times we prioritise the safety and security of our rangatahi and staff on site, however, we are committed to ensuring that the time rangatahi spend in our residences will improve their prospects for the future. Our Residential Youth Workers are there to keep our rangatahi safe, but they're also mentors, role models and coaches.Mō te tūnga | About the role Based in Rolleston, our residence team understands that the causes of offending are complex, and that successfully dealing with our rangatahi demands action beyond simple punitive measures.Guiding positive behavioural change is often challenging and our residential youth workers have many responsibilities, including:Ensuring that a safe and secure environment is maintained for the benefit of the rangatahi, staff and the communitySupporting rangatahi in their personal growth and rehabilitation with a focus on health, education, training and employmentWorking with rangatahi to help them build and strengthen relationships with their whānau and communities and encouraging them to act on referrals to servicesCoaching rangatahi through our structured day and through all life necessities.Participating in activities with our young people by playing sports and taking part in gym activities.Establishing and building rapport with rangatahi who have experienced trauma and assist with redirecting behaviour. Our residences run a 24/7 operation with staff working various shift times. The shifts are a rotating roster with a mixture of AM, PM, nights and weekends. Ngā pūmanawatanga ōu | What you will bring Experience and a passion for wanting to make a positive difference in the lives of rangatahi The ability to build positive relationships with a wide range of peopleEmpathy, patience and resilience.Good communication skills with the ability to work with others and contribute to a supportive and inclusive teamEmpathy, patience and ability to see past what someone may be struggling withWillingness and ability to work across a roster that covers mornings, evenings, weekends and public holidaysA good level of physical fitness that will allow you to safely support and interact with rangatahiYou must be able to present at work free from the influences of drugs and alcoholIn this role you need to have the right to work in New Zealand, either as a NZ citizen or permanent resident. You will also need to be able to meet the safety checking and police vetting requirements required under the Children's Act, please note that Clean Slate does not apply. You also must have a clean and clear drivers licence. Nōu te rourou | What's in it for you 4 weeks and three days of annual leave each yearA generous 23% allowance paid on top of base remuneration for working as part of a rotating roster (shift work). Meals that are prepared by our commercial kitchens and provided on-site - our kaimahi are encouraged to sit with rangatahi and share a meal and meaningful conversationsRegular training and professional development so that you can thrive and grow your skills and capabilitiesAccess to counselling and support when you need it through our employee assistance programme which reflects our genuine commitment to supporting the wellbeing of our kaimahiWe offer a remuneration package that starts between approximately $57,760 and $65,334 (depending on your experience). On top of this, we also apply a 23% allowance to your base remuneration for working shifts/a roster pattern. The 23% allowance is applied once you have completed your initial induction and are placed onto a rotating roster that covers days, evenings and weekends. Base remuneration plus the 23% allowance works out to be between $64,766 and $78,400 (depending on your experience). Additionally, Oranga Tamariki has a remuneration framework that offers step-based annual increases based on your tenure.Me pēhea te tuku tono | How to Apply:Apply online with your CV and Covering Letter telling us why you are interested in the role.If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please ensure you apply with a log in using your Oranga Tamariki email address. If you have any questions about role, please contact Info_recruit@ot.govt.nzPLEASE NOTE: We will not be processing any external applications until the 14th November 2025.If you are interested in any of our vacancies, please ensure that you make yourself familiar with our code of conduct as it sets out our expectations for our kaimahi and requires you to present at work free from the influences of both drugs and alcohol.
