jobs.title: Travel Expert
jobs.description: Open up the world to those who want to see. whakatuwhera te ao ki te hunga e hiahia ana ki te kiteAttention Travellers, Your Search for the Perfect Job Ends Here!Soon, you'll land a role where you’re encouraged to share your passion for travel and open up the world for our customers. The atmosphere is warm, welcoming, and rewards the bold and brave. Leave your ego at the door and bring along your drive, determination, and resilience. You might hit some bumps along the way, but you'll have the full support of your team. So buckle up and read on… your next adventure awaits!At Flight Centre NZ, there's always something exciting happening. We help friends plan their first overseas experience, couples create their dream honeymoons, and families book unforgettable trips. It's all about turning dreams into reality.Embarking on a career at Flight Centre is an exciting opportunity. You don't have to be a travel guru from the outset; what's crucial is your ability to dive into the world of research, organization, and connecting with people. Success at Flight Centre is about channelling your time and energy into the job while relishing the continuous journey of learning and growth. It's a path to a dynamic and fulfilling career you won't want to miss!About the role. Mō te TūrangaHow You’ll Open Up the World for Our CustomersCreate Dream Itineraries: Build dream trips for your customers, creating lasting memories they’ll share for years to come.Share Your Knowledge: Use your travel expertise to make perfect recommendations from a range of options including flights, accommodation, cruises, tours, insurance, and more.Roll Out the Red Carpet: Make your customers feel welcomed and valued through active listening, mutual respect, and a positive attitude.Trusted Advisor: Be someone your customers can trust and share their excitement with, showing them you take your business seriously but not yourself. About You! mo koe!Travel Expert: You’re the go-to person in your circle for travel recommendations, tips, and tricks.Innovative Thinker: You seek out new ways to build on your success and think outside the box to find the best travel solutions for your customers.Sales-focused: You believe hard work should be rewarded, so you’re focused on achieving your KPIs and sales targets to get the incentives you deserve.Organised: You understand the importance of organisation and managing your time effectively to achieve the best results and stay on top of your work.Multitasker: You’re good at the people stuff and the behind-the-scenes stuff too – building itineraries, creating invoices, operating our booking systems, and multitasking with a customer in front of you. Some of our benefits (why you should join us!) Ngā mea e tukuna ana e mātouCelebrate Success: Embrace our famous company culture at Reward & Recognition events throughout the year, including our annual ‘Global Gathering’Career Growth: Be supported in your career growth through our Brightness of Future pathways within our global organisation.Stay Healthy: Our In-house health and well-being team providing free consultations, webinars, courses and global challenges!Stay Active: Enjoy an hour out of your working week dedicated to being active or focusing on your wellbeing. We call this our hour of empowerment. Be financially savvy: Our in-house Moneywise team offer free financial planning adviceTravel Like a Pro: Access industry travel discounts and qualify for sponsored ‘Familiarisation Trips’ to explore new destinations and products around the world.Earn More from Day One: Base wage plus uncapped incentives – earn a percentage of every sale from day one, with no limit on what you can achieve.Be Yourself: Thrive in a workplace that values individualism – come as you are! This industry is always changing, every day a new rule, a new crisis, new resorts, or destinations. It’s challenging, high pressure but rewarding —and we wouldn't change a thing!Don’t Miss Out!Apply now for one of the best adventures you’ll ever have.About Flight Centre. mō mātou Flight CentrePut simply, we’re a bunch of travel lovers looking for more travel lovers to join our family. Over the past 40 years, we’ve celebrated many important milestones and today, we are proud to be an award-winning global travel retailer. This year we are SO proud to have been listed as excellence awardees at the HR Awards New Zealand, for the Employer of Choice Award AND the HR Team of The Year award! Come as you are. Nau mai, whakatau maiWe believe that every individual is equally important and has access to all the same opportunities and rights. We work as a community with accessible leaders, and we embrace diverse cultures, backgrounds and perspectives. We have an irreverent culture of taking our business seriously but not ourselves.So come and join our team of Flighties and help us open up the world to those who want to see. Click Apply Now! And let your career take off with Flight Centretono mai!

Apply today to become our next Tenancy Advisor. Lynda McMeekan will be handling your application.

jobs.title: Graduate Business Development Executive (Canterbury)
jobs.description: About the roleHalter helps farmers to grow more grass and graze their land more efficiently while driving mating performance and monitoring every cow 24/7. We have removed many of the barriers farmers face on a day-to-day basis. Halter farmers don’t need to get up at 4am to get the cows in, put up a fence, measure pasture, or detect heats… they do all of this automatically and more proactively through the Halter App. They can schedule their mobs to meet them at the dairy for milking, run as many mobs as they want, and allocate precisely the right amount of feed. Welcome to farming with Halter!We are searching for a fresh grad with a strong desire to launch their career with Halter! We're looking for someone to help Halter’s expansion in the Canterbury market whilst also playing a crucial part in assisting the team with events and local days across the South Island.This is an entry level opportunity for someone to positively disrupt an industry and pioneer groundbreaking change on some of the highest-performing dairy farms. You will be assisting the the South Island team through expansion for one of the world’s fastest-growing companies by helping equip farms with Halter technology that will transform the way they farm to become leaders in productivity and sustainability. You will be working closely with a passionate Customer team on the ground in the area and backed by a team of exceptional people at Halter’s Auckland HQ, to ensure this is the best job you’ll ever have.In addition to your CV, we want to see a cover letter to show us why you’re the right fit for this Business Development Graduate role - demonstrate your creative, out-of-the-box thinking and help us understand what makes you tick and why you want to work at Halter!We're targeting someone to start within this role in March 2026. This role is based out of our Christchurch office. Applicants must live within the region. Travel is required to meet with farmers daily.What your day could look likeOn-farm sales meetings: Understanding the needs and problems of your prospects then clearly communicating functionality, benefits and highlighting value relative to each farming operation.Manage and assist the team with events and open days.Prospecting: Building and growing a pipeline of quality farms fit for Halter, while continuously reducing sales cycle times. Managing newly sourced and inbound leads through the initial stages of the pipeline including screening and qualifying.Networking: Building and leveraging industry relationships to establish and maintain Halter's brand.Forecasting: Working with the Business Development Manager to enable monthly and quarterly forecasting of revenue.Growth initiatives: Working with the Business Development Manager to optimise and evolve the sales process to become faster, more efficient, and more predictable as the company scales.Who are we looking forSomeone who is excited about growing new business, and owning an end-to-end sales cycle from lead generation to close.A passion for the agri sector and dairy farming with a deep passion for helping farmers succeed.A phenomenal attitude and a team player with the ability to consistently overcome challenges.The ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced working environment with a high degree of autonomy.A hunger for success and personal growth to be able to evolve quickly alongside a world-class sales team.Bachelors degree (ideally agriculture).Why our team loves working at HalterA genuine and shared connection to our mission to make a difference in the world.The excitement, risk, and reward of a high-growth technology scale-up.The pride of joining an iconic New Zealand technology company growing successfully on the global stage.The opportunity to work with and grow together with an enthusiastic, and highly gifted team with diverse backgrounds.The opportunity to supercharge your career in a supportive and caring environment.Our ideas are truly valued, we are able to move fast, and our impact is real.Delicious snacks and drinks are available for your daily flow.Healthy body, healthy mind. We’re partnered with Southern Cross Health Insurance to support your well-being.We offer 6 months of fully paid parental leave for primary caregivers, 4 weeks of fully paid secondary caregiver leave and many other parental benefits that support you and your family.Our personal growth is important. Halter offers an annual $1000 self-development budget to be used for anything that fuels personal growth.Our time to recharge is valued, we’re offered wellness leave and unlimited paid annual leave.Importantly, we offer an inclusive and attractive remuneration package made up of salary, benefits and an employee stock ownership plan.About HalterAt Halter, we’re on a mission to enable farmers and graziers to run the most productive and sustainable operations. Our customers are using Halter to break free from the time-intensive constraints of conventional practices. Imagine watching 500 cattle stand up and walk calmly towards their next break? No quad bikes, no dogs, no fences. Just a group of cattle walking at their own pace. People say it looks like magic. Our customers are revolutionizing grazing with Halter. It's changing lives and transforming an industry. People join Halter to do meaningful work. By joining us you’ll be solving challenging problems within a talented team and a culture built for high performance. Our team out-think, out-work and out-care. We’re committed to delivering real change in the world - this isn’t easy, and in truth, we love that it’s hard. We’re backed to deliver on a mission that matters by Tier 1 investors including Bessemer Venture Partners, DCVC, Blackbird,Promus Ventures, Rocket Lab’s Peter Beck and Icehouse ventures.To find out more, visit our careers website, LinkedIn & Instagram.Join our teamHalter is committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive workplace — a place where we can each be ourselves and do the best work of our lives. Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the requirements, women and under-represented groups of candidates tend to only apply when they meet every requirement. If you think you have what it takes but don’t necessarily tick every requirement on this job description, please still get in touch and apply to Halter. We’d love to chat to see if you’ll be an epic fit!If this opportunity sounds like you, please apply below by sending through your cover letter explaining why you’re excited about this role and working at Halter, along with your CV, and we’ll be in touch!Please also feel free to check out the careers page for more information on working at Halter and don't forget to follow us on LinkedIn & Instagram.We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

jobs.title: Youth Worker Te Whiki and Te Awe Community Homes
jobs.description: We are looking to fill 2 x Full time permanent positions based at Te Awe in Lower Hutt and Te Whiki based in Upper HuttMō mātou | About usOranga Tamariki—Ministry for Children has a commitment to putting tamariki and rangatahi at the heart of what we do. We are committed to ensuring that New Zealand is the best place in the world to be a child. We are also committed to ensuring Oranga Tamariki partners with hapū, iwi and Māori organisations to find appropriate solutions for tamariki in need.Our Residential Youth Workers have an important role to play. They provide care and support to the young people in our care and encourage and motivate them to make positive choices. This is a real opportunity to positively influence young people, help them grow and successfully transition back into the community.The operating model for our community based homes are on a journey for tamariki and what they will feel, think and experience in each part of their engagement with the whare, taking a te ao Māori approach.This is not a 9 to 5 job, our young people require wrap around support from us which is why our Residential Youth Workers do rostered shifts as the facility provides 24-hours, 7-days per week coverage (including weekends and public holidays).Mō te tūnga | About the roleOur Residential Youth Workers have an important role to play. They provide care and support to the young people in our care and encourage and motivate them to make positive choices. This is a opportunity to positively influence young people by working alongside tamariki and rangatahi.Typical duties of the role could include: coaching rangatahi through our structured programmes, participating in activities with our young people through playing sports or taking part in gym activities as well as supporting our rangatahi with their studies, teaching them life skills like cooking, art and music.Ngā pūmanawatanga ōu | What you will bringA full, clean, valid driver's licence is essential for this role and a willingness to drive Ministry vehiclesMeet the Children's Act safety checking and our vetting requirementsNew Zealand citizenship or residencyResilience, initiative and a proactive approach with a positive outlookEmpathy, patience and ability to see past what someone may be struggling withA tertiary education within psychology, social sciences, social work, sports, music, arts or teaching would be an advantageFlexibility to work different shifts - mornings, evenings, weekends and public holidaysExperience working with rangatahi and tamarikiPhysically able to keep up with 10 teenagersSound judgement with the ability to manage risk and make tough decisionsLife experience and understanding of what rangatahi may be going throughExcellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to adapt to your audienceUnderstanding and confidence in tikanga Māori and te reo Māori would be a definite advantage Nōu te rourou | What's in it for youOranga Tamariki offer a remuneration package that starts between approximately $69,312 and $78,400 (depending on your experience) which includes allowances for working shifts. Oranga Tamariki has a remuneration framework gives pay increases based on tenure. We offer significant training and professional development so that you can thrive and grow. We welcome diversity and are committed to working in an inclusive and respectful way. This is your opportunity to apply your skills and experience to the wellbeing of tamariki and rangatahi.To see all the benefits of working for Oranga Tamariki, please visit https://mahi.orangatamariki.govt.nz/working-with-us/employee-benefits/ Me pēhea te tuku tono | How to ApplyApply online with your CV and Cover Letter. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please ensure you register or login using your work email address. For reporting and transparency, it is important that all applications are submitted through our careers site, please do not email through applications and/or CVs. If you have any questions about the role, please contact Info_recruit@ot.govt.nzApplications Close midnight 7th December 2025! Applications will be reviewed and successful candidates may be invited to an interview prior to this advert closing If you are interested in any of our vacancies, please ensure that you make yourself familiar with our code of conduct as it sets out our expectations for our kaimahi and requires you to present at work free from the influences of both drugs and alcohol.

jobs.title: Investment Sales Specialist

At The Property Factory, we’re redefining how property is sold — leveraging technology, specialised systems, and a nationwide buyer network to help you achieve more sales in less time. If you’re a licensed real estate salesperson (or close to completing your licence), this is your opportunity to accelerate your career in a fast-growing, high-commission environment.About UsThe Property Factory is a specialist new build/off-the-plan agency supplying quality listings directly to both investors and first home buyers around the country. We’ve built some of the most advanced online tools available to New Zealand property buyers, enabling you — the salesperson — to deliver smarter insights, faster responses, and stronger results.We invest heavily in technology so you can spend less time chasing paperwork and more time doing what you do best: selling property and earning commission.Tasks & ResponsibilitiesAs an Investment Sales Specialist, you’ll work with engaged, finance-ready clients who are motivated to buy — either entering the market for the first time or expanding established portfolios.You will:Work with motivated, pre-qualified buyers who are ready to take actionBuild deep knowledge of each project: the developer’s track record, the location story, floor plans, numbers, and value driversAct as a trusted advisor throughout the entire buying journey, guiding clients with long-term investment insightsMaintain strong rapport and brand visibility through consistent engagementCollaborate with our network of expert partners in finance, legal, accounting, and asset planning to support your clients’ decisionsWho We’re Looking ForA proven sales overachiever, master closer, and driven self-starterSomeone willing to repeat buyers, and managing multiple decision-makersDigitally confident, comfortable following structured online systems and processesBenefitsHigher sales volume compared to traditional real estateA generous, performance-driven commission structureExtensive onboarding and supportA social, motivated team environmentRequirements (Non-Negotiable)You must hold an active New Zealand real estate salesperson license.If you are currently completing your qualification, please include this in your application — we want to hear from you.For a confidential exploratory conversation, call Dan Grima on +64 21 243 6073.

jobs.title: Team Leader
jobs.description: Our client is New Zealand's leading marquee and event hire specialist. Locally owned, they supply marquees, furniture, lighting and glassware to their customers for weddings, corporate, major events, festivals and community events - nationwide.We are currently seeking a Team Leader with marquee installation/dismantle experience and a passion for the events industry. jobs.description: Maternity leave position for terms 1&2 beginning 2nd February 2026 (start of term 1)We are looking for a kind and caring teacher aide who has experience supporting learners with high needs.Experience working with ORS funded learners would be an advantage but not essential.At Papanui Primary, we are a caring and passionate team who are dedicated to giving our tamariki a fantastic, future-focussed education, filled with challenge, inspiration and fun. We pride ourselves on being inclusive and culturally responsive, and our four school values really underpin all that we do. We are all about growing our tamariki to be kind people (Atawhai), and to see themselves as lifelong learners (Akonga). We are focussed on building our kid’s resilience so that they have the tools to face life’s challenges (Aumangea) as well as developing the mindset to always strive to achieve their personal best (Eke Panuku). We have 230 fantastic tamariki at our school.Hours will be negotiated with the successful applicant and are likely to be 25-27 hours a week, term-time only. 9am - 3pm Mon-FriThe hourly rate will be based on the Teacher Aide Pay Equity Work Matrix at the appropriate grade for the successful applicant's experience.Key skills needed include ability to:remain calm under pressureremain focussed on the needs of the childwork within a teamhave strong inter / intra personal skillshave a positive dispositiona sense of humour and a love of fun.Applications close 3rd December 2025We will aim to interview and appoint the successful applicant by 9th December. jobs.title: Heavy Diesel Truck Mechanic
jobs.description: We are a family owned and operated company with workshops in Auckland & Christchurch, we have 2 roles available for diesel mechanics with experience on trucks & trailers to work in our busy and growing Christchurch workshop specialising in fleet maintenance across multiple brands. There are roles available for both morning and evening shifts.In this varied position where you will be predominantly working on heavy vehicles such as trucks, trailers and machinery of all makes and models no two days will be the same. From day to day servicing, preventive maintenance, pre COF checks, diagnostics, parts exchange, rebuilding components and breakdowns you will be required to work independently in a confident and competent manner.We offer a competitive hourly rate and opportunities to advance your career as we grow for motivated hard working candidates.You will be passionate about your role as an diesel mechanic and conscious of the role requirements and the risks involved. You will also have excellent communication and organisation skills. You will have experience in all of the aspects listed above and a complete understanding of vehicles.You will need either a Level 4 relevant qualification or at least 3 years’ relevant work experience. The role is Monday to Friday along with rostered Saturdays (half day) with a minimum 40 hours of work.Our salary ranges from $34 p/h to $45 p/h depending on skills and experience.If you're interested in discussing this opportunity further call Anusheel 0211524774 for a confidential chat or click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV.We are an accredited NZ employer.

jobs.description: Lead with purpose…. Inspire with passion …. Make a lasting impact Imagine That Preschool is under brand new management, and we are thrilled to welcome them to the Busy Bees whanau. Are you an inspiring leader with a passion for ECE? We are looking for an extraordinary person to lead and empower our team of highly skilled teachers. As a team we are dedicated to supporting our tamariki to thrive and reach their full potential in their lifelong journey.As the Centre Manager of Busy Bees The Lakes you will have access to an excellent support network within the group, along with a Regional Manager who is committed to coaching and developing your success. Role Requirements:An inspirational leader with an innate ability to develop and lead a team to deliver best practice childcare servicesB Ed/Dip Teaching Level 7 (ECE) and current teacher registration/certificationDemonstrated leadership experience you will love to coach, mentor and inspire!Initiative, desire and passion for quality practice standards and commitment to the principles of Te WhārikiFamiliarity with the New Zealand Education Council, ERO, MOE requirements, Licensing Criteria, 2008 Regulations and Code of EthicsA comprehensive understanding of how to maintain and grow occupancy levelsWhy choose Busy Bees?Full Pay Parity, subsidised childcare, First Aid Certification and Flu vaccinationOngoing professional development and mentoringLeadership development course to grow new leadersA generous time out of ratio to enable you to coach and mentor your teamA companywide commitment to employee wellbeing with access to EAP ServicesApply now with your CV and Cover Letter and be part of our journey to deliver the best possible childcare services to our community.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.We are an Accredited EmployerWhy Work for Busy Bees?If you’re passionate about early learning, Busy Bees is the place to be. Although we are part of a global organisation, our company was founded by three families looking for better, more enriching childcare. Three decades later, we still keep the same values at heart.We know that we couldn’t do what we do without the important people in our teams. We invest in our people and work with them to build career pathways that inspire.

Our nurses and Kaiāwhina | Support Workers provide services to more than 40,000 people. And we listen to each one of them, because we genuinely care. 'A better day, every day' He kōrero whakamārama mō tēnei tūranga | About the role As an Advanced Support Worker at Access Community Health/Uru Ātea, you'll play a vital role in evaluating, training, and supporting our general support workforce. jobs.title: Accountant – Small Team, Big Impact
jobs.description: About UsWe’re MyAccountant, a growing sister company of MyRefund Ltd, helping thousands of Kiwis make sense of their tax. We’re not your typical accounting firm — no corporate suits, no unnecessary jargon, just a small, down-to-earth team that works hard, communicates clearly, and genuinely cares about helping clients get the best results. Our core focus has always been helping salary and wage earners meet their tax obligations, but we’re now expanding to support more sole traders, contractors, self-employed clients, landlords, and property investors. As we grow, we’re looking for an experienced accountant to join us in the new year and help take MyAccountant to the next level.The RoleYou’ll be working directly with your own portfolio of clients — from PAYE earners to property investors — helping them understand their tax obligations and meet IRD requirements.Your day-to-day will include:Preparing and filing IR3 and rental returns for a variety of clients.Reviewing income and expense documentation and identifying claimable deductions.Providing clear, practical tax advice in plain English.Managing client relationships — collecting information, answering questions, and ensuring compliance.Helping identify opportunities to grow our client base and streamline processes.You’ll be part of a tight-knit team that values initiative, accountability, and honest communication.What We’re Looking ForProven NZ accounting or tax return experience (minimum 2+ years preferred).Strong understanding of IRD requirements, IR3 returns, and small business accounting.Excellent attention to detail and accuracy under pressure.Confident communicator — able to build trust and explain tax clearly to everyday Kiwis.A proactive attitude and willingness to help grow the business.Xero experience an advantage (but not essential).Doesn’t need to be Chartered — just solid, proven experience and a passion for doing things right.Why Join UsBe part of a business that’s growing fast and genuinely helping Kiwis.Work alongside a team that values honesty, flexibility, and initiativeEnjoy every public holiday off — we believe work-life balance matters.We’re open to flexible work arrangements — a mix of office and home-based work can be discussed depending on the applicant.Opportunity to shape how the company grows — your input will matter.

jobs.description: Operations Support/Freight HandlerDedicated Services (CHC Based) Be part of a super smart and high performing teamMessenger Services Limited (MSL) is recognised as one of New Zealand’s best employers and is the leading On Demand courier business in New Zealand.Members of the MSL team lead the industry in innovative thinking, creating logistical outcomes that were never thought possible and constantly impress our awesome customers. jobs.title: Senior Submissions Coordinator
jobs.description: About UsAt Downer we plan, create and sustain. Downer is the leading provider of integrated services in Australia and New Zealand. This role primarily covers tenders for the South Island, excluding Tasman and Marlborough. There may also be times when you will be asked to help on tenders for other Downer regions within New Zealand. Applicants need to be based in the South Island.This role is a key part of our tendering function, providing leadership, coordination, and expertise throughout the entire Opportunity and Bid Management lifecycle. Reporting to the Bid & Opportunity Lead, Lower South, you’ll work closely with operational teams, and other stakeholders to produce winning tenders that reflect Downer’s strategic goals, values, and reputation for excellence.Primary responsibilities also include:Managing the full bid process for bids of up to $30M, including planning, writing, coordination and delivery. Supporting Bid Leads in the submission process for over $30M higher value strategic bids.Driving bid strategy, win themes, and key messaging in submissions alongside Bid Leads and operational teams.Writing and producing high quality submissions, presentations, capability statements, and award entries. Contributing to the Transport & Infrastructure bid database.Ensuring compliance with The Downer Standard and the Opportunity and Bid Management process.This role requires both strategic thinking and hands on delivery – ideal for someone who thrives in fast paced, deadline driven environment and takes pride in producing work that wins. Nga pūkenga matua | Important SkillsWe’re looking for someone with proven experience leading and delivering tenders and working collaboratively within complex, multi-stakeholder environments. You’ll be an exceptional communicator with a sharp eye for detail and a genuine passion for crafting persuasive, client focused submissions: Essential experience and skills:Demonstrated experience (ideally three or more years) in managing end-to-end tender processes within the transportation construction industry (including high level bids of up to $30M in value)Proven ability to write and develop high quality, client focused, and compelling submissions Strong understanding of procurement methods and their impact on bid strategy Collaborative approach, with the ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels High attention to detail, process driven, and organised, with a drive to deliver winning resultsAdvanced skills in Microsoft Word and use of SharePoint and MS Teams How to applyIf this sounds like an opportunity for you then register your interest at www.downercareers.co.nz reference 726540Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a pre-employment drug test and medical.Due to the fast-paced nature of Downer, our vacancy close dates may be subject to change, so don't delay and make sure you apply as soon as possible.

Key responsibilities:Perform routine maintenance services, including oil changes, lubrication, and filter replacementsConduct thorough diagnostics using modern laptop-based software and diagnostic tools to identify electrical, hydraulic, and mechanical faultsRepair and overhaul engines, transmissions, hydraulics, and electrical systemsPerform pre-delivery inspections (PDIs) and post-repair testing to ensure equipment meets manufacturer specifications and safety standardsAccurately complete job reports, service records, and parts requisitionsProvide exceptional customer service and technical advice to our clients Equipment you will work on:Agricultural/farm machinery: tractors, sprayers, defoliators, wrappers, balers, harvesters, and other similar equipmentConstruction equipment: excavators, track loaders, skid-steer loaders, wheel loaders, dozers, and backhoes. (8am - 2.30pm) Why Choose BestStart?At BestStart, we’re passionate about early childhood education and the people who make it happen. We love what we do — and we make a real difference every day.Here’s what we offer:Support from our dedicated National Support teamAccess to Whare Ako, our online learning platformProfessional development and career growth opportunitiesA $2000 referral bonus when you refer a Qualified Teacher*Your wellbeing matters to us too, with:Subsidised health insurance*Free annual flu vaccinationsConfidential counselling through EAPWellbeing programmeSick leave available from day oneAdditional week of leave for 10 years’ serviceWhat We’re Looking ForA warm, approachable communicator who thrives in a team settingHighly organised and detail-oriented, with great multitasking skillsConfident using Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook) and comfortable with IT systemsKnowledge of accounts processes and customer service best practiceA compassionate, professional attitude towards whānau and tamarikiExperience in the ECE sector is a bonus — but what matters most is your enthusiasm and ability to bring your best every day.How to Apply:If you’re ready to join a supportive, fun, and community-focused team, click Apply Now! The Role:Our client, located in Wigram, is looking for experienced Glass Labourer to join their fast-paced factory team.This is an afternoon shift role, Monday - Friday from 2:30pm-11.00pm.Starting rate - $24.00-26.00 p/h + 8% Holiday PayDuties include:Machine operating Safe manual handling of glassStrapping in productUse of mechanical/lifting aids to move glassGeneral labouring as requiredApplicants need:Own reliable transportTo follow instructions well and work safely as part of a teamTo be fit and capable of heavy lifting and labouring when necessary as well as being able to stay on your feet for an extended periodBenefits include: Immediate start - long term opportunity for the right candidateStable afternoon shift hours offering consistent income and long-term job securityAll PPE supplied by OneStaffThe chance to build a career in an established companyGreat team environmentPlease note a pre-employment Drug & Alcohol check and a Criminal history check is a part of the recruitment process.If you are interested in this role, please apply online now or contact Haley or Kate at OneStaff on (03 377 3992).

jobs.title: Chef de Partie & Casual Kitchen Porter
jobs.description: O.G.B is a bar in the heart of Christchurch that’s grounded in old-fashioned style, quality, and service. Housed in the once “Old Government Buildings”, from which it draws its name and inspiration, O.G.B. has both a quiet old-world ambiance during the day and a roaring, fiery soul at night. Home to the main O.G.B Bar, Parlour Lounge, sprawling Courtyard, the O.G.B Restaurant, and O.G.B. Barbershop.We are currently looking for an experienced full-time Chef de Partie & Casual Kitchen Porter to join our team.The CDP position requires the following:Preparing, cooking, and delivering high-quality meals for OGB and OGB Restaurant.Guaranteeing an exceptionally high standard of culinary services offered to our guests.Helping less-experienced kitchen staff during service. When appropriate or asked, help to train those staff on new cooking techniques and our in-house recipes. Duly applying cooking instructions from the Head Chef. Preparing the company’s food offerings in alignment with the company's branding, message, positioning, market, and vision.Complying with food hygiene, safety, and quality within Inkster Company venues.Coordinating with Front of House Staff to ensure that the service runs smoothly at all times, including altering dishes at guests' requests to suit various dietary requirements. Managing kitchen stock, supplies, and ordering within budget and ordering policies as directed.Ensuring that equipment and appliances are used correctly and kept in good order.Assisting with menu development and planning, in line with Gross Profit/Cost of Goods targets.Completing daily ordering with various suppliers when required. Ensuring a high level of cleanliness is maintained at all times.Carrying out your duties with honesty, integrity, and professionalism at all times.At least 2 years of experience in a commercial kitchen and a NZ Certificate in Cookery (Level 3) or higher is required to be eligible for CDP role.The Kitchen Porter position requires the following:Washing and cleaning utensils and dishes.Cleaning food preparation equipment, floors, and other kitchen tools or areas. Cleaning up spillages when they occur. Disposing of rubbish. Ensuring proper use of chemical/cleaning products and ensuring they are stored appropriately. Following all hygiene and Health and Safety regulations within the kitchen Food Preparation. Assisting the Chef in the preparation and cooking of food, as required. Following directions toward portion control, cooking standards, and wastage. Maintaining a positive and motivated work ethic in the kitchen at all times. Handling, sorting, storing, and distributing food items. Following instructions from the Chef or nominee, any other duties the employer may reasonably require. Assisting in stock management and logistics where required. Assisting management in carrying out logistics and other tasks.

jobs.title: Senior Beauty Therapist / Skin Specialist
jobs.description: Hello, welcome to Caci!At Caci we’re focused and passionate on delivering results to our customers and developing our people. We’re award-winning and are leaders in the skin and appearance industry and have been delivering great results and skin confidence to our customers for 30 years! Exciting opportunity to be part of an established team at Caci Riccarton! – are you ready to work with NZ’s most iconic skin and appearance company?! If you are looking for an exciting career with further development opportunities – we’d love to meet you!About the role Our Beauty Therapists are passionate, fast paced and focused on delivering amazing results for our customers on their journey to skin confidence!The role will involve:· Working with customers to deliver skin treatments best suited to their concerns· Managing the customers journey through their Treatment Plan – including cross-selling treatments where recommended (for example, appearance medicine or injectables)· Maintaining a tight-knit relationship with the clinic team to ensure we all achieve our targets while meeting our high-performing team values· Always doing right by our customers and delivering the best for the brand· Generating and facilitating customer enquiriesWe are looking for someone who has plenty of experience! The role will be part time with two late nights and a alternate Saturday mornings, but opportunity to increase hours from January 2026Our training academy: Centre of Excellence (based in Auckland) offers advanced learning pathways with a mix of face to face and online, including, personal development, technical skills, and further education. Along with a base hourly rate, you will have access to treatments, products at special staff prices and commission! To further your professional development, we host an annual Conference with an exciting Caci Awards Night, development days and in-clinic training.Are you for us?You’ll need to be customer focused, with a can-do attitude, the ability to collaborate, work as a team and be passionate about delivering results for our customers!You’ll carefully consider all possible outcomes before taking action, focus on the task at hand, look towards long term outcomes when making decisions. You’ll have exceptional customer service and have an absolutely passion for skin care and the knowledge to match! Caci stars are motivated by achievement, resilient, adaptable with high emotional intelligence, accountable and efficient with their time management and organisational skills.You will have:· Minimum of 1 years training course e.g. CIBTAC, CIDESCO, ITEC, London City & Guilds Dip (Advanced) and 3 years industry training· Punctual and flexible approach to work· Passion for skin care and the knowledge to back it up· Experience in Laser hair removal, chemical peels and advanced skin treatments· A desire to grow and be part of a high performing team· Happy to get involved in promotional activity· Interest in skin, beauty, cosmetic and cosmetic medicine· Great presentation and someone who loves to shine!How to apply! If you think you’ve got what it takes, or you really want to join us we would love to hear from you. While it would be awesome if you possessed expert skin knowledge, it’s your ambition, drive and experience that we are after. We can teach you the rest as you grow and develop with the role. Hit Apply now and submit your cover letter and cv! Or email Kirsten at riccarton.private@caci.co.nz We can't wait to hear from you 😊 If this sounds like the role for you, hit the apply now button, we can’t wait to hear from you!

jobs.title: IT Project Manager
jobs.description: Are you an experienced IT Project Manager looking for your next challenge? We are seeking a highly skilled contractor to lead a transformative 12-month project based in Christchurch. This is an exciting opportunity to work on a high-impact initiative that will drive significant improvements in operational efficiency and service delivery. About the role: This role involves leading a major redesign project aimed at addressing inefficiencies within a critical infrastructure environment. You will be responsible for managing all aspects of the project lifecycle, including initiation, planning, execution, monitoring, and closure. The project requires someone with strong analytical skills, governance expertise, and the ability to manage risks and engage senior stakeholders effectively. This is an onsite role requiring presence at the Christchurch campus five days per week. Free parking is available on a first-come, first-served basis.Key Responsibilities:Lead projects using established frameworks to ensure delivery within scope, timeframes, and budget constraints.Identify and mitigate risks while escalating issues through appropriate channels when necessary.Build strong relationships with internal teams and external stakeholders to ensure smooth project execution.Provide regular updates to senior leadership and ensure adherence to governance processes.Ensure seamless operational handover upon project completion.Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives within the project management framework.What we're looking for:We’re seeking a results-driven professional who can bring expertise in IT project management along with strong leadership skills to deliver this critical initiative successfully.Required Skills & Experience:Minimum 10 years of industry experience (e.g., Engineering, IT, Construction), including 5 years in project management roles.Advanced knowledge of project management methodologies (PMBOK preferred).Strong analytical and diagnostic skills with proven ability in root cause analysis and structured decision-making processes.Proficiency in governance frameworks and project artefacts tailored to scale and complexity.Expertise in risk identification, assessment, tracking, escalation, and resolution through appropriate channels.Exceptional upward management skills to engage senior stakeholders effectively and facilitate strategic decision-making processes.Desirable Skills & Attributes:Postgraduate university degree or equivalent experience.PMP accreditation or similar professional project management qualification.Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills with demonstrated influencing capabilities.Strong commercial acumen with a focus on creating value while managing costs effectively.Ability to communicate clearly across diverse audiences while building long-term relationships with stakeholders.Resilience under pressure with a proactive approach to problem-solving and continuous improvement initiatives.How to Apply:If you meet the above criteria and are ready to take on this exciting challenge, please submit your CV via the link or email alexandra.gosling@robertwalters.co.nzThis is your chance to make a meaningful impact on a high-profile project that will shape the future of operations in New Zealand’s skies!

jobs.title: Support Worker
jobs.description: HealthCare NZ is a leading provider of in-home and community-based health, rehabilitation, nursing, mental health and disability support. Our aim is to support people to live as independently as possible, for as long as possible and to maintain their independence regardless of age, injury, illness or disability. Are you looking to make a real difference in your community? We are currently looking for candidates in Christchurch North to work on Wednesday,Thursday, Friday, and every weekend between 7:00 AM and 9:00 PM. What does a Support Worker do? As part of a wider team, you will assist our clients to live as independently as possible, within their homes and community. You will help our clients to achieve their goals and reach their potential, through both practical and emotional support. Responsibilities can be varied and you will follow a care plan, which may include some or all of the below: Meal preparation Community outings and integration Giving medication Personal cares (showering, toileting etc) Home management What's in it for you? We are committed to our employees and are proud to employ and train the best people in all areas of our organisation. We provide a career pathway for staff through the learning and development framework to achieve NZQA qualifications, which are fully funded. You will earn between $23.97 - $29.68 per hour, depending on experience and qualification. This is an opportunity to join New Zealand's largest community healthcare provider with the potential to gain experience in a variety of disciplines including aged care, disability, mental health and rehabilitation. Whilst you will be part of a large national organisation, you will join a dedicated and close-knit team. What are we looking for? Attitude - a desire to help and support others, achieving excellence in all you do! Previous healthcare or care-giving experience would be advantageous Excellent communication skills Healthcare qualifications are advantageous Most positions require a full NZ drivers' licence and your own reliable transport At HealthCare New Zealand, we are passionate about creating an inclusive workplace that promotes and values diversity and reflects the communities we serve. If you are passionate about what you do and are interested in exploring a rewarding career with us, then we would love to hear from you! Mēnā he tangata ngākaunui ana koe ki te tautoko i ngā momo tāngata, tēnā pea, kei konei he tūranga mōu.Tukua mai tō tono ki Healthcare NZ! You must possess the right to work in New Zealand and a willingness to undergo police vetting and additional checks in order to be considered for this position.

jobs.title: Qualified Teacher
jobs.description: Many Paths Walked TogetherWe’re looking for a passionate and dedicated Qualified and Certificated Teacher to join our energetic and tight-knit team at BestStart Salisbury Street.Our beautifully renovated centre sits in the heart of Christchurch city, the perfect base for local excursions that enrich our localised curriculum. Our vision, “Many Paths Walked Together,” reflects our belief in shared learning journeys where every child and teacher can thrive.Why Choose BestStart?At BestStart, we’re proud to be a progressive and adaptable leader in ECE, where our Kaiako are recognised for the positive difference they make every day. We’ve opted into full pay parity, ensuring your dedication is valued and rewarded.We offer:A supportive teacher mentoring and induction programme Learning through Whare Ako, our online learning platform Career growth and leadership opportunities Discounted childcare $2,000 bonus when you refer a qualified teacher* Your wellbeing matters:Subsidised health insurance* Free annual flu vaccinations Access to EAP counselling Comprehensive wellbeing programme Sick leave available from day one One week’s additional leave after 10 years of serviceAbout the RoleWe’re seeking a caring, creative, and flexible Preschool/Nursery Teacher to nurture and inspire our tamariki in a newly renovated, engaging, and inclusive learning environment.This is a permanent part-time position (30 hours per week, Monday–Friday). You’ll have the opportunity to gain experience across all age groups, supporting where you’re needed most, so flexibility and adaptability are key.You’ll plan and implement age-appropriate learning experiences that promote social, emotional, physical, and cognitive development. Whether you’re newly qualified or experienced, if you’re passionate about making a difference, we’d love to hear from you!What You’ll Bring:BEd/Dip Teaching (ECE, Level 7) and current teacher certification A strong understanding of child-led curriculum and extending learning Good knowledge of ECE regulations, Te Whāriki, and compliance expectations A commitment to Te Tiriti o Waitangi in everyday practice Passion, creativity, and dedication to delivering quality educationJoin Our Team! Click Apply Now to become part of a centre that values collaboration, growth, and the joy of teaching. We can’t wait to welcome you to BestStart Salisbury Street!

jobs.title: Accounts Administrator (Fixed Term, Part Time)
jobs.description: Fixed Term, Part Time Position - 20 hours per weekAbout UsShakti Mats began in 2014 in a tent and has since grown into a fast-moving global e-commerce brand, best known for our flagship product: The Shakti Acupressure Mat. We're proudly values-led, with deep commitments to ethical production, charity, and creating meaningful employment in both India and New Zealand.Our mission is simple but powerful: Ignite the Good — in ourselves, our communities, and the world.We operate with a values-led culture that prioritises education, personal growth, and positive global impact. Our 25+ person team is united by a shared drive to grow sustainably, lead with integrity, and make a lasting difference in people’s lives. With ambitious plans on the horizon, the best is yet to come…The RoleWe’re looking for a proactive and detail-oriented Accounts Administrator to join our Finance Team on a part time, fixed term basis until the end of March 2026. This role may have the option to extend, based on project requirements. In this role, you’ll be responsible for accurately maintaining financial records and supporting our day-to-day accounting operations. Reporting directly to the Financial Controller, you’ll ensure the integrity of our accounting data while providing timely, professional support to internal and external stakeholders.You’ll work across accounts receivable, accounts payable, reconciliations, and general finance administration. This role is perfect for someone who thrives in a fast-moving environment, values accuracy and structure, and enjoys being part of a collaborative, purpose-driven team.Key AccountabilitiesDaily Administration & SupportManage accounts inbox and answer finance queries efficiently;Reconcile Xero transactions which include shopify transactions, AMZ, Upwork, etc.Identify and investigate discrepancies.Maintain up-to-date financial records and ensure completeness of supporting documents.Support daily accounting and finance admin tasks as needed;Support internal control and process improvement initiatives Accounts receivable and accounts payable Record accounts receivable and accounts payable accurately.Liaise with relevant parties to ensure accounts receivable are paid on time.Liaise with suppliers and the management accountant to ensure timely invoice and payment processing.Coordinate with other departments to ensure receipts are provided for purchases using company cards.Month-end supportAssist with expense allocations, shipment cost entries and month-end close tasks;Support preparation of management reports and finance workpapers as needed.Reporting and Legal compliance Assist in preparing tax returns for Shakti entities;Assist in GST Audit;Assist with ad hoc finance projects / reports.Who You Are2+ years’ experience in a similar Accounts Assistant or Administrator role.Proficiency in Xero.Tertiary qualification in Accounting or Business (desirable but not essential).High level of accuracy, organisation, and attention to detail.Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.Able to work independently and collaboratively within a team.Proactive, adaptable, and solutions-focused approach.Comfortable working in a fast-paced, evolving environment.Our CultureAt Shakti Mats, our culture is values-led, collaborative, and fuelled by growth - personally, collectively, and globally. We embrace challenges, celebrate progress, and support each other to show up fully and do work that matters.Our values are grouped into three core themes that shape how we think, act, and grow together:Sharpen UpLearn & growGet comfortable with the uncomfortableCare for the CollectiveGot your backSay it straightShow upEnjoy the RideEmbrace playBe your full selfThese values aren't just words on the wall — they guide how we show up every day and shape our shared experience at Shakti.How Our Values Show Up✈️ India Roots & Renewal: After 3 years at Shakti, every team member is flown to India to visit our charity partners, the school we’ve built, and our production partners.📚 Annual learning & development budget to sharpen your skills.🌍 Work & travel remotely for up to 6 weeks per year for permanent employees.❤️ A tangible connection to ethical production, charitable giving, and global well-being.🧘 Flexible working schedules, including WFH 1 day/week from Jan–Oct.👶 Additional parental leave for both primary and secondary caregivers.🤝 Quarterly team sessions that connect, energise, and refocus.We’re not just building a business — we’re growing people, creating impact, and having fun along the way.

jobs.title: Business Development Manager

We provide specialist finance solutions for investment, business, bridging and property development projects. With a dynamic, get-it-done attitude, we look for ways to make deals work for all involved.We’re seeking an autonomous, relationship-focused Business Development Manager in Christchurch to expand our origination footprint across Canterbury.The RoleYou’ll represent Fico Finance in your region – identifying, engaging and converting new lending opportunities through your network of brokers, advisors, developers and professional referrers. jobs.title: Swim Coach
jobs.description: About the roleV-dragon Swim Teaching and Coaching Service Ltd is seeking an experienced and enthusiastic Swim Coach to join our Dragon Swim Club team in Christchurch Central, Canterbury. This is a part-time opportunity to work with swimmers of all ages and skill levels, helping them to develop their swimming abilities in a supportive and nurturing environment.What you'll be doingDelivering high-quality swim lessons to groups of swimmers, tailoring your approach to meet the individual needs of each studentAssisting swimmers with technique development, stroke correction, and building their confidence in the waterMaintaining accurate records of swimmer progress and providing regular feedback to both students and parentsEnsuring a safe and inclusive environment for all swimmers, adhering to health and safety protocolsCollaborating with the wider V-dragon team to continuously improve the quality of our programsPotentially some additional hours for admin tasks outside of coaching hours.What we're looking forMinimum of 2 years' experience as a swim coach or instructor, with a proven track record of delivering effective swimming lessonsStrong knowledge of swimming techniques, water safety, and swimmer developmentExcellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage and motivate swimmers of all agesA genuine passion for swimming and a commitment to providing a positive and enriching experience for all studentsRelevant swim coaching qualifications or certifications (e.g., Ausswim TOCS)Availability to work during peak swim lesson times, including evenings and weekendsWorking HoursOur training hours are Monday to Friday 4.00-8.00pm, Saturday 9.00-11.00am and 3.30-6.30pm for primary school terms, School holiday hours are 2.00-8.00pm Monday to Friday. Your hours will be around this schedule subject to demand.What we offerAt V-dragon, we are committed to creating a supportive and rewarding work environment for our team. As a Swim Coach, you'll have the opportunity to develop your skills, collaborate with a talented group of professionals, and make a meaningful impact on the lives of our swimmers. We offer competitive pay, ongoing training and development, and the chance to be part of a growing and dynamic organisation.About usV-dragon is a leading provider of swimming lessons and aquatic education in Christchurch. Our mission is to inspire a love of swimming and help individuals of all ages and abilities to achieve their swimming goals. With state-of-the-art facilities and a team of dedicated and experienced instructors, we are committed to delivering an exceptional experience for our students.If you're passionate about swimming and excited to join our team, we'd love to hear from you. jobs.title: Intensive Support Worker

jobs.description: About UsAt Downer we plan, create and sustain. Downer is the leading provider of integrated services in Australia and New Zealand. By sharing our capabilities and insights across our regions we achieve the best technical solutions for our customers’ challenges, and for our communities.Job DescriptionKo te take ka parekareka e koe ki te mahi ki kōnei | Why you will enjoy working hereDowner is committed to delivering excellence by ensuring our people have the environment and the means to be successful. other skin abnormalities.Analysing images to identify potential signs of melanoma and other skin cancersCollaborating with our team of medical professionals to provide comprehensive patient assessments and recommend appropriate treatment or follow-up actionsChecking blood results and histology results and contacting patients to arrange further management where appropriate.Maintaining accurate and detailed patient records, ensuring compliance with all relevant medical and privacy regulationsParticipating in ongoing professional development and training to stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in medical photo-imaging and melanoma detectionWhat we are looking forA RN who can work independently, is in good health and with great people, communication and computer skillsCurrent NZ Registered Nurse with APCPrevious experience working in a dermatology clinic, wound care clinics, or dermoscopy skills would be desirable but not essential.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to accurately interpret medical images and identify potential areas of concern ( following training and backed up by dermatologist supervision).Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to provide clear and compassionate patient care,A commitment to maintaining the highest standards of patient confidentiality and data security.In addition to a competitive salary, we offer a range of benefits, including:Training and qualifications in melanography (skin cancer detection using dermoscopy)Access to state-of-the-art Fotofinder medical imaging equipment and technologiesA collaborative and collegial team environment that is supportive and enjoyable.No after hours work.

jobs.title: Experienced Chef
jobs.description: About the role:We are looking for a Chef de partie to join our vibrant team. We run three stalls in the beautiful Riverside Market. We have positions for an experienced chef in all three stalls. Role type: Permanent full-time Hours: 25 hours minimum We are currently only seeking candidates who possess full working rights within New Zealand . Each dish is topped with a colorful assortment of vegetables, and a perfectly marinated soft-boiled egg. The signature Tonkotsu ramen is a fan favourite, but with a range of vegan and vegetarian options, there’s a bowl to suit all dietary requirements and lifestyles.Corner Grill: Experience an open kitchen where you will work your magic over breakfast or lunch. Customers pick a dish from our menu, or their favourite cuts from our butchery cabinet. We cook everything exactly how they like it, right in front of the customers! For the best seat in the market, sit at the chef’s table.Roti Joe's:Our latest venture! Roti Joe's specialises in Hawker rolls (comes in a variety of mouth watering choices such as roasted hoisin duck, sticky roast pork belly, Korean beef and more!) and Rice bowls, inspired by the sensational flavors and aromas of Asian cuisine. We also have street food inspired entrees and salad bowls, never a boring day with such a dynamic menu and fantastic location!Job Responsibilities: Prepare, craft and execute our diverse menu with skill, distinction and passion. Engage and converse with our customers! You will be working in an open kitchen/stall environment, having an outgoing and engaging personality would be a huge plusThere will be quite a bit of interaction between you and the customers, therefore we are looking for someone who possess a high level of presentation and self maintenance.Supervising kitchen operations with a focus on: Maintaining a seamless workflow, an energetic and collaborative work culture.Lead and partake in collaborative efforts to craft enticing menus that cater to a diverse array of tastes and dietary preferences.Guiding, overseeing, and nurturing kitchen staff to maintain the utmost standards in culinary expertise and presentation finesse.Ensuring strict adherence to food safety and sanitation standards in all kitchen activities.Overseeing and upholding the functionality of kitchen equipment, taking proactive measures to initiate repairs or replacements as needed.Constantly embarking on culinary adventures to discover novel cooking techniques, embrace emerging trends, and experiment with vibrant ingredients, all aimed at elevating our creations to new heights. Requirements2+ years of proven experience as a Chef A deep passion for culinary arts and a keen understanding of various cooking techniques.Strong leadership skills with the ability to inspire and guide the kitchen team.Great communication skills with proficient EnglishCreativity and the ability to conceptualise and execute new and exciting dishes.In-depth knowledge of food safety and sanitation regulations.Excellent organisational and time management skills to handle a fast-paced kitchen environment.Flexibility to work during evenings, weekends, and holidays as requiredPerks and Benefits:Work in an inclusive and vibrant team!Located in Riverside Market- a 7-day indoor farmers' market selling local produce, meat, seafood, baked goods, coffee and moreCraft and execute using diverse, top quality and fresh ingredientsOpportunities for professional growth and advancement, chance to take enhanced responsibilities. Find out more:If you find this role interesting, please hit the “Quick Apply” button or send your cover letter and resume to Madlen at cluckcluckslurp@gmail.comIf you wanted to find out more about us at Cluck Cluck Slurp, Corner Grill and ROTI JOE's, please see below!Website: https://cluckcluckslurp.nz/https://cornergrill.co.nz/Social media:https://www.facebook.com/CluckCluckSlurp/https://www.instagram.com/cluckcluckchch

Customers appreciate that we listen first, document our solutions, deliver on time and provide certainty of project delivery in which we pride ourselves on.We are open to talking to people with an architectural background.The RoleWe are seeking a graduate or experienced Draftsman to join our team at Richards Consulting. The position could be located in Auckland or Christchurch.In this role, you will be responsible for producing high-quality Revit and CAD structural drawings for a variety of engineering projects. The role involves working with (rather than for) our engineers to ensure we produce an appropriate design that be built easily and cost effectively. The approach we take is that both the Revit technician and the engineer work together to produce the design. What You'll DoDevelop 2D and 3D Revit drawingsCollaborate with the engineering team to ensure designs are accurately represented in RevitMaintain project documentation and drawing registersContinuously improve Revit standards and workflows to drive efficiencyDo You HaveStrong proficiency in RevitAbility and willingness to contribute to developing our systems to create the optimum solution for clientsAbility to work effectively under pressure to meet budgets and deadlinesUnderstanding of construction principles and methodsA degree or diploma in Engineering, Architecture or a related fieldStrong attention to detail and problem-solving skillsEffective communication skills to liaise with clients and stakeholders and team (engineers)Familiarity with industry standards and relevant software (e.g. Autodesk, MS Office)We Offer· Competitive salary and formal bonus programme· Formal regular development sessions and support to grow· Social team environmentApply Now:Please email your CV, Cover Letter to Amelia at amelia@rcengineers.co.nz or call (03) 347 1624 for further information.You must have the right to work in NZ to be eligible to apply.

jobs.title: All Rounder - Campervan Rentals
jobs.description: All-Rounder – Campervan Rentals$55,000 base salary + Kiwisaver + Monthly KPI Bonus & Sales Commission: OTE $60,000-$65,000Christchurch – Immediate StartTravellers Autobarn is a global campervan rental company — born in Australia, now rolling across New Zealand, the U.S., and Japan.Our Christchurch branch is looking for a hands-on, practical, and friendly All-Rounder to help get campervans hire-ready and deliver unforgettable service to our travellers.At Travellers Autobarn, there are no egos and no “that’s not my job” attitude — everyone from management to new starters pitches in wherever needed. switched-on, and dependable — people trust you to get things done.Handy and confident with tools — you enjoy fixing things, improving setups, and keeping equipment in top shape.Approachable and clear when talking with customers.Organised and tidy — you take pride in doing things properly.A genuine team player — happy to jump in wherever help is needed.What You’ll DoCarry out campervan safety checks, interior repairs, and minor refurbishments.Quality-check the work of our contract cleaners to make sure vans are spotless.Greet customers, manage check-ins/check-outs, and process rental contracts.Provide handovers and trip briefings to excited road-trippers.Upsell add-ons like insurance, camping gear, and more.Support the Branch Manager in keeping the branch running smoothly.What You BringMust-Haves:A valid driver’s licence and clean driving record.Practical hands-on skills — confident with tools, repairs, and problem-solving.Strong people skills — warm, clear, and customer-focused.Good attention to detail and efficient work style.The legal right to work in New Zealand.Nice-to-Haves:Experience in customer service, tourism, or vehicle rental.Familiarity with Microsoft Office or rental systems.A love for travel, vans, or the camping lifestyle.What You’ll Get$55,000 base salary + Kiwisaver.Monthly KPI bonus – $500 (at-risk).Monthly Sales commission on add-ons and insurance (Uncapped).Free annual campervan hire in NZ, Australia, USA, or Japan.Ongoing training and development.A fun, laid-back team culture and career pathways in a global travel brand.What This Isn’tNot for desk-bound types — you’ll be on your feet, in the yard, and in the vans.Not for clock-watchers — days move fast, and you’ll need to keep pace.Not for passengers — we’re looking for someone who takes ownership and gets stuck in.How to ApplyClick Apply Now and upload your CV with a short cover letter addressed to Sam Cundall, Operations Manager.Tell us:Why this role grabbed your attention.The most satisfying hands-on job or fix-up you’ve ever done.Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.Learn more: www.travellers-autobarn.co.nzFollow us on Instagram & Facebook: @travellersautobarnLocation: 238 Roydvale Avenue, Burnside, ChristchurchOpening hours: Monday–Friday 9am–5pm, Saturday 9am–1pmYou must be available to work Saturdays, and Sunday is your jobs.title: Meat Process Workers
jobs.description: Company DescriptionSouth Pacific Meats provides the world with New Zealand’s finest premium beef and lamb products for all to experience and enjoy. We serve over 80 markets globally, supported by an operation which includes twelve processing plants throughout New Zealand.SPM sources top-quality, sustainable, grass-fed, New Zealand Beef and Lamb products from our network of farmer suppliers. We are 100% New Zealand-owned and operated and a proud member of the Talley’s Group; New Zealand’s leading exporter of meat, dairy, seafood, and vegetable products.Job DescriptionSPM Malvern is gearing up for our busy season and are putting together motivated teams at our modern processing plant near Christchurch to help get NZ sheep and beef from our backyard to customers plates. No prior experience necessary as training is provided, you simply need to be keen for some hands-on work as part of a motivated crew!Reliable and hard working with a positive attitude, you know if a job's worth doing, it's worth doing right. Plus, you'll like to keep fit and healthy and seek a workplace where it's all go.We're building teams to fill a wide range of roles. You could be out in the stockyards or in the cold-stores, a butcher, boner, machine operator or labourer - wherever works best. We'll bring you up to speed right there on the job, so you can learn while you earn!We are seeking applicants for a variety of processing roles for our night shift:Sunday - Thursday 3:30pm - 12:00amSuccessful applicants must:always put safety firstbe keen to learn new skillsbe able to work on a night shift roster including weekendsenjoy working in a diverse teamIf you are already experienced in knife handling or meat processing, that’s great we need talented people like you and we invite you to apply as wellNo prior experience necessary as training is provided, you simply need to be keen for some hands-on work as part of a motivated crew!This is a Night-Shift roleAdditional InformationAll applicants must have the right to work in New Zealand To ensure a safe workplace, South Pacific Meats conducts pre-employment medical checks and drug screening. Applicants must be eligible to work in New Zealand.If you’re interested in joining a fast paced, challenging but enjoyable workplace, where you get to meet great people and work alongside your mates then please apply online through this ad.

jobs.title: Facilities Technician - Plumber
jobs.description: About UsAt Downer we plan, create and sustain. Downer is the leading provider of integrated services in Australia and New Zealand. We are currently seeking a Certified Plumber to join our high performing team in building maintenance at Christchurch Women’s Prison and Rolleston. This is a great opportunity for someone who is looking to expand their knowledge in the Facilities sector. There are a lot of opportunities to grow within the team, and you will be exposed to different responsibilities that will further enhance your skills in Plumbing. Prisons are sometimes challenging work environments, so you must be confident and able to conduct yourself professionally at all times. You will also understand the 24/7 nature of a prison site and be prepared to sometimes manage jobs and situations after hours.While undertaking general maintenance and repairs of the facilities your duties will also include;Dealing with unexpected events and providing direction to work for teamsLooking for opportunities for continuous improvement and providing solutionsThe undertaking of scheduled maintenance, first response, and reactive activities in order to mitigate disruption to the customer’s activitiesA hands-on role in completing work safely and meeting our client and the needs of the contractWe are looking for a team player who is willing to go the extra mile for our customer. You will be focused on quality delivery, have an eye for detail and be able to coordinate other trades as required to get a job fully completed. You will be a problem solver and keep the plumbing services at site in good working order.Nga pūkenga matua | Important SkillsYou will be an ambitious and resilient Plumber and will bring with you;Experience working as a NZ Certified Plumber or a Tradesman PlumberAble to work unsupervised while providing safe and quality workA full class one Driver’s license and ability to drive a manualPhysically fit and agile, able to carry out regular bending and lifting tasksMore than anything, you’ll bring a strong work ethic, a positive attitude, and a commitment to delivering high-quality outcomes for our clients.Ko wai mātou | Our Organisation At Downer, we plan, create, and sustain essential public services across Australia and New Zealand. From hospitals to data centres and defence partnerships, we manage critical infrastructure that keeps communities thriving.Ko te take ka parekareka e koe ki te mahi ki kōnei | Why you will enjoy working hereWe’re proud of our high-performance culture and commitment to diversity, offering:Training and development to support and diversify your career. With 30% of vacancies filled internally you’ll find real opportunities to advance your career.Perks@Downer: healthcare discounts, great savings on retail purchases, car purchases and much more.Employee Assistance Program: professional support for you and your family when you need it most.You want your work to matter and so do we. With over 26,000 people across Australia, New Zealand and the Pacific, our team is made up of individuals with unique perspectives, backgrounds, and ideas.We know that diversity makes us stronger and we actively celebrate it through our commitment to inclusion and belonging.We’re committed to building a team that reflects the diverse communities we serve and we welcome people of all ages, genders, sexual orientations, cultures, abilities, and lived experiences. We especially encourage applications from those whose voices have traditionally been underrepresented in our industry, including women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, Māori and Pasifika Peoples, veterans, people with disability, and neurodivergent individuals. jobs.title: Elder Abuse Response Clinician
jobs.description: Are you a registered nurse or registered social worker with experience working with older people? Age Concern Canterbury promotes the well-being, rights and dignity for Canterbury’s older people and has a proud history of supporting people in a variety of ways. This role requires managing a case load while responding to reports of Elder Abuse/Neglect covering the Canterbury region. You will be joining a passionate and skilled team so a collaborative mindset is a must. You will receive regular clinical supervision, a flexible work environment, and pay equity, with a commitment to ongoing education and training. We are looking for someone who: Is passionate about the safety of older people, Has experience working with clients/whānau in the community setting, Demonstrates sound clinical and risk assessment skills, Has a strong understanding of professional boundaries and ethics, Has a proven ability to manage a caseload, prioritise and triage referrals (you will work within a team but need to be able to work autonomously), Is confident in networking with health and community agencies who support older people – previous experience working with older people is preferred, Has a knowledge of and commitment to Te Tiriti o Waitangi principles and working with kaumātua, kuia, and whānau, Has a good knowledge of services/agencies that support older people throughout Canterbury, Has a willingness to work collaboratively with our wider team, who provide a range of services for older people, Has sound computer skills, Has a full driver’s licence. If you want to work in a friendly supportive team, we warmly invite you to apply for this position. The role is 0.6 FTE (24 hours per week). While you will largely working from our office in Papanui, there may be occasions where some travel around Canterbury will be required. Please apply via Zeil with a cover letter and CV. For more information or to discuss this opportunity, contact Greta Bond at ceo@ageconcerncan.org.nz or call on 021 145 3681.
